story:
Hello out there, film fans! 

Campaign Pitch from YouTube Land
We’ve been working hard to produce a series of parody films that will let you see some of your favorite iconic characters in media pit themselves against the Joker himself inside the walls of the Asylum!


This little idea all started with Lucky Mangione sitting on a couch watching The Dark Knight for the bajillionth time.  As the interrogation room scene played out on the screen in front of him again, he casually thought, “What would happen if Joker was questioned by all these other random people instead of Batman?”  The conversation that came afterwards led to him meeting with JC Kingsley over in Charlotte, North Carolina, to discuss what it might take to make something like that happen.


Lucky also got in touch with Heath Simms and Kiefer Diaz to come in as sound and camera on the project and lined up a sweet spot to film out in Belmont, North Carolina.  The Old Stone Steakhouse is connected to the old Belmont Jailhouse, and they let us film there repeatedly watching us go in and out of their back rooms in a myriad of costumes constantly.  JC got in touch with his Brother-in-law, Kaden Suon, to come in and help act out some parts, and Lucky brought in Jennifer Smith on Makeup and Eric Helda as an extra security guard type in the Asylum. 


It really looked like things were going to come together, and we all began to discuss getting these episodes together and getting them out there to you guys!  Well, we got a cool trailer done already that we want you to see right here:
Trailer HERE!

What We Need & What You Get

If you like what you saw there, then stay tuned for the series debut on January 22nd, 2015!  The first episode will go out that Thursday, and we plan to be able to release one per week EVERY THURSDAY for a six episode run.  And we got that far on our own and think you can see our progress as we went!  We’re all independent film-makers and actors in the Charlotte area, and we want to see our film community continue to grow even as lawmakers decide to restrict the tax programs that support the larger business end of things.  We also LOVE the Carolina communities that get behind the arts and help them thrive, and we believe that things like this indy project help people like us make our own Hollywood right here at home to support our home environment in ways that support our dreams and goals, too!  All while supporting local businesses that feel the same way and provide equipment and filming locations to our efforts!

The Impact

We got six of these in the can already to show you that we mean business as film-makers.  We didn’t want to be just another one of those campaigns that puts together a trailer and then never gets past that point even though we asked for all your money.  We did it.  We made six, and we wanna keep making six as long as you keep laughing at ‘em!  We WOULD like some help though, so if you can spare a few bucks towards us hopeful film enthusiasts to get some of that cool stuff over there on the right side of the screen, we’ll cut backflips and bother people on the street with songs of praise in your name!  Sometimes… On Saturdays… past two a.m.  No, seriously, we’d love to be able to keep doing these and even make some other series lines for you folks in the future, but we all gotta eat, too.  Sometimes, we spent a full work week for free typing, editing, filming while some of us worked full time jobs at the same time.  We’d love to know that you thought this stuff was cool enough to keep going, and that you didn’t mind out of all those hits on YouTube to spare a five dollar bill here or spring for some of those cool extras that we’re offering as perks to go along with your at home enjoyment of our show!

Other Ways You Can Help

We’ll keep you updated with cool social media content, photography stills, posters, playing cards, vid clips of behind the scenes stuff, and all kinds of other cool stuff as we go along, so we promise it won’t get boring!  Come along for the ride and if it’s past the January 22nd release date as you read this, go here to check out some episodes and find the link to the new support campaign!
LuckyKings YouTube Page - Subscribe Now!


Our Equipment List Current and Desired:


Hey, folks!
JC Kingsley here! 

As Director/Producer/Writer of the “ASYLUM: the lost interrogations” series, I’m constantly looking for and listening to ways we can upgrade our production and release continuously more refined material for your viewing pleasure.  I just wanted to take a second and show you guys what we’ve used so far and what the results were of using that equipment.

Also, we’ve started an Indiegogo Campaign to help raise funds for further equipment needs and other needs going forward, and I wanted to let you folks know what the money would be used for should you choose to help us out in this endeavor.

Here’s what we’ve used so far:

Camera - Black Magic 2.5 (Prologue and Episode 1) and Canon 5D (Episode 2)
Lighting – Standard LED block light of about 5 inches by 3.5 inches for overhead swinging interrogation room light  (Prologue and Episode 1); Two 500 Watt Fresnel Lights, One 1K Watt Fresnel Light, 250 Watt Bare Bulb Incandescent.  (Episode 2)
Sound – Zoom H4N (http://www.guitarcenter.com/Zoom-H4N-Portable-Digital-Recorder-106869043-i1712724.gc?country=us&currency=usd&source=4WWRWXGP&gclid=CMuksqyMnsMCFdEdgQodcwEADA&kwid=productads-plaid^65674144602-sku^106869043@ADL4GC-adType^PLA-device^c-adid^46499340282) ; Rode NTG Shotgun Mic Bundle (http://www.austinbazaar.com/rode-ntg2-multi-powered-shotgun-microphone-rod-ntg2-combo-dlx.html?utm_source=google-pads&utm_medium=cpc&utm_content=ROD-NTG2-COMBO-DLX&channel5=true&coupon=yes&gclid=CIX908eMnsMCFdgKgQodtj0AmQ) (Prologue and Episode 1);  Zoom H4N Field Recorder, Sennheiser ME 65 and ME 66 shotgun mics (Episode 2).
Location – Old Stone Steakhouse in Belmont, NC has the original town jailhouse attached to the back end of it. 

They use the lower part of the jail for restaurant storage and equipment like freezers and such, but the top floor of the jail is pretty much empty.  Lucky Mangione contacted them and asked them about it, and they let us use the place for credits listed in the films.  Can’t beat that with a stick.  It’s a little bit limited on Electrical outlets, but we haven’t run into any problems yet on it.  We even made one of our Indiegogo perks a dinner at the steakhouse with a special appearance by Joker and Commissioner Gordon, so check it out if you’re interested.  It comes with a tour of the filming location after dinner!
Editing Software – We’ve been using Pinnacle Studio 15 for our editing needs.  It’s one of the most overlooked editing programs out there due to market saturation in school by Adobe/Apple, and it costs a tenth of what the Final Cut or Premiere programs will run you. 
Soundtrack – We’ve had a lot of luck pulling our soundtrack material from YouTube’s royalty free music selection.  Jingle Punks has been a big help to us in making this sound impressive through the soundtrack, and we highly recommend fellow film-makers to check them out!
Sound FX – FreeSounds.org has been where most of our Sound FX have been located, and what we didn’t use from there, we were grabbing off of the Pinnacle Software.
Make Up – Nimbus Creations has been used in the Prologue Episode as well as the Deathstroke Episode for the scars on the Joker.  We also have used home-made gelatin make-up prosthetics from Carolyn Kingsley’s stash of makeup goodies and find those to be a little better than most store bought prosthetics, and they’re CHEAP!  So, there’s that.  You can find out how to make your own gelatin based prosthetics on YouTube and have fun with them!
Costumes – We have all been responsible for putting together our own costumes on this project and all guest spots on the show come to set with their own costumes as well.  That way the guests get a credit for acting on the program but also for costuming as well! 

Here’s what we’d like to upgrade to in the future with your help:

Camera – We’re pretty happy with the DSLR (Canon 5D and Canon 70D) for this series and think the Black Magic may be overkill for the most part.  The Black Magic also exports as RAW files with no color correction in place.  They expect you to use DaVinci Resolve to color correct the footage after importing, but any color correction program can really be used for it.  What we DO want to do for our camera crew in supply them with a few extra nuances like having a Focus Puller on set to assist in getting scenes put together for our Director of Photography.  A Focus Puller just sets stops (marking a place on the camera focus ahead of time) on the camera’s focus to let the guy shooting the scene know exactly where the focal points of a scene are so that it’s not left to guess work on the fly.  Basically, a guy comes in and has the actors stand in their spots through the scene, and then he adjusts the focus to each position that they’re standing and marks those spots off using zip ties and a marker or an actual piece of equipment like this:
http://www.bhphotovideo.com/bnh/controller/home?O=&sku=1049634&gclid=CI6DuoWLnsMCFQ_l7AodFTkAIg&Q=&is=REG&A=details
As you can see, this is a minimal purchase to increase our quality by a LOT!  It’s only going to cost around 50 bucks of the 3,500 we’re asking.
You can read more about the idea here:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Focus_puller

Lighting and Sound: 
We’ve found our solution for Lighting and Sound by pulling in a pro, Mr. Willie Kimbrough.  Willie costs us a little bit (and by industry standards, I mean a LITTLE bit), but he’s worth his weight in gold when it comes to lighting a shot and pulling all the extra sound we need.  Basically, some of the money collected will go to paying the 100 bucks it costs to get him out there, and that 100 bucks gets us pro light and sound, so we think you’ll agree that it’s well warranted.  We’ve got four more episodes to get filmed so that’s at least 400 of the 3,500 we’re asking via the campaign.

Here’s a bit about what Willie uses on our set for you other film-makers out there:
Two 500watt fresnel lights, one 1k fresnel light, Zoom H4n field recorder, Sennheiser ME 65 and ME 66 shotgun mics, 250 watt bare bulb incandesant bulb.

Editing Software:
We’d like to upgrade our old Pinnacle 15 to Pinnacle’s newest release @ 18.  You can find out more about the software here:
http://www.pinnaclesys.com/publicsite/us/home/
We also will begin using Final Cut Pro on our material every other episode as we bring in Ernest Eich to work with us.  He will be editing every other episode with it, so there will be a good comparison of the two programs for people to see and judge for themselves.  We may end up choosing one or the other, but we wanted to let folks see the difference in the two if all the equipment used on a shoot was the same.  The upgrade on Pinnacle costs around 120 of the 3,500 we’re asking.
Soundtracking: 
We’re stoked that it’s been so easy to find music online for this project, but we have heard some of these tunes on other shows as well.  That being said, Charlotte has some great local artists in all different genres of music, and we’d love to give them a shot at being on the show as well.  We don’t want them to necessarily pony up their song for free though.  We’d like to pay at least 50 per song used to the local artists that help us out with their music, so if you guys can help out in that regard that would be great!  Typically we look for a song at the beginning creds, ending creds and sometimes something in the middle to keep things lively.  So with four episodes left to go, that’s between 400-600 dollars in music money for local artist support!

Guest spots and Acting Talent:
We’d like to be able to pay each guest spot at least 35 dollars for the four hours it takes us to shoot one of these episodes.  With four episodes left this season, that’s 140 buckaroos of the 3500.  No sweat right?

Make-up and Costuming Fund:
We’ve been ponying up all the money for supplies on costumes and make-up on our own, so any help there would be appreciated.  We also want to have a little on-hand to grab props that would help round out an outfit for our guests, so that they can stay focused on making the costume look the best that they can.  Things like a big Mallet for Harley, or a microphone prop for Oprah, etc.  We’re looking for around 300 dollars of the fund to go towards those needs.

Additional costs:
We’re doing our best to publicize the series, market it, distribute it and all those trimmin’s, so that, of course, costs us as well.  In January, we spent about 200 on Printed Goods, Online Ads, and additional video shots to make the campaign info and other adverts, so we’re looking at that as the baseline expense per month on that kind of thing.  We should wrap the first season’s film dates in March/April so we’re looking for 200-400 dollars to carry us through on that end.



All together, our costs look like this:
Camera – 50 bucks for a focus puller, and 50 bucks for the camera Folks (150 total)
Lighting/Sound – Willie costs 100 bucks
Soundtracking – Local artist fund of 400-600 dollars
Guest Spots – 140 dollars for the remaining episodes in this season
Makeup and Costume Props – 300 Dollars
Editing Software Upgrade – 120 Dollars
Editing Team Pay – 50 per (100 dollars)
Printed Goods and other Marketing – 200-400 dollars

Total costs listed :  1,510 – 1,910 for remaining episodes in Season 1
Remaining Costs:  1990 – 1590 for next season’s costs

3,500 total

We include this info for film-makers to learn from as well as for our investors to know what their money will be used for in this production.
As always, let us know if there are ever any questions or if you spot something we could do better!
story_txt:
Hello
out there, film fans!  Campaign Pitch from YouTube Land
We’ve been working hard to produce a series of parody films that will let you
see some of your favorite iconic characters in media pit themselves against the
Joker himself inside the walls of the Asylum!

This little idea all started with Lucky Mangione sitting on a couch watching
The Dark Knight for the bajillionth time. 
As the interrogation room scene played out on the screen in front of him
again, he casually thought, “What would happen if Joker was questioned by all
these other random people instead of Batman?” 
The conversation that came afterwards led to him meeting with JC
Kingsley over in Charlotte, North Carolina, to discuss what it might take to
make something like that happen.

Lucky also got in touch with Heath Simms and Kiefer Diaz to come in as sound
and camera on the project and lined up a sweet spot to film out in Belmont,
North Carolina.  The Old Stone Steakhouse
is connected to the old Belmont Jailhouse, and they let us film there
repeatedly watching us go in and out of their back rooms in a myriad of
costumes constantly.  JC got in touch
with his Brother-in-law, Kaden Suon, to come in and help act out some parts,
and Lucky brought in Jennifer Smith on Makeup and Eric Helda as an extra
security guard type in the Asylum.  

It really looked like things were going to come together, and we all began to
discuss getting these episodes together and getting them out there to you
guys!  Well, we got a cool trailer done
already that we want you to see right here:
Trailer HERE! What We Need & What You Get If
you like what you saw there, then stay tuned for the series debut on January 22nd,
2015!  The first episode will go out that
Thursday, and we plan to be able to release one per week EVERY THURSDAY for a
six episode run.  And we got that far on
our own and think you can see our progress as we went!  We’re all independent film-makers and actors
in the Charlotte area, and we want to see our film community continue to grow
even as lawmakers decide to restrict the tax programs that support the larger
business end of things.  We also LOVE the
Carolina communities that get behind the arts and help them thrive, and we
believe that things like this indy project help people like us make our own
Hollywood right here at home to support our home environment in ways that
support our dreams and goals, too!  All
while supporting local businesses that feel the same way and provide equipment
and filming locations to our efforts!The Impact 
We
got six of these in the can already to show you that we mean business as
film-makers.  We didn’t want to be just
another one of those campaigns that puts together a trailer and then never gets
past that point even though we asked for all your money.  We did it. 
We made six, and we wanna keep making six as long as you keep laughing
at ‘em!  We WOULD like some help though,
so if you can spare a few bucks towards us hopeful film enthusiasts to get some
of that cool stuff over there on the right side of the screen, we’ll cut
backflips and bother people on the street with songs of praise in your
name!  Sometimes… On Saturdays… past two
a.m.  No, seriously, we’d love to be able
to keep doing these and even make some other series lines for you folks in the
future, but we all gotta eat, too. 
Sometimes, we spent a full work week for free typing, editing, filming
while some of us worked full time jobs at the same time.  We’d love to know that you thought this stuff
was cool enough to keep going, and that you didn’t mind out of all those hits
on YouTube to spare a five dollar bill here or spring for some of those cool
extras that we’re offering as perks to go along with your at home enjoyment of
our show!Other Ways You Can Help 
We’ll
keep you updated with cool social media content, photography stills, posters,
playing cards, vid clips of behind the scenes stuff, and all kinds of other
cool stuff as we go along, so we promise it won’t get boring!  Come along for the ride and if it’s past the
January 22nd release date as you read this, go here to check out
some episodes and find the link to the new support campaign!
LuckyKings YouTube Page - Subscribe Now!Our Equipment List Current and Desired:

story:
An inept inventor, a fairy princess and a former megalomaniac trapped in the body of a toy raccoon rent an apartment downtown...

Ed's R Us started online March 2, 2008 and has been producing comics almost every day since. Ed's R Us is a generally optimistic roommate comedy (think of a cross between Friends and Futurama).

Morning People, the first Ed's R Us collection collects the strips from the Start to November 1, 2008. After a small miscalculation causes a wayward asteroid destroys their former home, Ed (cuddly mad scientist), Rocco (even cuddlier megalomaniac) and Kanna (I wouldn't cuddle if you know what's good for you) move into an apartment in downtown Raincity.

Hilarity ensues.

So why should you care?

Basically the economy sucks and a the best way to combat it is to do what you love. I LOVE this comic and I want nothing more than to do it as a living, and the way to do that is to print a collection. Unfortunately, I'm a freelance and even though my freelance work pays the bills, It's not quite enough to print the first book. That's where you come in...

This campaign is all about pre-selling the book. That's the main focus and for a mere $25 you can get a copy of the book and a sketch on the inside of the cover of whatever character you want. If you really want to help out I have a lot of other donation levels that you can contribute to and win my love!

I need to get about $5000 to print the books, that includes delivery and taxes. I can cover a little of it, and if this campaign comes up short, I will find the rest of the money somehow.

 

So head on over to Ed's R Us and see where we are and where we're going and where we've been. Help bring this ray of sunshine to the world and start making life a little bit better for the readers.

Unlockables!

$500 - Browncoat video update... UNLOCKED!

$1000 - Hobbit Video update

$1500 - Thank you animation from Ed

$2000 - Pirate video update

$2500 - The artists get's MANSCAPED

$3000- Thank you animation from Rocco

$3500 - Steampunk video update

$4000 - "Naked" Video Update

$4500 - Thank you animation from Kanna

$5000- "Even worse than Naked" video update.

$6000 - ???

story:
THIS campaign is all about getting the SECOND STARDROP GRAPHIC NOVEL into print!


For those of you who have no idea who I am. . .  I'm a Self-Published Cartoonist!  I've been writing and drawing my own comic books for nearly 20 years!

My best known title is a fantasy adventure series called, "Thieves & Kings". (You can check it out on my website).

STARDROP is my new project!  (well, sort of new. The first graphic novel launched in 2007 and has become the gem of my studio). Stardrop is about a princess from outer space who has come to live in a small town here on Earth.

 


The new book is going to be 200 pages, digest sized like the first one, and it will continue Princess Ashelle's adventures, picking up right where the first book left off!

Here's the best part; all the writing and drawing is DONE!  It's a real project.  It's not vaporware or maybeware.

You can see what you'll be getting over on my website where Stardrop is regularly posted.  The 2nd Graphic Novel, however, will include a TON of new material which is not on the site.  -I don't like to put a book out which doesn't offer something unique.

"A Place to Hang My Spacesuit"  (That's the title of the Second Volume), is going to be one of those fun books for a Sunday afternoon.  It contains all of the charm Stardrop carries; the humor, friendship, and adventure.  Everything from making snow-angles in the park to pitched blaster battles in the hanger bay.  Stardrop covers a surprising amount of territory.

And that's what Second Volumes are all about; After having established the premise and the characters in the First Volume, a second book likes to stretch its story legs!  To see what it can do! 




Jenny Mysterious will also make another (several) appearances.  The time-traveling ninja girl (whose own series is in production right now), is given a lot more room to move in this volume.

 

Want a copy?  Me too!  How can you help?

 

 

Anybody can help by donating money in any amount. That would be enormously appreciated.  (You can either be mentioned in the thank-you section of the book or you can specify to be anonymous.)

 

Simply by declaring that you will buy a copy will also help!  If 420 people all decide to pre-order one copy, the whole print run will be paid for.  The books are $10 plus shipping.  (And if you live in my town, then I can easily just hand your copy to you in person!  Look at that very first option in the perks chart!)

I've created a lot of different packages with different perks.  Please go through them and see which suit your taste.  When you select one, you'll be asked for your payment info and a shipping/contact address.

Thank-You!

Retailers of book stores and comic shops!

Want to stock Stardrop on your shelves and support this campaign?  That's wonderful!  I've put together basic packages of 5 and 10 copies.  You get a 40% discount and I pay shipping.  Please see the side bar perks section under the retailer options.  (I apologize; Indiegogo puts all perk packages in descending order based on cost, so the two I designed for you are mixed in with the others.  Just look for the label, "RETAIL")

 

$30 - 5 copies, Free Ship (Retailers only - copies signed)

$60 - 10 copies, Free Ship (Retailers only - copies signed)

You can also order copies of the FIRST volume of Stardrop.  Simply specify in your order using the above two options.

 

 

 

 

The hard numbers. . .

Here's the project cost breakdown; where those dollars will be going:


$4200 - Printing cost and taxes on 2000 copies. Printing is done in Canada.

$2376 - Rough estimate for shipping costs of individual and retail copies pre-ordered during this campaign.

$274 - Indiegogo takes 4%.

$6850 -- TOTAL

 

Please note: none of the money raised during this campaign will end up in my pocket; it all goes toward printing and shipping.

How do I pay myself for the hundreds of hours invested in writing and drawing this book? Why, with all the left over copies! I will endeavor to sell these over the next few years on my own. For me, the end of this campaign will represent the beginning of the next stage of my work, but that can't happen without a book in hand. This campaign will make that possible!

 

Thank-you for your support!
story_txt:
THIS campaign is all about getting the SECOND STARDROP GRAPHIC NOVEL into print!

For those of you who have no idea who I am. . .  I'm a Self-Published Cartoonist!  I've been writing and drawing my own comic books for nearly 20 years!My best known title is a fantasy adventure series called, "Thieves & Kings". (You can check it out on my website).STARDROP is my new project!  (well, sort of new. The first graphic novel launched in 2007 and has become the gem of my studio). Stardrop is about a princess from outer space who has come to live in a small town here on Earth.

 

The new book is going to be 200 pages, digest sized like the first one, and it will continue Princess Ashelle's adventures, picking up right where the first book left off!Here's the best part; all the writing and drawing is DONE!  It's a real project.  It's not vaporware or maybeware.
You can see what you'll be getting over on my website where Stardrop is regularly posted.  The 2nd Graphic Novel, however, will include a TON of new material which is not on the site.  -I don't like to put a book out which doesn't offer something unique.

"A Place to Hang My Spacesuit"  (That's the title of the Second Volume), is going to be one of those fun books for a Sunday afternoon.  It contains all of the charm Stardrop carries; the humor, friendship, and adventure.  Everything from making snow-angles in the park to pitched blaster battles in the hanger bay.  Stardrop covers a surprising amount of territory.And that's what Second Volumes are all about; After having established the premise and the characters in the First Volume, a second book likes to stretch its story legs!  To see what it can do! 

Jenny Mysterious will also make another (several) appearances.  The time-traveling ninja girl (whose own series is in production right now), is given a lot more room to move in this volume.

 
Want a copy?  Me too!  How can you help?
 

 
Anybody can help by donating money in any amount. That would be enormously appreciated.  (You can either be mentioned in the thank-you section of the book or you can specify to be anonymous.)
 
Simply by declaring that you will buy a copy will also help!  If 420 people all decide to pre-order one copy, the whole print run will be paid for.  The books are $10 plus shipping.  (And if you live in my town, then I can easily just hand your copy to you in person!  Look at that very first option in the perks chart!)
I've created a lot of different packages with different perks.  Please go through them and see which suit your taste.  When you select one, you'll be asked for your payment info and a shipping/contact address.
Thank-You!


Retailers of book stores and comic shops!

Want to stock Stardrop on your shelves and support this campaign?  That's wonderful!  I've put together basic packages of 5 and 10 copies.  You get a 40% discount and I pay shipping.  Please see the side bar perks section under the retailer options.  (I apologize; Indiegogo puts all perk packages in descending order based on cost, so the two I designed for you are mixed in with the others.  Just look for the label, "RETAIL")

$4200 - Printing cost and taxes on 2000 copies. Printing is done in Canada.$2376 - Rough estimate for shipping costs of individual and retail copies pre-ordered during this campaign.$274 - Indiegogo takes 4%.$6850 -- TOTAL
 
Please note: none of the money raised during this campaign will end up in my pocket; it all goes toward printing and shipping.
How do I pay myself for the hundreds of hours invested in writing and drawing this book? Why, with all the left over copies! I will endeavor to sell these over the next few years on my own. For me, the end of this campaign will represent the beginning of the next stage of my work, but that can't happen without a book in hand. This campaign will make that possible!
 
Thank-you for your support!

story:
Our friend Aaron has dreamed up a concept for a claymation series that he would like to pitch to MTV, Adult Swim, Cartoon Network, etc.  I've read the treatment and heard the verbal pitch...and I think it's brilliant!  Without giving too much away I will say that it's about a classic mythical creature...that drinks, smokes, chases women, eats celebrities, and generally reeks havoc on American pop culture.  It's hilarious.  

Aaron has been experimenting with stop-motion animation since he was a young child.  One of his earliest attempts was around middle school age, when he animated a toilet transform into a robot!  He begin working seriously again with the claymation technique in 2008, during his production of a documentary called Fatty (which you can see the results of in the video above). 

Recently Aaron was laid off from his job in LA and moved off-the-grid with a friend, so that he could concentrate full-time on this project.  His plan is to create a short sample segment from the show, to use in order to get funding to create a full pilot episode. The thing about claymation is that in order to create even 30 seconds of animation, it takes hours upon hours to complete.  And that's just the animated aspect.  Before even getting to that stage Aaron must build the set, the props, and sculpt the characters.  

He needs about $1000-$2000 to complete this project.  So far he's built half of the set, created some props (see the "gallery" for pics) and has started sculpting one of the characters.  The scene consists of two characters sitting around a campfire next to the fuselage of a crashed airplane containing marijuana plants.  Your contributions would go towards materials including fabric, wood, expensive clay, glue, and more.  In addition your money would contribute towards Aaron's basic living expenses while he completes this endeavor.  To even get to the point of pitching this to a major network, Aaron must have something which visually demostrates his concept, plus show that he is capable of handling the animation aspect of the job.  That's why he needs to create this scene and ultimately a full-length pilot episode.  

Over the past decade Aaron has produced a string of short and full-length films and documentaries for other people.  Now it's his time to shine.  So please help us make this a reality and help get some Wachholz-vision out into the universe!!  

And if you can't help monetarily, you can still contribute to this cause by helping us get the word out about this fundraising campaign via your Facebook and Twitter accounts.  

Thank you!!  

Ryan Shaffer, friend

story:
#### UPDATE ####

We currently have 12 days to go until the pre-order closes, so on the 5th August we'll be sending the final pages of The Editors off to Ka-Blam to have the books printed up.

All contributors will get their eBook version of The Editors #1 no later that 10th August, and we hope to be sending out physical copies and bundles no later than mid September.

So far we've had a great deal of support and press from readers and comic news sites around the world and we really appreciate it.

We'll still be ordering the comics regardless of how much we raise on the pre-orders but every pre-order/donation/share does help.

In return for you guys being so supportive of our project we're going to hold a small contest for the last 12 days of the pre-order.

--- With three prizes: ---

a) FREE STUFF FOR SUPPORTERS

FOUR people will receive a free eBook version of The Editors issue #1 - no need to pre-order, or donate. The winners of these copies of the comic, will be the first FOUR people to reblog our tumblr post which goes up today (see our tumblr blog here: ( http://t-iii.tumblr.com/ ), retweet our post on twitter that will go up today marked with #TheEditors ( http://twitter.com/t_iii ), or share our Editors promo posts on facebook ( http://www.facebook.com/aKe.FERA )

We'll also give away ONE free print issue of The Editors to the first person who manages to get a famous comic creator/fan to plug The Editors on their twitter or tumblr account. Please don't make a nuisance of yourself or upset anyone, just ask politely and see if they will. When we say famous we mean actors, comedians, authors, or even artists/writers working for Marvel or DC etc. with verified twitter accounts. If they do, please send a link to their post and account to: press@angelk.at and if possible to your posts that convinced them to.

b) RANDOM CHANCE AT EXTRA LOOT FOR FUNDERS

If we manage to get more than $100 in funding/pre-orders, we'll choose a funder at random to receive an extra item - this item will be the framed newspaper front page of that person as either a hero or villain in their moment of victory or defeat (winners choice). This is normally reserved for funders of the $150 "Headliner" bundle, and this one won't count toward the availability restriction on that bundle.

Even if someone orders the "Headliner" bundle or "Editor in Chief" bundles, there will only ever be THREE of these ever made at most, and each of them will be unique to the individual that purchases and/or wins them.

 

 

What is The Editors?

The Editors is an ongoing comic book series from artist Davy Shirley (the webcomic Fera) and writer Paul Burr. The Editors are a clandestine group who are controlling the lives of the world's various heroes and villains, until a two bit crook wakes up during one of their procedures.

Follow his adventures as he attempts to unravel the mystery that lies at the heart of The Editors and at the same time stop himself from becoming just another cape.

 

Who?

The Editors is a new project from angelKat Entertainment - with the creator of the popular LGBT romance/adventure webcomic "Fera", Davy Shirley, and the talented writer of dark fiction, Paul Burr.

With the success of Fera, and with a new writing team working on various new projects at angelKat Entertainment, between us we have experience of producing both print and digital comics since 2009, as well as having writing experience both in fiction, and in articles for national magazines.

angelKat Entertainment and all of our creators are based in the United Kingdom.

 

What are you funding?

Any money raised from these pre-orders, will go towards the first print run of issue #1 of The Editors. Issue #1 will be a 24 page long, full colour, comic book, professionally printed by Ka-Blam in the USA. This will partially fund the print run, and the rest will be coming out of our pockets. We will be printing enough books to cover all pre-orders and stock for conventions/online sales. We hope to have the first books in our hands by July 2012 (and hopefully available at London Film and Comic Con).

If we manage to surpass the goal on IndieGoGo, we'll also be using the extra funding to promote the new comic to national/international press, at events, and possibly for printing of future titles - such as the already scripted sequel, a short story compilation, and the new instalment of Fera (issue #3).

>> In fact, for each instance where the funding amount increases by $100 over the goal amount of $500, we'll throw in extra goodies for donators - including extra artwork, and other existing and future titles from angelKat Entertainment (depending on perk tier). <<

 

NOTE FOR FUNDERS OUTSIDE OF THE UNITED KINGDOM: Please add $5 to your order on top of the minimum for the bundle that you wish to receive (at least). This is to allow for postage and packaging. Thank you.

 

What do you get?

The main purpose of this IndieGoGo campaign is a pre-order for our new comic, but to show our appreciation for your interest, and because services like IndieGoGo make it simpler to make a reality... We are including extra perks, bundle deals if you will, depending on how much you wish to spend. You can get anything from a PDF for your favourite eReader, to a whole host of extras including cameos, commissioned artwork, limited edition comics, and even your very own super hero story.

For every bundle/perk tier that you go up, you include every item from the lower tiers. Take a look at the list on the right hand side for more details and choose what bundle you feel is right for you. And it's completely up to you how much you pay - it can be anything so long as it's above the minimum for your chosen bundle.

 

Other ways you can help?

Not everyone is able to contribute, and that's perfectly okay. But what if you still want to help this project? Well, there are a few ways;

  • Tell others about The Editors - share the link to this campaign on your blog, website, facebook, google+, twitter, tumblr - anywhere you can. Email your favourite comic news site about how excited you are about this new comic.
  • Use the IndieGoGo share tools - they're at the top of this section, and they make sharing this project with others so easy.

And for those who can't contribute financially, we will be holding "contests" periodically - giving away PDF's and copies of The Editors issue #1 to those who share the link and help to promote the campaign. These will generally be in the form of "first 3 people to retweet/share" or randomly selected from those who have shared posts regarding The Editors pre-order.

If you want a chance of winning any of these prizes, you'll have to follow/like us on Facebook, tumblr, and Twitter:

  • Twitter - t_iii (use hashtag - #TheEditors )
  • Twitter - pauladamburr (use hashtag - #TheEditors )
  • Facebook - angelKat Entertainment
  • Facebook - Fera
  • Tumblr - t-iii (use tag - #TheEditors )

 

Can we help even after the book is in print?

Yes, you can, and we'd welcome it greatly. Once printed, the comics will be distributed to comic shops via IndyPlanet (a part of of printers Ka-Blam). It would be great if you guys could encourage your local comic shop to order The Editors issue #1 and help us reach a new audience in your home town.

We already have our flagship title Fera on sale (both issue #1 and issue #2) via IndyPlanet!

story:
• Hello everyone.... name's Isaac Vargas and I want to share my story, I'm schizophrenic and let me tell you that people like us can suffer very much just because of the discrimination.... after  being hospitalized for months I started wondering: what can I do with my life? I realized that I love telling stories and I also love drawing so I decided to raise funds  to self-publish my own comics, that has been my dream since I was a child and I hope that you like the result
  • Greetings from Mexico



What We Need & What You Get

I need 5000 dollars to publish the first volume of my series called "Upir Vrah: The Vampire Legacy" for printing and distribution. I hope I can print a few hundreds of books with the funds I raise.... If you fund me I have some ideas about perks like signed sketches, commissions and the book itself and if I don't reach my entire goal I still gonna print as many books as I can


The Impact

I just want to make a contribution to the world of comics and show people that we schizophrenic folks are talented and can be very hard working, I think mental illness should not be a obstacle for people to make dreams come true

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help fund the project but want to support it you can share it and spread the word. You can share by clicking on the social media buttons and sharing it with your friends.

story:
The Humor Times: 'The World's Funniest News Source!'

The Humor Times® (already nationally trademarked) is a monthly publication, featuring the "news in cartoons" – a humorous review of the latest in national and international events and politics.

It features editorial cartoons by some of the finest artists in the business, organized by subject and strung together into a storyline by "quips" above each one. This way of presenting the great work of political cartoonists makes for a "comic book" feel, and summarizes each issue in such a way that even folks who are unfamiliar with the particular subject being covered can follow along, and get some real news along with the humor!

The magazine also features non-political cartoons, humor columns, "fake news," and many other fun features. It is based in Sacramento, California.

The Humor Times appeals to people who like to follow politics and the news, and enjoy our irreverant take on it. It might be described as a print version of Comedy Central's "The Daily Show," although it was founded in 1991, long before that show debuted -- so maybe the show is actually a TV version of the Humor Times!

It attracts a similar audience to the Daily Show, yet most of that national demographic doesn't yet know it exists.

And that is why we are raising funds: for a national marketing campaign for the publication, to raise awareness, and grow our subscription base.

While many of those who have discovered the Humor Times love it and subscribe to it, we have never had the budget to help it to grow nationally. We've been struggling financially through the years, and the time has come to expand.

The Humor Times is a publication that we believe -- as do our loyal readers -- has a lot of merit. It helps people to laugh, rather than cry, about our current national politics, and so gives them fortitude to keep going, to believe things can and will get better.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to fundraise $20,000. You can help America smile again, by helping the Humor Times!

We're offering different perks for different levels of support. Please check them out, and give what you can.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share this page on Twitter, Facebook, by email, or however else you want. 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Check out our website at www.humortimes.com, and share it as well. We get a lot of subscriptions from people discovering us through the site.
  • Buy a subscription! It's cheaper than donating, but still helps us. The cheapest one is getting the magazine in downloadable form, rather than a physical copy. That is only $9.95 a year!

Thank you!

Help us to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign! Share this page on Twitter, Facebook, by email, or however else you want. 
Use the Indiegogo share tools!
Check out our website at www.humortimes.com, and share it as well. We get a lot of subscriptions from people discovering us through the site.
Buy a subscription! It's cheaper than donating, but still helps us. The cheapest one is getting the magazine in downloadable form, rather than a physical copy. That is only $9.95 a year!


Thank you!

story:
My name is Isabeau & unfortunately, I’m funny.

Instead of going to grad school like the rest of my peers, I have this irrational desire to be on NBC's Saturday Night Live. 

But first, I have to make a name for myself in America's birthplace of comedy: Chicago. Making people guffaw in Chicago is more likely to catch Mr. Lorne Michaels' eye than making people laugh in the small farm town of Miami, FL.

Even a small donation of just 100 cents helps make my dream a reality.

Besides, when's the last time you saw a 'fro on SNL?

Do it for the 'fro. Donate below.

Even a small donation of just 100 cents helps make my dream a reality.
Besides, when's the last time you saw a 'fro on SNL?
Do it for the 'fro. Donate below.

story:
Scenes from a Cafe Counter

My name is Alex, I am a former barista and an avid cafe patron. I'm also a teacher and cartoonist based of out Massachusetts, and I need your help.


This collection came about following dozens of conversations with former baristas and cafe lovers. Collectively, our time at cafes brewed up positive anecdotes and always encourage self-reflection.

Scenes from a Cafe Counter is an effort to collect some of these anecdotes in the form of comics, art, and writing.

By donating to this cause, you are helping bring a dozen unique and carefully percolated stories and artwork to print. Some of the contributors in this collection are premiering their work for the first time, while others are veterans of anthology story telling, but all of them are itching to have their work seen so that we can rally behind the unsung heroes of our mornings--cafes.

The Contributors:
Carl Antonowicz
Allison Bannister
Phil Barcio
Jon Chad
Alex Chautin
Jessikah Chautin
Sam Dangerous
Michele Desabrais
Hans Gerhke
Kibble
Jenny McKeon
Cobalt-Robin
Jeanie Smith
Imani

The Breakdown:
To keep this plain and simple, this is what we need to cover the costs of the collection.

Printing: $750
Stamp: $30
Stickers: $40-50
Mailing: $100
Cushion/funding fees: $100

Contributors are receiving copies of the book so that they may read, give, or sell as they see fit, so it is important that we reach our goal to put their hard work in their hands.

Each physical copy is made to look like a to-go coffee cup. The back of the books are for personalizing -- to put your name and favorite coffee order. To make the coffee cup more realistic, each book will be covered with a corrugated paper "hot-sleeve" with the book's logo hand-stamped on it. Deluxe copies will include a specially designed bookmark and a vinyl sticker to use on your own to-go cups -- so you can take Scenes from a Cafe Counter with you anywhere! Please see the Perks section for more details.

These books are designed to be nice coffee table toppers. They will be perfect bound and 50 pages in length, and printing will be fulfilled by Docucopies who do amazing work.

*Any money over our initial goal will be used to print more books, which will in turn give more copies to the contributors*

story:
About Top Secret Press

My name is John Daniel Taylor IV, the owner of Top Secret Press. For over seven years, I have been creating, writing and selling comics with the help of the best talented artists around. Top Secret Press is a fully established publishing house that publishes comics by other talented creators, as well as Playing Cards, Prints, Magazines and books.

  • Top Secret Press has a number of great comics planned in the future! With the success of this Indiegogo Project, we hope to be able to move forward on a great number of these projects while giving our stockroom a little space! We're hoping You guys can help us make this happen!


 

​'You don't know me, Man!'

Most likely the majority of you have no idea about Top Secret Press (and then some of you might!) or who we are, so I thought we'd give you a FREE PREVIEW some of our comics in the form of a 100 Page Giant Digital Edition with a great cover by Rafael Lanhellas! 

FUNDED!  Thanks for Your Support!



Perks 

We have picked a goal, and Funding will be Flexible! Even if we don't reach the goal, we can deliver the Perks!

  • All the Perks are In Stock ~ there will be very little waiting for delivery
  • PDF's will be shipped as soon as Indiegogo funds clear the bank (about two weeks after Funding ends). Physical copies will be mailed four weeks after the end of Indiegogo.
  • The wait time for products will be short and sweet!



How you can help!

We are expanding! That means we need more space and resources to create exciting new comics. The goal of this Indiegogo is to eliminate overstock & to make room for new projects.

  • Overstock hurts because it is money sitting; always a problem with publishing comics
  • Here's a chance for YOU to get a Great Perk for up to 40% our normal price!



About Add Ons...

There are quite a few. Actually more Add Ons than Perks. Alternate Covers, Signed Covers Special Limited Covers; much more are located in the Add on Section! There were just too many to put in the normal Perks. If there is something we missed, or something you think we should be added ~ please email us and ask!



Risks & Challenges

Top Secret Press has delivered every one of their over 40+ crowd-funded projects! Including Playing Cards, Sketch Books, Comics, Buttons, Postcards, Magazines, Artwork and more. Every day we reach out to new fans all over the world!
 

The only challenge is deciding which Perk to pledge! All items listed are ready to sell, they just need to be packed and mailed. We have a proven track record of sales for over seven years, so you can go for it, and know you WILL get your items!

It's all up to you guys now ~ Thanks!

John Daniel Taylor IV
Editor in Chief / Owner
Top Secret Press

WEB SITE: www.topsecretpress.com
FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/topsecretpress
TWITTER: https://twitter.com/TSPCMX 
INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/tspcmx
TUMBLR: http://topsecretpress.tumblr.com

Keep scrolling, there's more!


Playing Card Decks

TSP has created a variety of Playing Card Decks from their comics as well as some of the Top Artists in the field of art! Two decks that stand out are the Sci Fi Angel Series & The Claudio Aboy Elite Series. These decks are quality ~ Artwork by Artist Claudio Aboy (Heavy Metal Magazine, Official Star Wars). We also created a beautiful deck with Artist Atilio Gambedotti. Atilio has been in the field of art for over twenty years ~ currently, he has a Kickstarter campaign going for his series The 4Girlfriends. 

Some of these decks are Add Ons while other come in a set of 6.



Trading Card Sets

TSP made two Limited Trading Card series ~ one in 2014; one in 2019. Both sets highlight covers from various Top Secret Press Comic Series. These Trading Card Sets are Add Ons.

story:
Sonya Devereaux IndieGoGo Extended With Stretch Goals!

Thank you!  Everyone here on the Starring Sonya Devereaux team is incredibly thankful for the support you've given us on this project!  We've received dozens of requests for cool Sonya Devereaux stretch goal items and one really stood out to us.  Half of those requests were for a Starring Sonya Devereaux promotional trading card featuring the likeness of superstar cosplay model Cara Nicole (AZ Powergirl).  So we did just that!

We are officially extending the Starring Sonya Devereaux IndieGoGo an additional 30 days in order to deliver an exclusive Cara Nicole cosplay Violet Vixen trading card!  If we can reach $3500 for the project every print level backer will receive this cool collectible! 

AND...if that wasn't exciting enough...it’s only the first card.  We can unlock others that feature other incredible cosplay models and surprise guests from the Sonya Devereaux comics!  Please help us to reach these new goals and open new thank you gifts for our incredible supporters!

 

HOLLYWOOD'S 306TH BEST ACTRESS & SCREAM QUEEN IS BACK!

Hollywood’s 306th best actress is self-absorbed “Scream Queen” Sonya Devereaux, whose career consists entirely of ultra-low budget, straight to DVD movies – the kind you find in the bargain bin or playing at 2am on cable TV. 

Each 30-page, full color issue of the critically-acclaimed Starring Sonya Devereaux contains a stand-alone B-movie that Sonya has made, framed by an event in Sonya’s life that leads to the movie’s viewing. In a unique twist, real life actors loan their likenesses to co-star with Sonya in these hilarious, ridiculous, fictitious films!

 

 

STARRING SONYA DEVEREAUX: THE COMPLETE MOVIE COLLECTION VOLUME 1 collects the first four laugh-out-loud issues:

 

“Naked Are the Damned 2” - Sonya plays a farm girl forced to take a job as a nude model when an evil corporation forecloses on her family’s home, then battles the CEO’s zombie henchmen with the help of a voodoo queen.

“Vampire Academy 4” - The Elizabeth Bathory Academy for Girls is one of the country's foremost schools for prepping teenaged vampiresses for un-life out in the world.  The final exam is to hunt a victim, but Elsbeth (Sonya) has fallen in love with her target and must decide if saving her BAE is worth destroying her GPA. 

“Debutante Desperado” - Actors Meredith Salenger (Star Wars: The Clone Wars, Dream A Little Dream, Journey of Natty Gann), Scott Whyte (Mighty Ducks, videogames Call of Duty 4, Batman: Arkham Underworld, Final Fantasy), and writer/director Eric Spudic (Creepies, Dead Clowns, Killers By Nature) co-star with Sonya in a low budget, hilarious western in which a stagecoach carrying rich college girls to Spring Break gets hijacked. When the debutantes are held for ransom, the only way for sheltered Prudence Conway Wellington (Sonya) to save her friends is to hide in a brothel and operate outside the law.

“Spider-Shark vs Snake-Bear” - When an archaeologist goes missing in Africa while investigating the myth of the Spider-Shark, Dr. Haley Lord (Sonya) is released from a government psychiatric ward to lead a rag-tag team of operatives into the jungle to find her.  Also in the “cast” are genre favorite actors Damion Poitier (The Avengers, Captain America: Civil War, Star Trek) and Magda Apanowicz (Kyle XY, Continuum, The Magicians), adult star Caroline Pierce – and a special appearance by horror hostess Ivonna Cadaver of Macabre Theatre!

Starring Sonya Devereaux was created by Emmy Award and Rondo Award winning writer Todd Livingston (The Black Forest, Rocky & Bullwinkle Show, Sheena – Queen of the Jungle) & Nick Capetanakis (Pink Panther, So,You’ve Downloaded A Demon, Hobbes & Phil vs Zombies) and illustrators Brendon & Brian Fraim (The Three Stooges, Vampire PA, The Flight). They are also the team responsible for THE ODD SQUAD and the critically-acclaimed AMERICA JR (where Sonya first appeared).

 

Also included in the trade paperback are the bonus features: An interview with Sonya, a look into the creative process with the creators, cover galleries, the Vampire Revolution strip run from the America Jr webcomic, and NEVER-BEFORE-PUBLISHED Behind the Scenes mini-documentary on the making of Naked Are the Damned 2 and bloopers & outtakes from Vampire Academy 4.

 

FREE with every order of physical rewards will be an exclusive button designed by illustrators Brendon & Brian Fraim!

WHY CROWDFUND?

Due to COVID-19, retailers have suffered a drastic loss of cash-flow. Reduced store hours (if a store has been fortunate enough to remain solvent) and limited number of customers that can be in the store at the same time has dramatically reduced the budget that stores can spend on titles. Sadly, independent publishers are the first casualties.  By crowdfunding, you will ensure the production and distribution of this totally unique book, and get karma points resulting from supporting independent creators!

RISKS/CHALLENGES

The overwhelming bulk of the story/art pages and the editorial pages are done and are ready to print right now. We have an experienced team of creators and production people who are confident this will finish on time.

Reduced store hours (if a store has been fortunate enough to remain solvent) and limited number of customers that can be in the store at the same time has dramatically reduced the budget that stores can spend on titles. Sadly, independent publishers are the first casualties.  By crowdfunding, you will ensure the production and distribution of this totally unique book, and get karma points resulting from supporting independent creators!RISKS/CHALLENGESThe overwhelming bulk of the story/art pages and the editorial pages are done and are ready to print right now. We have an experienced team of creators and production people who are confident this will finish on time.

story:
CAMPAIGN UPDATE:

I've taken down some of the previous perks because the books are done and ready to ship so the campaign is winding down. The stretch level goals are still available with each purchase with the exception of your name in the book (for obvious reasons).

 

 

 

 

 

THE MAIN COVER!


 

VARIANT COVER

PAGE 1!

 

PAGE 2

 

PAGE 3


 

PAGE 4

 

PAGE 5

 

THE NEW BOOKMARK!

 

THE POSTER!

OUR HERO: PAUL JACKSONHello and welcome!

Hi, horror and comics fans! I'm Graham Nolan, a 35+ year veteran writer/artist of the comic book gulags. Over the years you've probably seen my work for DC and Marvel Comics and if you don't already know, I'm the designer and co-creator of the iconic Batman villain, BANE! I'm also the creator of MONSTER ISLAND (which is still available on Indiegogo) and the artist on the successful, THE EXPENDABLES GO TO HELL (also still available) to name a few!

THE CHENOO is a story I've been kicking about for a couple years now but because it's a self-contained story there was never an outlet for it with the major comic book publishers. I think readers are looking for good  stories that don't require them to invest in multiple issues when the story could have been told in one without all the padding.

People like YOU, with crowdfunding, have changed the paradigm of graphic storytelling. Now there are no limits on the types of stories that can me told. Your trust and investment in these new ideas and ways of doing things is really ushering in a new GOLDEN AGE OF COMICS!

So a big thank you for checking out my story!

 

THE STORY:

In 1977 a once in 500 year winter storm hit the city of Buffalo, paralyzing the region. 23 deaths were attributed to the storm but the truth could never be revealed. There was something hiding in the snow and wind. Something evil and malignant.  And it was hungry.

Today, another monster storm is brewing over the lake and once again it is bringing more than wind and snow. It's bringing death!

Paul Jackson was a kid during the storm of '77 when his father, Jimmy was the chief of police. His dad told him stories about the storm that couldn't and shouldn't be shared.

Stories of the Chenoo. A giant frozen creature of Native American lore that comes off the ice to eat the hearts of its victims in search of the warmth it will never have.

Now Paul is a cop and it's happening all over again.

 

Created, written and illustrated by Inkpot Award recipient, Graham Nolan

 

48 Pages b/w with gray tones and blood red (More pages to be added to stretch goals)

 

 

STRECH GOALS

EVERYBODY WINS!

• $15K- EVERY supporters name in the book!- UNLOCKED!

• $20K- Super cool collectible TRADING CARD! - UNLOCKED!

• $25K- Chenoo BOOKMARK -UNLOCKED!

• $30K- ADDED STORY CONTENT! The Chenoo in the Blizzard of '77!  -UNLOCKED!

• $40K- Free DIGITAL COPY of The Chenoo -UNLOCKED!

• $50K-Main Cover Foil Stamp -UNLOCKED!

• $60K-Variant Cover Foil Stamp- UNLOCKED

 

Funding

Funding for this project will first go to the expenses of paying for services such as printing, design and setup costs, lettering, etc. After that, the rest of the funding will go to me as creator/writer/artist to keep the lights on and pay the bills while I work on the project as well as to help launch the NEXT project...You are not going to want to miss that!

 YOU MAKE AN IMPACT

The Chenoo is just the beginning of new stories and concepts I want to bring to Indiegogo under my publishing label, Compass Comics.

The "Big 2" comic book companies have stacked the deck against the creators by owning our creations for a pittance of a page rate and monopolizing distribution. But there's a new sheriff in town and it's called crowdfunding! Because of YOU we can now bypass their rigged system and deliver the kind of comics you want directly to you! It's an exciting time to be creating stories!

 

Risks & Challenges

This a low risk investment, my friends. I have never missed a deadline or failed to deliver on a promise in the 35 years I've been in this business. If this is funded, it WILL be fulfilled. You can take that to the bank!

Other Ways You Can Help

I tried to make sure there is a level for everyone, but I know times are tough. If you love comics but can't contribute, I ask that you help support by helping me get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends by using the Indiegogo share tools. It will be greatly appreciated!

 

Stretch Goals:

I'm asking for the bare minimum that it will cost me to produce this book. Once we hit that goal, then the fun can begin. At levels to be determined, more pages will be added, more opportunities for YOU to appear in the book and lots of other goodies!

Shipping: 

To be determined

EVERYBODY WINS!
• $15K- EVERY supporters name in the book!- UNLOCKED!

• $20K- Super cool collectible TRADING CARD! - UNLOCKED!

• $25K- Chenoo BOOKMARK -UNLOCKED!

• $30K- ADDED STORY CONTENT! The Chenoo in the Blizzard of '77!  -UNLOCKED!

• $40K- Free DIGITAL COPY of The Chenoo -UNLOCKED!

• $50K-Main Cover Foil Stamp -UNLOCKED!

• $60K-Variant Cover Foil Stamp- UNLOCKED

 
Funding
Funding for this project will first go to the expenses of paying for services such as printing, design and setup costs, lettering, etc. After that, the rest of the funding will go to me as creator/writer/artist to keep the lights on and pay the bills while I work on the project as well as to help launch the NEXT project...You are not going to want to miss that!

 YOU MAKE AN IMPACT
The Chenoo is just the beginning of new stories and concepts I want to bring to Indiegogo under my publishing label, Compass Comics.
The "Big 2" comic book companies have stacked the deck against the creators by owning our creations for a pittance of a page rate and monopolizing distribution. But there's a new sheriff in town and it's called crowdfunding! Because of YOU we can now bypass their rigged system and deliver the kind of comics you want directly to you! It's an exciting time to be creating stories!


 
Risks & Challenges
This a low risk investment, my friends. I have never missed a deadline or failed to deliver on a promise in the 35 years I've been in this business. If this is funded, it WILL be fulfilled. You can take that to the bank!

Other Ways You Can Help
I tried to make sure there is a level for everyone, but I know times are tough. If you love comics but can't contribute, I ask that you help support by helping me get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends by using the Indiegogo share tools. It will be greatly appreciated!
 
Stretch Goals:
I'm asking for the bare minimum that it will cost me to produce this book. Once we hit that goal, then the fun can begin. At levels to be determined, more pages will be added, more opportunities for YOU to appear in the book and lots of other goodies!
Shipping: 
To be determined

story:
*UPDATE*

There has been a great response over the last couple days so we have decided to extend the campaign for SIX MORE DAYS! As a thank you for all the wonderful support for SHRINKAGE we are reducing the VIP Conan Pack to $500 and adding four more slots for the Cameo Appearance Pack. We are overwhelmed from everyone's support and are very excited about finishing SHRINKAGE.

Short Summary

Rob Kutner's SHRINKAGE is a comedic, sci-fi action tale about how the most unknowable battleground we face is the one within our own craniums. An 8-part comics series, written by 5-time Emmy Award winning writer Rob Kutner ("The Daily Show with Jon Stewart," "Conan") and illustrated by renowned comics artist John Lucas (X-Men, Deadpool), it will be distributed digitally and offered to readers FREE, via the new Farrago Comics app. This is the first original comics series produced by Farrago Comics, a FREE app for Apple and Android devices, that provides FREE comics by today’s top creators, as well as Golden Age goodies galore. By helping SHRINKAGE happen you’ll also be a part of the movement to make it easier for everyone to read comics. 

If you have yet to download the Farrago Comics app, you can do so for iOS & Android here: iOS and Android

So What is Shrinkage?

Aliens have invaded.

Not in giant motherships – inside the brain of the President of the United States. They are nano-scale, feed on radiation, and are trying to use their host to turn the Earth into one giant, glowing bon-bon of radioactivity.

But not if barrel-chested, quasi-mystical uber-patriot 3 1/2-STAR GENERAL (long story) STURGE McCRAIN has anything to say about it.

He and brilliant, dysfunctional, embittered brain scientist DR. LANA PERCY undergo experimental (as in, they're its first-ever test subjects) Pentagon miniaturization technology and are shot right up the Most Powerful Nose in the Free World to find and kill or be killed by the Nano-invaders.

And all they’ll have to do in the midst of battling is...
  • Steer clear of the MICROGLIA, immune-system macrophages that devour hostile bodies… or imprison them in an unbreakable scar;
  • Survive the treacherous MEMORY FOGS of the hippocampus 
    (particularly brutal: “The Battle of That Time Mom Walked in On Him Masturbating”)
  • Defeat the totally unhinged creations of the DREAM LABYRINTH (ever heard a US Corporal say, “Deploy the gangsta-rapping burrito – STAT!”?);
  • Oh, and did I mention Sturge and Lana also have to keep PRESIDENT BENNETT DULLARD functioning normally? (Imagine major global arms talks where a brain-battled Chief Executive suddenly pisses himself and heils Hitler).

That’s because they’re the only ones who can know about the aliens – and their mini-mission – besides BART, a Secret Service agent with a twisted hero complex, and DR. BENARI, the President’s exhaustingly cheerful Physician.And decidedly NOT on our heroes’ side is FIRST LADY ELIZA DULLARD who suspects something’s happening inside our man, and determined to root it out – by any drug necessary.

Meet Team Shrinkage

Rob Kutner (@ApocalypseHow), current writer for TBS’s “Conan,” five-time Emmy Award winning writer for “The Daily Show with Jon Stewart,” author of the national bestseller “Apocalypse How: Turn The End Times Into the Best of Times,” and co-creator of the all-star charity sci-fi comedy album “2776 ” (featuring Patton Oswalt, Reggie Watts, Ira Glass, Margaret Cho, Dick Cavett, Bobcat Goldthwait, etc), is partnering with Marvel and DC comics artist John Lucas (@himwhatjolts) and comic book publisher Farrago Comics (@FarragoComics), to publish his new comic book series SHRINKAGE.

“For years I’ve been dreaming up an insane comedy sci-fi series called SHRINKAGE about an all-out battle against nano-scale alien invaders, all taking place inside the President of the United States’ brain,” said Kutner. “But these days, with so many comic book houses focused on in-house superhero properties, it was hard for a comics ‘noob’ like me to sell the idea."

"Then Farrago Comics came along, which already had a ton of cool comics on their app and wanted to do something special for their first original comic. My mom always said I was special, but it was nice that Farrago Comics also thought I was special enough to partner with on producing their very first original comic. Now this story no longer needs to battle within my brain, but is becoming a reality."

As opposed to television for which Rob regularly writes, the average person does not have a comic book reading habit. We all believe that by making comics free to read and thus lowering the entry barrier to a medium that everyone can (and once did) enjoy, Farrago Comics is doing both fans and creators a mammoth service. Fans don’t have to pay anything but attention to try out great comics, and creators win by sharing in-comic ad revenue each time their comic is read. So help us not only make a funny comic book, but impact a whole industry by helping spread the Farrago Comics platform to bring joy to readers and a new avenue for both appreciation and remuneration, to creators.

Shrinkage Wrap: The Covers

We have brought in some great comic book talent to create covers for SHRINKAGE: Dean Haspiel (American Splendor, Billy Dogma, HBO’s "Bored To Death"), Rob Guillory (Chew), Bob Fingerman (Minimum Wage), Paul Pope (Batman Year 100, Battling Boy), and our very own John Lucas to round out the amazing talent.

Special thanks to:
  • David Avallone for filming Rob's scenes and editing the final clip
  • Eric Deitz for filming John's scenes
  • Vatche Arabian for the special effects
  • Dan Ruckus for the music 

Your Impact

We are three quarters of the way to completing this series, but we still need your help! SHRINKAGE was originally planned as a four issue series, then we realized we had to break it into eight parts to tell the story in the best possible way. Due to some of these adjustments, our initial estimate for the cost of the series were less than what the actuality is.

All the means is that you have another opportunity to be a part of the SHRINKAGE team. There are some amazing Perks for you to choose from. Choose one, two or as many as you like. Either way, we want you to help save the President and world!

Risks & Challenges

With the productive pedigrees of both writer Rob Kutner (Emmy Award-winning writer for "The Daily Show with Jon Stewart", "Conan") and artist John Lucas (Marvel, DC), we're confident the SHRINKAGE graphic novel will be ready for your reading pleasure right on schedule. Farrago Comics co-founder Matty Ryan brings years of production experience at Marvel to the table, and our social media maven Jeff Newelt (AKA JahFurry) will make sure supporters get plenty of in-progress peeks and previews.

This campaign for SHRINKAGE exists not just to raise funds to complete the digital comic, but to create an EXCLUSIVE print Trade Paperback edition. We will be using Print-On-Demand to produce an exclusive limited and signed editions of the book based solely on the amount of orders we receive. 

As you can see from the list of rewards, from all-star comedy albums to custom sketches to original cover art by four different artists, there's lots to cherish and enjoy as you support the creation of both an original graphic novel, and the flourishing of a novel FREE digital comics platform.

Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean
you still can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about SHRINKAGE.
  • Share our campaign on Facebook or Twitter
  • Read the beginning of the SHRINKAGE saga on the Farrago Comics app!
    Available for iOS and Android

story:
All books have shipped out to our backers! Missed out on the campaign? You can now purchase the book directly from the publisher!

And don't forget to check out our follow-up book, P. Craig Russell's Salome and Other Stories!

This stunning 12"X17" oversized hardcover features complete stories scanned from P. Craig Russell's stunning original art! While appearing to be in black & white, each page has been scanned in color to recreate as closely as possible the experience of viewing the actual original art—including blue pencils, notes, art corrections and more. Pages are reproduced at near-original size on heavy paper stock to provide fans, aficionados and collectors with the best possible reproductions.


 

6 Complete Comic Art Classics

The final contents of the 148 page 12"X17" hardcover includes the following complete Jungle Book stories:

  • The King's Ankus (28 pages)
  • Red Dog (32 pages)
  • Spring Running (27 pages)

The "other stories" included are three of P. Craig Russell's most acclaimed early works:

  • Siegfried and the Dragon (9 pages)
  • La Sonnambula and the City of Sleep (11 pages)
  • Breakdown on the Starship Remembrance (33 pages)

In addition to the complete stories, this special Fine Art Edition includes artist's notes with background info on each stories as well as a bonus gallery featuring even more Jungle Book-related Russell art and covers!

story:
RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN! 

TOXIC FEMINISM and EXTREME MASCULINITY COLLIDE IN THIS EPIC ADVENTURE! 

(MAIN COVER by JIMBO!) 

Two Army Veterans crash in a mystical jungle populated by a lost tribe of Warrior Women that hunt men, enslave them and then kill them. They must escape, adapt to survive, or die trying.

(ALTERNATE COVER By Geebo Vigonte)

Prolific writer Mr. Chuck Dixon is known for his legendary writing at DC Comics on iconic titles such as BATMAN, where he helped create the key character of BANE. He has also written on other mega-hit titles for MARVEL Comics including The Punisher and many many more!

Mr. Dixon has joined forces with Benjamin L. Henderson, Founder, Writer, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief of Cautionary Comics to develop original action-packed comic book stories set in the CAUT!ONVERSE! They are joined on RAVAGE by Artistic Powerhouses Jimbo Salgado and Bryan Arfel Magnaye as well as the entire team at Cautionary Comics to create the NEW and ORIGINAL Title RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN!

We are well on our way to our next tier!! We have the entire 120pages of the RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Saga!  All we need is YOU!

If we are lucky enough to hit $100,000.00 we will release the FULL 120 Pages GRAPHIC Novel of the RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN Saga which is already written and ready to go!

Below is a break down of each of our tiers. 

$30,000.00 Tier 2 Ravage #2 (24 Pages) UNLOCKED!

$45,000.00 Tier 3 Ravage #3  (24 Pages)

$60,000.00 Tier 4 Ravage #4  (24 Pages)

$75,000.00  Tier 5 Ravage #5 -The Conclusion (24 Pages )

$100,000.00 FULL GRAPHIC NOVEL of The RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN Saga!

We have new perks to help us get to our goal out soon! Once we hit Tier 2 we will have Ravage #2 on sale on IndieGoGo!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

MR. CHUCK DIXON

Chuck Dixon is a veteran comic book writer with thousands of titles to his name including a record run on  BATMAN at DC Comics (where he co-created the villain BANE) and seminal work on Marvel’s The Punisher.

BENJAMIN L HENDERSON

Benjamin L Henderson, Writer of over 50 original titles such as RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN, The Magus: Inner Demons and The Offworlder: The Protectors of Sa'Ra. Ben is the Founder, Creator, and Editor-In-Chief Cautionary Comics.

JIMBO SALGADO

Jimbo is Art Director and Artist currently working on RAVAGE #1 and THE MAGUS: Inner Demons. Jimbo has a unique and innovative expression all his own. His works include DC Batman Arkham Unhinged, Team 7 #3, Judge Dredd #7, Toy Packaging Art for Hasbro Publishing, Transformers More than Meets the Eye Annual work for IDW Publishing, Trading Card Work for Upperdeck Entertainment, He is also a Cover Artist for Different Publishing Studios like Heavy Metal Magazine, Zenescope Entertainment, Titan Comics and Valiant Entertainment.

BRYAN ARFEL MAGNAYE

Bryan Arfel Magnaye is a comic book colorist wizard! He graduated in multimedia arts and design for post-secondary education as well as many seminars and trainings. He has worked for Glasshouse Publishing, God n Bone Animations, and Zenescope Entertainment.

Bryan is currently working on Ravage: Kill All Men and The Magus: Inner Demons.

THE STORY

The RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN saga take's place in the mystical land of The PROTECTORI, home to an Ancient Race of Warriors that are sworn to stop the Evil of The LIZZARSIN, The FIRST ONES, members an ancient Cult from a long forgotten race that worship nothing but their lust and the One-Eyed Demon. The Evil GENERAL RAK of the LIZZARSIN has spent an eternity hunting ANDRAMAK, The Queen Of The Protectori and her Warriors.

The "General" and his Cult of Devil Worshiping Assasians, attack all those that look, think or feel differently, Children, The Sick, The Elderly Protectori Women in the Old Temples, nothing is held sacred to the snakelike "warrior" cult. The tears of the Old feed their dark souls while the cooked bodies of children feed their bellies. All those that are not a part of their hive are an abomination to be ridiculed, attacked and enslaved. Women are simply meant to be used in their Dark Society.

Project Status

We are very excited to announce the first 12 pages of RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN #1 are already COMPLETE!!  We have invested our hearts, minds, money, and time into the RAVAGE Saga! Also, are well into our FINAL DRAFT of the entire 120+ Page RAVAGE: KILL ALL MEN SAGA!  The response by the true Comic Book Industry Professionals, Comic Book Legends, and most importantly to the entire Cautionary Team the die-hard old-school Comic Book Community has been Amazing!

THANK YOU FOR ALL THE LOVE!

Check out the just some of the breathtaking Art you will find in RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN!

RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN #1 Page 1

RAVAGE - KILL ALL MEN #1 Page 2

Ravage - KILL ALL MEN #1 Page 3

  

Ravage - KILL ALL MEN #1 Page 8 "COME..." "I think I already did...."

Ravage is part of the CAUTIONVERSE, a fully developed comic book universe of over 50 NEW and ORIGINAL Titles!  Our leadership team is filled with experienced mature professionals with a track record of turning in projects ON TIME that benefit corporations and customers alike and now we are bringing our Professional Work Ethic to our new Comic Book Company and need help to continue to grow! Help us bring the CAUTIONVERSE into Existance!

The Cautionary Comic rocket ship is ready to launch! The last piece of this ship is YOU, our AMAZING future fans! 

 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!
