"I think I already did...."Ravage is part of the CAUTIONVERSE, a fully developed comic book universe of over 50 NEW and ORIGINAL Titles!  Our leadership team is filled with experienced mature professionals with a track record of turning in projects ON TIME that benefit corporations and customers alike and now we are bringing our Professional Work Ethic to our new Comic Book Company and need help to continue to grow! Help us bring the CAUTIONVERSE into Existance!The Cautionary Comic rocket ship is ready to launch! The last piece of this ship is YOU, our AMAZING future fans!  THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!

story:
THE WRASKLES ARE BACK!

Teen pop-punk sensations THE WRASKLES are going international! Tony, Alana, Max & Rosie, arrive in Ireland with high hopes of becoming world class superstars, but are soon confronted with the stark reality that the supernatural curse placed on them by a vindictive demon goat have followed them over the pond. Will they get their chance to make it big or will they succumb to the paralyzing scream of the malevolent Banshee? 

ARTISTS EDITION

Limited to 100 copies, each numbered and signed by Curt Spurging. THE WRASKLES: SONG OF THE BANSHEE ARTISTS EDITION is a unique look into the creative process that goes into producing a WRASKLES tale. Showcasing Curt's original line work and pencils, readers will get the full story while enjoying an in depth look at what it takes to produce the unique and bombastic art that forms the core of THE WRASKLES visual experience. Ideal for collectors and those comics aficionados who enjoy taking a behind the scenes look at the development process.

PERKS

We are keeping it simple for this campaign and offering only 2 perks;

1 - THE WRASKLES SONG OF THE BANSHEE ARTISTS EDITION

This perk comes with the 40 page book signed by Curt, 5 stickers, and a random sketch card of one of the core WRASKLES characters. Limited to 100 copies, this is going to be a must have item for WRASKLES collectors in the future. 

2 - THE WRASKLES BOOK 1: CROSSROADS AT PORKSBURG

We are re-offering BOOK 1 so that folks who missed out the first time around can jump right in at the beginning. This perk comes with the 36 page book, a sketch done by Curt on the interior cover, 5 stickers, and a random sketch card of one of the core WRASKLES characters.

FULFILMENT

We are dedicated to getting our books in our readers hands, quickly. Most books will be shipped 3 weeks after the campaign closes and we are hoping that North American backers will receive their books to enjoy for the holidays. THE WRASKLES books are finished before we start the campaigns and this enables us to simply send an order to the printer and then ship the books. 

DEDICATED TO QUALITY

THE WRASKLES books are printed on the highest quality paper and we aim to give our readers the best experience possible. The colours pop and you can leave them on a coffee table and know that they will be an excellent center piece. 

BOOK 2 INTERIOR PAGES

Page 1

 

Page 2

Page 3

 

Page 4

 

Page 5

 

Page 6

 

Page 19

Page 20

Page 21

Page 22

 

 

5 - STICKERS

5"x 2"

​5"x 2"

3"x 3"

3"x 3"

3"x 3"

 

SKETCH CARDS

4"x6" card stock

Each sketch card will be an original drawing.

 

EXAMPLE OF INTERIOR SIGNED BOOK SKETCH

Each sketch will be an original drawing. 

Book 2 will be number out of 100. 

6 3/4" x 10 3/4"

example of numbering. 

 

 

BOOK 1: CROSSROADS AT PORKSBURG

On the way to a very important gig THE WRASKLES van breaks down at the crossroads at Porksburg. An old goat challenges them to a musical contest and when they defeat him he transforms into a demon and curses them! This sets THE WRASKLES on their way to teen Pop-Punk superstardom as they battle the supernatural forces of evil! 

INTERIOR PAGES

Page 8

Page 11

Page 12

Page 16

Page 17

Page 18

Page 20

Page 30

Page 33

All books are mailed out in a hard document mailer, bagged and boarded with stickers and sketch card included. 

Original signed inked Drawings 7"x10.5"

story:
AIC Comics Presents:

Tales From The Streets Of Guangzhou

Hi folks, my name's Michael. In April 2017 I launched my self-published line of comics and graphic novels called AIC Comics. My first series, Shexie Meiren, was released later that year. To help with the high cost of publishing comic books, I created a crowdfunding campaign that was very successful - so much so that I was able to publish a second comic. This one was about a side character from Shexie Meiren called 'The American,' a vigilante who's tough on crime and not afraid to cross the line. I called it 'Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou." The overwhelmingly positive comments it received blew me away and the book nearly outsold the first issue of Shexie Meiren. Backers wanted to know if they would see more of the The American in his solo outing.

Well, I'm happy to announce that we at AIC Comics have been working on an expanded story line for the fan-favorite character. 'Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou' will be a four-part, 100+ page paperback graphic novel full of action as The American faces off against the rising threat of the Liu Mang Triad. The story is written by myself and the artwork is done by the original artist Allen Warner, along with some well-known comic pros such as Netho Diaz (GI:Joe - A Real American Hero, IDW & Halo, Dark Horse) and amazing indie creators like Jarret Katz.

Your support will help us to complete this book that is nearly two years in the making. As of now, three of the four parts are already finished! Work on the final part will begin immediately following this campaign and will incorporate elements from the backer perks, including the chance for you to become a major recurring character!

Thank you for your consideration in backing this project. We at AIC Comics are very passionate about this story and we're excited to have you be a part of it. Read on to learn more about our campaign and the sweet perks we're offering to backers. If you have any questions, check out the FAQs below or feel free to send us a message. As always, stay awesome, my friends!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for $2,000 to go towards costs of completing and publishing the book. This includes: interior page artwork, cover artwork, ISBN registration, printing, shipping, marketing, and other various expenses. Should we exceed that goal, the additional funds will go toward the other projects we have going on at AIC Comics, including costs of other publications (of which we have many - see the FAQs for more info) and expenses for comic-con appearances (our appearance schedule is also in the FAQs, which we will keep updated). In the unfortunate event that we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the funds raised to complete the book with other resources. Either way, 'Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou' will see the light of day.

We hope very much to avoid the latter scenario and so we've come up with perks that will appeal to backers of every kind, including a variety of low-, middle-, and high-end items. Check them out below and please don't hesitate to ask us any questions.

 

The Perks

Here you can find more information on the perks we're offering to our backers. We'll be updating this section as more perks come along, including milestone rewards and stretch goals. Is there something you'd like in particular, but don't see it here? Send us a message and we'll see what we can do! We like to work with our backers to come up with some great rewards for supporting us.

The Book: First and foremost, we're offering both digital and print copies of Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou - all 100+ pages on high quality paper that highlights the artwork by Allen Warner.

Chibi Stickers: We asked frequent collaborator Rey Ramos of Rain Art Studios (Spiderman, Marvel) to design a set of chibi stickers from some of AIC Comics' most popular titles, including: The American, Shexie Meiren, Agent Sparx, and Um Khuzi. The designs are adorable. For digital backers, we're still giving you the set in PNG format.

Wallpaper Set: Put The American in the background of your desktop, phone, or tablet with this set of wallpaper designed by comic pro Netho Diaz and rising indie star Jarret Katz. The American has never looked so good.

Comic Art Prints: The same amazing illustrations used for the wallpaper are also available in standard comic-size prints, plus more that you haven't seen yet! All are included in both digital and print perks and they are gorgeous.

Cosplay Prints: We recently did a fun photo shoot with models who portrayed two of our more popular characters, Shexie Meiren and Agent Sparx. The shoot was a blast and the pictures are great! Both digital and print perks will include an autographed photo.

Become a Major Recurring Character: This is one perk that I'm very excited to offer. This is a chance to have your likeness used to design one of five recurring characters - all of whom will be introduced in the fourth and final part of this book! In addition, indie creator Jarret Katz will design an exclusive poster with all five characters that will be used in promotion of the book. You'll need to provide us with images of your face, which we'll ask for at the conclusion of this campaign. The five characters will be leaders of a worldwide criminal organization and will be the main antagonists of the sequel to this book, but will also play an important role in the fourth part of this book!

Custom Cover by Staz Johnson: Do you like one-of-a-kind perks? Do you like comic book covers drawn by industry pros? You may just want to consider claiming this perk! Staz Johnson has been drawing comics since the late 80's and has done work for both Marvel and DC, among other publishers, including Spider-Man and Batman. He's one of my personal favorite comic artists and he's an all-around awesome guy. You'll get to provide us with your idea for a cover and Staz will draw it! It's as simple and amazing as that!

Custom Cover by Netho Diaz: These custom cover perks are very limited, but we want to offer as many as possible. Netho's work is included in other perks, but this time you decide what you want to see on the cover of your copy of Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou. 

Custom Cover by Diego Bernard: Diego is another brilliant comic pro who recently finished a run of X-Men. He's done work with AIC Comics in the past and we can't love him enough. Again, you provide us with your idea for the cover of your copy of Tales from the Streets of Guangzhou and we'll pass it along to Diego. For all custom cover perks, we'll ship your one-of-a-kind copy once it's ready, which will be around the same time as when other perks are sent out.

 

Risks & Challenges

This will be our third crowdfunding campaign, albeit the first on Indiegogo. While our most recent Kickstarter was unsuccessful, we can attribute that to an unfortunate injury that beset me and took me away from doing the work necessary for a successful campaign. However, we've had two very successful Kickstarters prior to that and we're excited to make the move to Indiegogo for our fourth project. We have a lot of experience not just in crowdfunding, but also publishing and so the risks are easily identifiable and planned for.

Being in China, shipping tends to be the biggest issue. However, we've worked with customs to figure out the best and most efficient ways to get your perks to you, no matter where you are in the world. If for any reason there is a delay, we'll work with customs to clear any issues.

In the past, we've had issues with the quality of printing - the end product always turned out great, but it used to take a few tries before we got it right. The reason for this is that printers in China - and most people for that matter - aren't familiar with the format of western comics. There's no market for them here. But recently we were introduced to a printer in Suzhou (outside of Shanghai) who's been working with comic creators for years and knows exactly what's needed. He's been a breath of fresh air for us and so printing is much more efficient and cheaper, which means we're able to sell our products at a lower price.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you wish you could help, but you're unable to back our Indiegogo? No worries! We appreciate your enthusiasm. But there are ways you can still help us out! Please share the link to our project on social media, with your friends and family, and anyone else you can think of who enjoys a good comic book. Spreading the word is the next best thing to backing us directly and we appreciate it all the same! We may even have something to give out to our more frequent sharers who help us get new backers. Be sure to tell your friends to let us know they learned about us from you so we can show our thanks!

story:
Colleen DerKamp used to be a normal girl, one day, her a strange fate befell on her. Subjected to a terrible ritual against her will, she becomes the new "Host of Darkness." With the help of the enigmatic Lucian Copper, she escapes the Cult of Guff, and now on the run, she's alone to face her new fate. 

Enter, Nathan Rowe, a disgraced homicide detective now working a private investigator, tasked with protecting Colleen from the Cult that chases after her and the dark powers that consume her soul.

Will he able to succeed in his mission or are they all destined to become lost souls to the Host of Darkness? 

 

Risk and challenges:

I am a one-man team doing all the work: writing, pencils, inks and colors plus editing and graphic design for the entire book. The entire work is digital, which speeds up the creative process, but as always there are hurdles (malfunctioning hard-drives, corrupted files and power outages). There are other factors that might delay the release of each chapter such as disease and injury.

But I will always try to deliver the promised rewards on time and let backers know of any possible delays.

story:
Welcome to SWORD MAIDENS! Sword Maidens is a swords and sorcery adventure fantasy starring twin sisters Ezla and Ursa! It's set in the Barbarian age and will contain Adult Content and Nudity similiar to the Savage Sword of Conan Comic Magazine. So this book is an Adults Only comic and it's going to be 24 pages and Full Color.  It is also Completely Finished, so Digital Copies will go out after IGG processes payments and Print Copies will ship as soon as I get them back from the printer after the Campaign ends. This campaign will only be 3 weeks and no longer, so don't miss out! 

You can pick from 4 Variant Covers or Collect them all.  (There are also Adult Variants to choose from.)

REGULAR COVER 1

REGULAR COVER 2

REGULAR COVER 3

REGULAR COVER 4

SWORD MAIDENS is the tale of two sister who seek vengeance on the Demon, G'Ral who killed their mother.  Their mother was a powerful witch and leader of the coven.  G'Ral and his followers seek to kill all witches so that G'Ral can horde all magic for himself.  The twin sisters Urza and Ezla have been taught the ways of the sword by their father, but unbeknownst to them they contain the last remaining magic their mother tried to hide from the demon before her death.  Now the SWORD MAIDENS are on a one way path to confront their mothers killer and defeat the demon G'Ral!

Interior Art (Final art will not be Censored)

 

ADULT VARIANT COVERS (Final Covers will NOT be Censored)

story:
Short Summary

Nowadays is a 300-page graphic novel that follows a group of people stranded along a Northern Ontario highway during the onset of a Zombie Apocalypse.

These aren't your parents zombies, though.  The undead have the ability to think, speak, run, and choose whether to be monsters. In every other story the zombie is the plot device that creates the fear and motivation that drives and develops the cast of characters through the story.  In Nowadays, we are redefining the genre in a way that sees the zombie as a tragic character.  They are no longer a part of the background to the story.  They are the main characters, with a choice to be antagonist or protagonist, the monster or the hero. 

The Nowadays creators are storytellers based in Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada.  Between the 2 of them, they have backgrounds in comics, film, visual arts, stage performance, radio, prose, and survived the Lakehead Outbreak of the Undead in '08.

This book is a product of over 2 years in the making, is completely done and is ready to print.  All contributions will help bring this project to reality.  100% of funds raised will go towards printing 2000 physical copies of the book (or more), and further our attempt to romance publishers with a compelling morality tale in a genre that currently has an expansive audience.

This is an all-or-nothing campaign.  The $20,000 we are seeking covers the cost of printing 2000 copies of a 300-page book in high quality.  The vast majority will cover the printing itself, and any monies left-over will cover the cost of the supercool rewards we are offering for helping us achieve this goal.  The rewards include magnets, stickers, buttons, art cards, t-shirts, prints, the book itself (of course) and limited canvas prints.  

Also, we are offering the unique experience of being IN the book. 

The zombie genre is very popular, but we aim to take it in a new direction that no others have steered.  This idea that zombies are still human has not been explored. These zombies are people you know.  They are your neighbours and your relatives. They could be you. What would you do if blood was the currency of the world?  How would the world react if the term 'dog-eat-dog' became literal?  Would it be a world of nightmare?  Or would humanity prove to overcome this new darkness?

In Nowadays, we follow two groups of characters as they are presented with these choices.

Nowadays is going to change your perspective of the zombie genre.  If you are a fan of zombies, you will want to share this story with anybody who shares your love for the undead. 

The creators of this tale have been telling stories for years.  Having been involved with the special-effects side of the commercial film industry, another on-going comic series (Victor's Legacy), on-going comic strip (Zygote Bop), Campus Radio, Improv Comedy, acting/writing/directing for stage, among other creative endeavours, we are excited to bring you this compelling tale of morality. 

All that is left is to provide you with a physical copy of the book.  You won't be sorry. 

Help us obi-indiegogo-kenobi, you're our only hope.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Nowadays is a 300-page graphic novel that follows a group of people stranded along a Northern Ontario highway during the onset of a Zombie Apocalypse.
These aren't your parents zombies, though.  The undead have the ability to think, speak, run, and choose whether to be monsters. In every other story the zombie is the plot device that creates the fear and motivation that drives and develops the cast of characters through the story.  In Nowadays, we are redefining the genre in a way that sees the zombie as a tragic character.  They are no longer a part of the background to the story.  They are the main characters, with a choice to be antagonist or protagonist, the monster or the hero. 
The Nowadays creators are storytellers based in Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada.  Between the 2 of them, they have backgrounds in comics, film, visual arts, stage performance, radio, prose, and survived the Lakehead Outbreak of the Undead in '08.
This book is a product of over 2 years in the making, is completely done and is ready to print.  All contributions will help bring this project to reality.  100% of funds raised will go towards printing 2000 physical copies of the book (or more), and further our attempt to romance publishers with a compelling morality tale in a genre that currently has an expansive audience.

All that is left is to provide you with a physical copy of the book.  You won't be sorry. 
Help us obi-indiegogo-kenobi, you're our only hope.

story:
The End: the final issues of DUMB

Exciting news everyone! This November I've been invited to stay at a friend's cabin for a few months in the wilds of Ontario, and I'm using it to complete my comics series about vocal disability: DUMB.

Without Toronto at my doorstep, under my feet,  throwing light and sound and smog into the air, I can finally dig deep into the conclusion of this experience. For the printed editions, I'm pouring everything in. There will be more introductory prose pieces from people like multi-lingual French comic artist Julie Maroh, Sound Studies Phd candidate Ely Rosenblum, commentary from Toronto's thriving deaf community, and more! 

I can't wait to share it with you. 

My last campaign ran exceptionally well and my schedule and deliveries were met without any problems. It was the perfect way to launch my career in comics. I'm looking forward to doing it all again with a little experience under my belt.

The Backstory

In October of 2012, I confronted the worst of an injury I had been strategically ignoring since that spring. After consulting a doctor, I was told that the intense and enduring pain around my vocal cords was a very bad strain and in my case, the severity of the injury would determine the length of the recovery—six months, if not more. It has now been two years, with no end in sight.

DUMB is the story of living day to day without a voice. I spent almost three months speaking less than 30 minutes a day, sometimes going for a few days or a week at a time without speaking at all. Since then, I’ve been increasing my painless speech time every day, little by little, and now find myself able to speak normally for up to three hours at a time before I need to rest.

My recovery continues, but the comics will end. If you want your copies before anyone else, this is your chance!

Get your copies of DUMB before they're available anywhere else

Issues 1 - 5 are currently available in stores, and online at my storenvy. 

The remaining issues, 6 - 10, will launch at TCAF 2015 -- HOWEVER: If you want your copies BEFORE they're available in stores, you can get them RIGHT HERE.

If you preorder, you'll receive all your comics in one batch in April, with PDF's and buttons to boot!

If you order current issues AND preorder issues, you'll receive the current issues in a batch in October, as well as a second batch in April to complete the set! Is it too early to mention Christmas/holiday gifts?

Budget

These are the basics of getting the series done, but keep an eye out for a blog post that delves into the more complicated details of my situation. I am looking forward to baring all on a taboo subject.

Printing and Production per issue, 250 copies: $725

Printing and Production for 5 issues, 250 each, 1250 comics total: $3,625 

Shipping, 5 issues in one envelope: $8 in Canada, $10 to the US, $17 International (round estimate: $725)

Materials (for making comics and for shipping): $350

Indiegogo and Paypal fees: $200 (Indiegogo) + $100 (Paypal)

TOTAL: $5,000

I'll update with stretch goals if we make it further -- rest assured, I've got some plans for that :)

    Scheduling and Challenges

    The only obstacle here is me. I'm thrilled to be spending the next few months with minimal contact to the outside world -- which is the opposite of how I normally live. The schedule is as follows:

    September       Run this campaign, get writing and drawing.

    October     Continue writing and drawing, fulfill campaign orders.

    November - January    Move into residency in Perth, Ontario with two of my closest friends. I have a room for almost no rent (and I'm subletting my apartment in Toronto to cut my costs), with a beautiful studio from which to work all day every day in the beautiful Ontario countryside. I'll stay there until the end of January, when I'll resume my busy life.

    February  - April    Print the final issues of DUMB, prepare for TCAF, mail out orders. DONE.

      Praise for DUMB

      "In Dumb, the feeling of powerlessness to express oneself is expressed in a completely articulate and powerful cartooning voice. It's a totally fascinating and meaningful comic."

      -- Dash Shaw, creator of Doctors, Cosplayers, and New School

      "Dumb is a passionate recount of a painful, frightening and very human experience."

      -- Eleanor Davis, author of Stinky and How to Be Happy

      "Georgia Webber's Dumb has an interesting subject matter that ropes you in and I'm here to tell you that it delivers. Dumb is a pleasure to read and I bug Georgia about the next issue whenever I see her."

      -- Ed Piskor, author of Hip Hop Family Tree

      "Georgia Webber’s DUMB is an excellent example of how comics can do things that other mediums can’t."

      -- Glyn Dillon, author of The Nao of Brown

story:
Who are you? What's State's Evidence and why the hell should I give you my money?

I'm Alan Brash from Shoot First Productions in Auckland, New Zealand. My bio is here but in short, I'm a screenwriter, producer, development executive, writing tutor & film-maker with more than 20 years' experience in the film & TV industry. This is my first foray into comics and graphic novels. (If you've watched the video, you'll know that my place is definitely not  in front of the camera!)

State's Evidence is a crime thriller which started life as a feature film screenplay. It placed well in a couple of script competitions and a few years ago I came across Italian artist, Giuseppe D'Elia, on-line (when we found out we'd been ripped-off by the same scam artist!) We formed an awesome long-distance working relationship, powered by Skype and email, and created the first 52 pages of a full-color graphic novel, which represented about 1/3 of the screenplay. 

Page 1 of the graphic novel.

But life intervened and I never pursued the project further - despite always believing in it. Which brings us to Indiegogo. 

This campaign seeks to raise funds to create the 2nd (& even 3rd) installment of the graphic novel which will be shopped to publishers - or self-published as an ebook (and potentially also a limited edition hard copy).

So what's it about? 'State's Evidence' is about Joe. Joe's an ex-con,  who was tangentially involved in a massacre of illegal immigrants years earlier by a white supremacist gang. Haunted by what happened, Joe turned state's evidence in order to put the key perpetrator in jail. Wanting to just quietly get on with his life in witness protection after serving his reduced sentence, he's coerced into infiltrating the gang, now run by the imprisoned leader's brother and plotting a comeback. His motivation? His old flame, Belle, is still associated with the group... and they have a son. Joe agrees to go undercover to save the son he never knew from the gang's destructive influence. (Plus, of course, he still holds a candle for his old flame...)

But aren't indie-published projects usually, you know... complete s**t?

At some time or other, we've all bought something from someone without a track record. And we've all - at least once - been disappointed it didn't live up to our expectations. It's these experiences that make us wary of backing something new - whether it's buying a washing machine of an unknown brand or sampling a new author's work.

I can't guarantee this story will be for you. But I can assure you I'll use my twenty years' experience of writing for film & TV - and teaching screenwriting - to give you the most gripping, entertaining story I can over 150-odd pages.

I wanted to ensure that this project stood out from the pack. That it would enhance the reputation of self-funded, indie comics, rather than diminish it. To this end, I assembled an awesome team to turn the story into a graphic novel. But these guys are professionals - this is what they do to pay their bills. Which is why I'm seeking funding to pay them. They are:

  1. Giuseppe D'Elia: Giuseppe is back to continue his awesome work taking my story and turning it into sequential art. I love the cinematic style of Giuseppe's work and he's proven to be a fantastic collaborator. Here are some examples of his work or check out the gallery. His recent work includes the sci-fi graphic novel Discord, written by film, TV and comics writer Paul J. Salamoff.
  2. Mukesh Singh: I came across Mukesh on-line and was blown away. I'd enjoyed Guy Ritchie's crime thriller The Gamekeeper, (even sending it to Giuseppe as an example of what I was going for) never knowing who was responsible for the evocative art . Mukesh has come on board to provide covers for the first and second (and maybe third) installment of the graphic novel. Check out a few of his illustrations in the gallery or go here for his facebook page or here for the work of his that's available on Amazon. I promise you won't be disappointed!
  3. Shawn Depasquale: Shawn is a writer in his own right (film, TV, comics), but he's also a highly experienced letterer. By bringing Shawn on-board, Giuseppe is freed-up from doing the lettering, and can focus on the pencils, inks and coloring that he's already responsible for.  Shawn showed me the great work he's capable of when I commissioned him to do some lettering previously (see gallery). He also has a crowd-funding campaign on the go (on that other crowd-funding website...). It's called The Galaxy Girls and you can check it out here. If one campaign's not enough to get involved with, then pop over to his campaign and give him some love, too!

    Tell me about your inspiration and influences

    This story was - as they say in Hollywood - "inspired by a true story."

    Michael Fortier was an accomplice to Timothy McVeigh - the homegrown terrorist who bombed the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City in 1995. In exchange for testifying against McVeigh, Fortier was given a reduced sentence for his involvement in the attack. When he was released from prison in 2006 he entered witness protection.

    When I read about his release I thought: Imagine how hard that would be for the families of the victims! Would anyone in law enforcement believe he got off scot-free? Would any of them attempt to serve rough justice on him outside the parameters of the legal system? Would any victims' families attempt the same thing? And what if - rather than testifying against a lone nutter - Fortier had testified against a movement? Such a figure could be in danger from both law enforcement and the extremists.

    While my story's hero is far less culpable in my fictitious event than Fortier was in the real bombing (and my hero has a Road to Damascus experience which turns him 180 degrees from his previous path), this was nevertheless the catalyst for the story that eventually became 'State's Evidence.'

    And now, with stories of illegal immigrants all over the news - from the countries of South and Central America trying to get into the US, to boat people fleeing Southeast Asia in search of a better life in Australia - the story again seemed very timely.

    The other theme the story explores is the rise of far right organizations - in part in response to the challenges of immigration. With the recent rise in many European countries of far right political parties, this issue also suddenly seems extremely topical.

    Apart from Tintin and the war comics I devoured in my youth, I've come to comics and graphic novels late in life. But I've been fascinated by stories like 'Y The Last Man' by Brian K. Vaughan (below), 'Scalped' by Jason Aaron, and 'Shooting War' by Anthony Lappe and Dan Goldman.

     I've been astonished by the way authors like Joe Sacco have used sequential art to cover such complex, harrowing topics as the Balkans War in 'Safe Area Gorazde' (below); how Marjane Satrapi can paint a picture of an Iranian childhood in 'Persepolis'; Darryl Cunningham can tackle conspiracy theories in 'How to Fake a Moon Landing'; how Raymond Biggs can humorously portray a catastrophic nuclear holocaust in 'When the Wind Blows.' In summary - I'm drawn to comics (no pun intended) that are not only entertaining, but that also have something to say! 

    For my own stories, I like a naturalistic, cinematic artistic style - hence my enthusiasm for working with Giuseppe and Mukesh.

    Where to from here?

    As soon as the first dollars roll in we'll be under way with this project.

    EVEN BEFORE THEN we'll be posting pages that are already created to the Shoot First Productions facebook page - found here (as well as to the company's website). Be sure to like the page, visit it regularly for updates, and don't forget to comment, like or share so Mark Zuckerberg believes you weren't kidding when you said you like the page and want to follow its updates. (Crazy, but what can you do?)

    As we go, we'll be posting more and more pages so you can track the progress.

    Feel free to get involved as much or as little as you like! We promise we won't cyber-stalk or spam you!

    Finally, we're still promoting this as a feature film project. I'll be taking 'State's Evidence' to the American Film Market (AFM) in Los Angeles in November, and hope to have the graphic novel well underway by then.

    Here's how the money will be spent:

    Pencils, inks, colors:                   $5500

    Design & illustrate covers:        $3000

    Lettering:                                          $825

    Pitch video & reward expenses:  $675

    TOTAL:                                         $10,000

    So what happens if you don't raise all the money?

    I'm committed to seeing this project through.  As soon as we have a cover created for the first installment I'll be marketing the project, both to traditional publishers and as an ebook via Amazon. One way or another, we'll be getting this project out to the world!

    If we meet our funding target we'll have enough to produce a cover for the first two installments and complete the art work and lettering for the second installment (to go with the first). If we exceed our target - or get a deal with a traditional publisher - then we'll forge on and complete the entire trilogy.

    What happens if you exceed your goal? Do you go on vacation in the Bahamas?

    Hell, no! At least - not on your dime... (Not on my dime any time soon, either, but c'est la vie...) 
    We forge on into the third and final installment and we insure that the books are available in hard copy as well as ebook format! :)

    In the meantime, can you show me the first six pages of the story? (Sure we can! Enjoy!!)

Finally, we're still promoting this as a feature film project. I'll be taking 'State's Evidence' to the American Film Market (AFM) in Los Angeles in November, and hope to have the graphic novel well underway by then.
Here's how the money will be spent:
Pencils, inks, colors:                   $5500
Design & illustrate covers:        $3000
Lettering:                                          $825
Pitch video & reward expenses:  $675
TOTAL:                                         $10,000
So what happens if you don't raise all the money?
I'm committed to seeing this project through.  As soon as we have a cover created for the first installment I'll be marketing the project, both to traditional publishers and as an ebook via Amazon. One way or another, we'll be getting this project out to the world!
If we meet our funding target we'll have enough to produce a cover for the first two installments and complete the art work and lettering for the second installment (to go with the first). If we exceed our target - or get a deal with a traditional publisher - then we'll forge on and complete the entire trilogy.

What happens if you exceed your goal? Do you go on vacation in the Bahamas?
Hell, no! At least - not on your dime... (Not on my dime any time soon, either, but c'est la vie...) 
We forge on into the third and final installment and we insure that the books are available in hard copy as well as ebook format! :)

In the meantime, can you show me the first six pages of the story? (Sure we can! Enjoy!!)

story:
Mein Weg zum Mangaka!

Mein Name ist Bianca, ich wohne bei Leipzig und bin 22 Jahre alt. Ich zeichne eigentlich schon mein ganzes Leben lang. Alle in meiner Familie sind sehr kreativ und führen auch in dieser Richtung einen Beruf aus. Vor knapp 7 Jahren hab ich mich dann an Mangas versucht und träume auch seitdem irgendwann mal damit mein Geld zu verdienen.

Mein Vorhaben :

Kurz und knapp gesagt, ich brauche finanzielle Unterstützung für diverses Zubehör (Zeichne zwar am Computer aber leider mit der Maus und ohne richtig professionelles  Zeichenprogramm), damit meine Arbeiten irgendwann professionell werden. Das Geld würde also für ein gutes Grafiktablett von Wacom und Manga Studio 5 (Programm) genutzt werden.

Ich zeichne jeden Tag und habe auch schon als Mediengestalter viele Erfahrungen gesammelt, welche für die Zukunft als Mangaka wichtig sind. Es würde für mich ein Traum in Erfüllung gehen, wenn ich mehr aus meinen Bildern machen und damit mein Geld verdienen könnte. 

Was ihr für euer Geld bekommt:

Für eure Spenden bekommt ihr auch etwas, von kleinen und großen Bildern mit Autogramm, Buttons bis hin zu eurem eigenen Wunsch-Manga (bitte sendet mir dafür eine genaue Beschreibung eurer Vorstellung). 

Ich freue mich natürlich auch, wenn ihr für mich werbt und meine Kampagne bekannt macht.

story:
Short Summary

Hello I am the mother of a  daughter is on the autism spectrum, She was given a opportunity to go to a special  needs camp, She had never been overnight anywhere but her home, or Grandpas house so i was very worried about how she would do,not to meniton while the camps are awesome they are a bit expensive (which is a nessicary evil) She had a blast and talks about it often, her teachers are some of the best in the country. The camp actually has a few programs through the year and I would like to sponsor as many as possible for the entire scheduled camp sessions. So I have put together Bustin4Autism Comic and Toy show to bring awareness to this, we would love to do this annually.

What We Need & What You Get

Money donated will be used to sponsor children to special needs camp for a year of scheduled events

  • You will get some pretty neat things, Magnets, KeyChains, Pens, Tshirts! 
  • We have set a realistic goal the more that is donated the more children we can send

The Impact

This camp took pictures of the kids Fishing, Horse Back Riding, Zip lining Swimming, Shaving cream duels (how fun is that) the smiles on her and other faces in the pictures speak for themselves the social interaction does them wonders, and also gives the parents a break because everyone one needs one!

I started this because while there are programs that are out there and are wonderful I didnt want to just throw money into a cause and not really see where it was going this is important to me and really impacted my life in a good way and I want to share that!

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can come to the Bustin4Autism Comic and Toy Show so we have set up this page for donations if you cant contribute, we understand just share the page with your friends and family! If you would like to see all the people coming to the Show vist www.zackpackpromotions.com/Bustin4Autism.html

story:
FREE Comic Reward edition of issue 1

https://www.dropbox.com/s/knshkkwz5tu9rny/01_cg_ks_1-1.pdf?dl=1

The Sisters Grey -- beautiful, deadly -- warriors sworn to protect the Kaiser, ruler of Mitteleuropa. But as a great war rages, the Kaiser is found dead, and one sister -- Giselle Grey -- is accused of his murder. Pursued by her enemies across the battlefields of Mitteleuropa Giselle must unravel the prophecy of the Carbon Grey -- before history itself unravels. 

See more details here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/hjnrvn2na49c0bc/AACuOdj-LnFaPT7qtthAKj-va?dl=0

Here is scene from a ball room dance, one of a rare moment where we get to see Giselle and Mathilde in a dress. Notice how uncomfortable Giselle is (she wearing the red dress) Mathilde on the other hand is quite happy.

Below are the three volumes (wrap-around-covers) trade paper back we plan to collect into one massive volume. Over 300 pages of excitement!

We're now reaching out to the community to help fund Carbon Grey collection and various toy collectibles. The money will go toward producing new contents for the book, as well as creating prototypes and going into mass production. We hope you'll join us and make this a reality. 

Thanks in advance for your support!

Best,

Hoang Nguyen

-

Perks for your support below. Please note that the delivery date is only an estimate, we still need to confirm the schedules with Image Comics and various toy manufacturers.

-

Pledge $5 or more: A special "Thank you" and a poster art screensaver. (Digital reward)

Pledge $15 or more: A digital PDF version of the Omnibus Collection, over 300 pages! Plus five high-res screensavers (Digital reward)

Pledge $25 or more: A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. Three signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and five high-res screensavers. See more images here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/za60lr2p4bqg70p/AAA5L9eSdbm4zLk7M2rSd7f4a?dl=0

Pledge $35 or more: A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. Five signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and five high-res screensavers.

Pledge $50 or more: A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. Five signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and screensavers.

Pledge $65 or more: Books only tier. This includes the Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection, the Art of Carbon Grey, and the Poster Art book. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. Five signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. A great saving if you want to get all the books together. All books and prints will be signed!

Pledge $85 or more: Two physical copies of Carbon GreyOmnibus Collection. Two Carbon Grey soundtrack CDs. Two Giselle "Nendoroid" figurines. Ten signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. (Save on postage, one for you and one for a friend.)

Pledge $100 or more: A six inch figurine of Giselle. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and five high-res screensavers.

Pledge $125 or more: A twelve inch action figure of Giselle. Come fully articulated with sword, gun and stand. A Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. Five signed prints. A digital PDF version of the comic and screensavers. See more of Giselle photos here.

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/gsszncgvp12n8rw/AAD_o3lvXxJEcH65-8YZGldra?dl=0

Pledge $150 or more: A twelve inch (DIY kit) of Giselle. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. More images of Giselle 12" DIY kit here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/9mnclxwwsea2p21/AADvxsvr2KiiWhj0521rNil9a?dl=0

Pledge $175 or more: A twelve inch action figure of Giselle. Come fully articulated with sword and gun. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. See more images of Giselle's action figure here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/7q4zo90rq9luj9k/AAB1cyF_nSgs4VOFj3GL-IRva?dl=0

Pledge $200 or more: A twelve inch DIY kit of Giselle and a six inch figurine, fully painted. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. More images of Giselle 12" DIY kit here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/9mnclxwwsea2p21/AADvxsvr2KiiWhj0521rNil9a?dl=0 

Pledge $300 or more: A twelve inch action figure. A twelve inch (DIY kit) and a six inch figurine of Giselle. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. More images of the 12" action figure here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/7q4zo90rq9luj9k/AAB1cyF_nSgs4VOFj3GL-IRva?dl=0

Pledge $500 or more: An original sketch from "Carbon Grey". A twelve inch action figure of Giselle. A twelve inch figurine of Giselle (DIY kit) A six inch figurine of Giselle, fully painted. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers. See more images of Giselle's action figure here: 

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/7q4zo90rq9luj9k/AAB1cyF_nSgs4VOFj3GL-IRva?dl=0

Included a twelve inch action figure of Giselle. An original sketch from "Carbon Grey" A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A twelve inch figurine of Giselle (DIY kit) A six inch figurine of Giselle, fully painted. Pledge $900 or more: A rare concept artbook. (this book was a proposal to get published with IMAGE Comics.) An original art page from Carbon Grey. A twelve inch action figure of Giselle. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and five screensavers.

Pledge $1100 or more: A six foot tall banner of Giselle. An original 11"x 17" art page from Carbon Grey. A twelve inch action figure of Giselle. An original sketch from "Carbon Grey". A twelve inch figurine of Giselle (DIY kit) A six inch figurine of Giselle, fully painted. A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and a screensaver.

Pursued by her enemies across the battlefields of Mitteleuropa Giselle must unravel the prophecy of the Carbon Grey -- before history itself unravels. 


Carbon Grey have been over eleven years in the making. This book meant so much to us and we wanted to do it justice by bringing all three volumes into one massive collection. Featuring gorgeous, fully-painted artwork throughout, Carbon Grey is an epic saga of honor, betrayal and redemption spanning generations. Includes all three volumes of the original series, stories from Carbon Grey: Origins, additional scenes and a new ten-page prologue."Add On" - We have a few items added, including, the "Art of Carbon Grey" - 128 pages Hardback in full colors. "Memories Lost" art book with slipcase, "Carbon Grey Trading Cards" collector set and a preview of "Metal Militia" comic, not available anywhere else. See more details here:

A physical copy of Carbon Grey Omnibus Collection. A Giselle "Nendoroid" figurine. Five signed prints and a Carbon Grey soundtrack CD. A digital PDF version of the comic and a screensaver.

Risks and challenges
We successfully completed our last three campaigns and delivered all rewards. We feel confident that we can do it again, but with any project, there are certain risks that will arise.
We have plans in placed that will mitigate these issues, however there are factors that are beyond our control, like manufacturing scheduling.
We're now using multiple toy manufactures to better schedule various products. Hopefully this will prevent delays in getting the rewards to you.
We learned a great deal from our previous three campaigns and feel confident that we'll manage any problem should it arise.
Please feel free to contact us if you have any questions or concerns.

story:
Short Summary

Enigma has been a passion project for Kimberly Moseberry (Artist and creator of Enigma) and long time comic book fan (She’s been attending comic cons since she was in high school.) Kimberly, Comic book writer and artist, has always been a fan of Noir, Sci-fi, action and post-apocalyptic stories.


LuEllen Joy Giera as Editor of Enigma2, is a published international artist, is the founder of planetcollage.net and co-founder of the Midwest Collage Society. She recently presented at the first Kolaj Fest in New Orleans in July 2018. She earned her Certificate in Drawing from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC) in 2005. LuEllen is a teacher and curator, and she teaches in-home painting parties, among many art related activities!

Demetrius Marble (Enigma2 colorist), is a freelance artist with over ten years of experience. He’s worked in a diverse array of jobs in the art field from comics, animation and much more. Demetrius is currently working as a color stylist, and has worked on many different comics, and cartoons.  Working with him on this comic has been one of the most gratifying experiences.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our team has worked hard in order to make the second issue of Enigma much better than the first.  Better art, and storytelling which is all done by our wonderful team Demetrius Marble, our Colorist, LuEllen Joy Giera, Editor,  and Kimberly Moseberry, Creator and artist of Enigma.

As a thank you for your kind donations, we offer posters, digital comics, physical copies of the comic, T-Shirts, buttons and stickers. Signed copies of some of the pages from the second issue of our comic will be available ! 

Impact

  Enigma2 has a small, yet dedicated team, working together. Each member will bring their best work to the table so you, the audience, can have something you can enjoy for years to come. Our team is diverse, with each member being a professional in their field. We're working to bring more diversity into the indie sci-fi, noir and action part of the comics.

 Challenges

The challenging part of this project was finding the right team to work with on Enigma2. With this dynamic team, we can now push forward and give the fans the great comic this need and deserve!

Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? That's fine. There are other ways to help spread the word. You can do your part by please sharing our link and asking others to donate.

Our team is diverse, with each member being a professional in their field. We're working to bring more diversity into the indie sci-fi, noir and action part of the comics.

 Challenges
The challenging part of this project was finding the right team to work with on Enigma2. With this dynamic team, we can now push forward and give the fans the great comic this need and deserve!

Ways You Can HelpCan't donate? That's fine. There are other ways to help spread the word. You can do your part by please sharing our link and asking others to donate.

story:
Ooh, what's this?

In the tradition of alternative comics, BALACLAVA JUNCTION combines biography and local history to explore one of Melbourne’s most unique and charming locales, home to the majority of the state’s JEWISH COMMUNITY.

From interviews with singer-songwriter SHELLEY SEGAL, whose 'An Atheist Album 'took unbelievers by storm, and RAPHAEL ARON, author of five books including 'Cults: Too Good to be True' (Harper Collins 1999) and 'Cults. Terror and Mind Control' (Bay Tree 2009), an expert on cults and mind control, BALACLAVA JUNCTION asks us to reimagine our familiar avenues, schoolyards, and hangouts, as brimming with story, mystery, and philosophy.

We're aiming to complete the book by 2014, in order to achieve this goal we need your support. Funds raised are for development and completion of the art, first batch of printing, (ideally a classy hardcover), some distribution, perks, and indiegogo fees.

 

Aha. And just who are you and what gives you the right to do this?

CREATIVES :

TED JANET is a Melbourne based grumpy screenwriter who grew tired of waiting around for gatekeepers to make decisions for him, and decided to take his craft to the realm of indie seq-art.

EDWARD ROCHA is an illustrator, animator, and just a jolly hoot. He lives with his XBox and three brothers.

 

SUBJECTS :

TED JANET is the subject of the first chapter of a comic book written by Ted Janet and illustrated by Edward Rocha. His auto-biographical body is more angular than his three-dimensional iteration, and he’s the life of the page.

SHELLEY SEGAL is a singer-songwriter whose ‘An Atheist Album’ took unbelievers by storm. Raised in a religious Jewish home, her musical journey of unbelief has taken her to the podium at Washington DC’s reason rally, and to major secular conferences around the world. Ask her about the salamander.

RAPHAEL ‘TAFFY’ ARON is a drug and cult exit counsellor, the director of CultConsulting Australia, and the author of several books. He is a sought-after public speaker and over the years has cultivated an above-average beard.

CHAPTER FOUR is a secret. Few know the truth of it, and some say it's better left unknown. The ramifications of publishing chapter four, the implications for humanity -- well -- let's just say we better be prepared. Or something. Chapter Four will be different and awesome.

 

 

So, my helping you = PRESENTS ? 

That's right. We've a host of sweet goodies available, starting with the book itself. There's the DIGITAL COPY, which, climbing some tiers, comes with BONUS MATERIAL including ORIGINAL SCRIPT AND SKETCHES, 

HARD COPY which we mean to be a prestigious HARDCOVER should we meet our goal.

BALACLAVA JUNCTION : THE LOST TALES. Strange side stories that were too quirky for the main text. These are things that one wouldn't write down, unless you're us. So far LOST TALES #1 is written. If we get close to our goal we'll unearth some more.

Ever wanted to be a COMIC BOOK CHARACTER? Now's your chance. For a limited number of supporters, there's the opportunity to have a speaking character inspired by their likeness featured in the text. Our highest tier involves getting your own SPIN OFF -- that's serious business.

Those who select the MUSICAL THANK YOU tier will get exclusive access to a MUSICAL THANK YOU video, specially recorded by the lady herself, SHELLEY SEGAL.

Finally, if you're super generous, come PARTY with us. We're bundles of fun and everyone at the LAUNCH PARTY will know that YOU'RE A HERO.

What's that? You want me to tell my friends too? Oy.

We are gallivanting about social media and online forums. You can

facebook.com/balaclavajunction

Tweet @balaclavajunct

tedjanet.com/balaclavajunction

balaclavajunction@gmail.com

youtube.com/balaclavajunction

Screaming > Balaclava Road

 

There. I've pledged. Happy now? Why thank you. That's so nice of you to say. I am amazing. 

You really are amazing. I'm noticing right now the exquisite beauty of your person. Bless you.

Much gratitude.

story:
Lindsay Gonzales has been performing theatre, stand-up and improv for many years, but what she wants more than anything is to perform in national and international comedy festivals.

 

She has performed in 8 countries so far:  The USA, England, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, Canada, Chile and Puerto Rico and at such festivals as The Women in Comedy Festival, The Boston Improv Festival, Geek Week, Impro Mundial Chile and The Portland Improv Festival. Lindsay Gonzales debuted her original one-woman show "M.P.H." in 2006 and the show is a mixture of stand-up, performance art, public education and song & dance.  Her show is a whimsical collage of stand-up, improv, sketch - “M.P.H.: It’s never the same show twice. It’s never the same show once.”

 

Lindsay:

 

I've made a lot of progress...I've had tremendous setbacks and losses, and many people in my position would have given up- but I refuse to. I know I can put every ounce of energy I have into finding what Joy I can in this life and making it through in the best way I know how: by making strangers laugh. That’s all I ever want to do.  I know life is short and I know I have not accomplished as much as I set out to do, but I just really want to get out there and do my best and reclaim the life I want to lead…and most importantly, make ‘em laugh.

story:
Amryl Dark Entertainment returns to Indiegogo with the exciting followup to our last successful campaign here for Cavewoman: Metal Age #1! Now it is time for the action-packed, no holds barred conclusion to the story with Cavewoman: Metal Age #2! 

Cavewoman: Metal Age was the first official title launched under the new Amryl Dark banner. Our first campaign last year for issue #1 was a great success and this follow up campaign will deliver the badass concluding chapter of this 2-issue series of ours! Like our previous book, Cavewoman: Metal Age #2 will be 24 pages of a wild, action-packed, pure adrenaline story!

 

STORY SYNOPSIS:

Meriem, our fearless Cavewoman, returns to Limbo with Sir Henry by her side, who is a Knight out of time that has pledged his loyalty to her as a life-debt for her saving him the previous night. Together the 2 of them cross the badlands of Limbo in search of these Lords of Limbo. Eventually making it to the castle of Lord Heinous, General of the Armies of Limbo, they manage to sneak inside and spy on Lord Heinous and even Malevolence herself before all hell breaks loose! 

Now they must fight their way through an army of demons and the evil General himself! Meriem is about to learn just why these monsters are the Lords of Limbo! Much blood will be shed and it quickly goes from a fight to the death to a race for their lives. Will anyone be able to make it out alive before the portal closes! One thing is for sure, after this experience, nothing will ever be the same for our Cavewoman!

 

HERE'S A PREVIEW OF PAGES 1-5!

 

THE COVERS:

The incredible cover variants for Cavewoman: Metal Age #1 are done by some incredible indie comics talents including Andrew Mangum, Bill Maus, Budd Root, Izik Bell, Rob Doria, Nick Nix, and Devon Massey!

 

We also have these incredible b&w original line art editions, exclusive to our crowdfunding campaigns! They are all scanned from the original art before being painted or digitally colored.

 

The standard cover editions for retail and Indiegogo are essentially the same on the front, so the main difference is at retail there is only one option for each variant cover, and here you can choose topless or not, b&w line art edition, or to even enhance the cover as a Metal, Silver, or Volcano Chrome!

Our incredible covers for this campaign come from some of the best! We have Covers A, B, C, & J by Andrew Mangum,  Cover D in Clean or Naughty options by Bill Maus, covers E & F in Clean or Naughty options as well as Cover M by Budd Root, Cover G Izik Bell, Cover H by Rob Doria, Cover I in Clean or Naughty by Nick Nix, and last but not least Covers K & L in Clean or Naughty by Devon Massey!

Andrew Mangum that will also have the special Premium Silver Wraparound part 2 cover that combines with the wraparound from #1 to form a huge 4-cover image. 

Here is how all the variant covers will work:

~Cover A is the mass market cover and will not be limited and numbered like the rest.

~The Clean/Regular covers are all limited to 200 copies and cost $15.

~The Naughty/Topless covers are limited to 150 copies and cost $20.

~The b&w original line art editions are limited to 100 copies and cost $20.

~All the Enhanced Edition (Metal, Silver, or Chrome) covers will be limited to 60 copies each! They will feature virgin images of the chosen cover without titles or trade dress and will cost $40.

~The deluxe Silver Wraparound covers featuring the Lords of Limbo are $50 each and limited to 200 copies. They will not be numbered or have any trade dress on it at all, making it a virgin wraparound.

~All variants except cover A will have the print total limit printed on them, same as last time, but without the individual serial numbering.

 

 

Enhanced cover sample videos on YouTube. These give you a much better idea of what the enhanced cover books look like in Chrome, Metal, and Silver versions. These are uncensored so we have to age restrict them and only show them on YouTube to comply with IGG rules.

 

Here are all the single Perk levels we have to offer besides just the main variant covers above, including money saving bundles!

 

DIGITAL COMICS:

 

CUSTOM METAL AGE T-SHIRT & COMIC:

 

LIMITED EDITION ASHCAN:

 

ENHANCED EDITIONS IN METAL, SILVER, AND VOLCANO CHROME:

Metal Enhanced is a full sheet of shiny metal for the cover. Silver Enhanced looks kind of like a flat chromium without the embossing dots that give the depth. Volcano Chrome Enhanced has a splotchy rainbow effect that looks awesome!

(samples above from previous campaigns. They are Metal, Silver, and Volcano Chrome)

 

Special Silver Wraparound covers for Metal Age #1 & #2 combine for a giant 4-cover image!

 

Money saving bundles!

 

Comic Reseller bundles for a crazy deal!

 

                  *ORIGINAL ART LEVELS AVAILABLE! COVERS, PAGES, & SKETCHES!*

We will offer several Original Art pledge levels similar to before. So not only are there opportunities to get sketches and original interior pages art and a cover, but this time we are making 2 of Andrew's covers available in the campaign! 

Below are the 2 Original Cover Art pieces available, cover B on the left and cover J (Naughty version) on the right! (shown censored here only, black bar is not on the actual art)

 

*There are also these fantastic Original Art interior page pledge levels!*

                                          

 

                                     **ADD-ONS AVAILABLE FOR THIS CAMPAIGN!**

 

CAVEWOMAN FAN PACK:

We have put together a little fun pack of Cavewoman goodies for the discerning fans for only $5. The pack includes a 7"x10" Calendar card with art by Budd Root, a 1.5"x3" temporary tattoo with art by Devon Massey, a 1.5" button with art by Izik Bell, and a Fridge Magnet with art by Andrew Mangum! All for just $5!

 

PREVIOUS COMICS:

Cavewoman: Metal Age #1 was our first campaign launched last year to great success. We want people to be able to get the whole story, so we are offering Metal Age #1 cover A as an add-on for $8. 

 

We also have some of the Premium Silver Wraparound cover to issue 1 of Metal Age by Andrew Mangum featuring the Lords of Limbo. This wraparound cover from issue 1 combines with the wraparound cover to issue 2 (available in the campaign) and together they form a huge 4-cover image of the 4 Lords of Limbo! We have a limited amount of them left of the original 200 we made and it is available as an add-on for $50 or as a set of both for $100!

 

This special b&w preview edition of Metal Age #1 in the Fanexpo Dallas 2020 edition with the special pencil art cover by Andrew. We printed 100 of these for the 2020 show in March of this year, and then everything shut down and the con was cancelled. So we have used them as Bloody Remarks and now ink remarks, but you can still just get one of the regular copies without the drawing on it for just $20 in the add-ons!

 

Cavewoman: Razor's Run was released in comic stores everywhere in February 2019, before the Amryl Dark imprint, and featured the return of Razor & Morbid Angel to comics as well as introduced Malevolence, the ultimate evil of the Amryl Dark Universe! The AD Universe starts in this book and it sets up everything for Cavewoman: Metal Age and the upcoming Razor: Afterlife series which follows next, so we wanted to make the starting issue available here as well, as an add-on. That way you can enjoy the journey from the very beginning. Cavewoman: Razor's Run is b&w and 24 pages, like all typical Cavewoman comics, but Amryl Dark books will always be in color from now on under the new imprint. Only cover A is available here, for $5. 

 

METAL TRADING CARDS:

The Cavewoman: Metal Age METAL TRADING CARDS are back by popular demand! The metal trading cards were offered in our last campaign and we will be making them available as a set for purchase again so they can also be added for $10 to any physically shipping reward level. These are standard sized trading cards printed on actual metal sheets! They feature "Metal Age Meriem" and "Malevolence, the ultimate evil." 

 

TRADING CARDS:

The 4 Lords of Limbo character trading cards are available as an add-on for the complete set for $10. The 4-card set gives a background bio on each of the Lords and insight you wouldn't have otherwise.

 

PRINTS:

We have 3 options on prints now. First we have the 4x6 mini prints set of all 13 uncensored covers as a set for $25. Some of them will be used as stretch goals for the campaign but this way you can get all of them!

 

11x17 cover art prints!

We also have the full 11x17 limited prints available for either $10 each or all 13 uncensored prints for $100. Shipping will be added with this item as they ship separately from everything else in a protective hard tube. So this add-on has it's own shipping charge in addition to your pledge level's shipping.

 

Lords of Limbo 11x17 Print set!

We have added the 4-panel Lords of Limbo image we used for the wraparound covers to the prints! So you can add a set of all 4 to form the huge image, or you can buy the single prints under the single 11x17 print for $10 add-on instead. 

 

WHO WE ARE:

Amryl Dark Entertainment in a new imprint of Amryl Entertainment, the longtime publisher of Cavewoman comics for over 2 decades. This new imprint is completely independent from the Amryl Universe, and will offer a different, darker take on the Cavewoman character as well as explore the new shared universe with Razor and the returning London Night universe of characters that will soon be relaunching as well under Amryl Dark. This "parallel world" will be darker, the tales will be bigger, and the stories & characters will connect in exciting new ways. Amryl Dark will change the status quo, but unlike most reboots we will not be throwing out the existing history of Cavewoman or Razor, but rather building upon what is already established  and taking that in a new and exciting direction. You are in for a wild ride with Amryl Dark Entertainment!

 

Meet the Amryl Dark Entertainment team:

Dave Kopecki – Writer & Editor

Andrew Mangum – Artist & Art Director

McLain McGuire – Lettering & Graphics   

Kevin Alsop - Publisher

The Amryl Dark imprint is overseen and managed by Dave Kopecki as the Writer & Editor of the line, Andrew Mangum handles the art and oversees Art Direction for the entire line, and McLain McGuire handles all the lettering, graphics, and design.

We three independently produce and deliver the finished product to the publisher at Amryl Entertainment, who prints and distributes the books for us under our imprint. We do not even solicit our books until they are already completed so that we always deliver as promised. As such, our books will be released as a series of one-shots or miniseries rather than regular monthly comic books.

 

OUR MISSION:

Our goal is to deliver fun, '90s-style comic books! We love how comics used to be in the '90s heyday, as opposed to the more traditional modern storytelling in comics that are "written for trade" and that slowly build over 6 issues or more to tell a story. Each series we do will be a 1 or 2-issue self contained story while also part of the larger whole of an interconnected universe.

 

OUR SOCIAL MEDIA:

Check us out on the following pages!

Amryl Dark Entertainment has its own Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/amryldarkentertainment 

Cavewoman Comics also has its own Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/cavewomancomics 

Follow Amryl Entertainment on Twitter - https://twitter.com/amrylent

Follow Amryl Entertainment on Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/amrylent/

These are standard sized trading cards printed on actual metal sheets! They feature "Metal Age Meriem" and "Malevolence, the ultimate evil."  TRADING CARDS:The 4 Lords of Limbo character trading cards are available as an add-on for the complete set for $10. The 4-card set gives a background bio on each of the Lords and insight you wouldn't have otherwise. PRINTS:We have 3 options on prints now. First we have the 4x6 mini prints set of all 13 uncensored covers as a set for $25. Some of them will be used as stretch goals for the campaign but this way you can get all of them! 11x17 cover art prints!We also have the full 11x17 limited prints available for either $10 each or all 13 uncensored prints for $100. Shipping will be added with this item as they ship separately from everything else in a protective hard tube. So this add-on has it's own shipping charge in addition to your pledge level's shipping. Lords of Limbo 11x17 Print set!We have added the 4-panel Lords of Limbo image we used for the wraparound covers to the prints! So you can add a set of all 4 to form the huge image, or you can buy the single prints under the single 11x17 print for $10 add-on instead.  WHO WE ARE:Amryl Dark Entertainment in a new imprint of Amryl Entertainment, the longtime publisher of Cavewoman comics for over 2 decades. This new imprint is completely independent from the Amryl Universe, and will offer a different, darker take on the Cavewoman character as well as explore the new shared universe with Razor and the returning London Night universe of characters that will soon be relaunching as well under Amryl Dark. This "parallel world" will be darker, the tales will be bigger, and the stories & characters will connect in exciting new ways. Amryl Dark will change the status quo, but unlike most reboots we will not be throwing out the existing history of Cavewoman or Razor, but rather building upon what is already established  and taking that in a new and exciting direction. You are in for a wild ride with Amryl Dark Entertainment! Meet the Amryl Dark Entertainment team:Dave Kopecki – Writer & EditorAndrew Mangum – Artist & Art DirectorMcLain McGuire – Lettering & Graphics   Kevin Alsop - PublisherThe Amryl Dark imprint is overseen and managed by Dave Kopecki as the Writer & Editor of the line, Andrew Mangum handles the art and oversees Art Direction for the entire line, and McLain McGuire handles all the lettering, graphics, and design.We three independently produce and deliver the finished product to the publisher at Amryl Entertainment, who prints and distributes the books for us under our imprint. We do not even solicit our books until they are already completed so that we always deliver as promised. As such, our books will be released as a series of one-shots or miniseries rather than regular monthly comic books. OUR MISSION:Our goal is to deliver fun, '90s-style comic books! We love how comics used to be in the '90s heyday, as opposed to the more traditional modern storytelling in comics that are "written for trade" and that slowly build over 6 issues or more to tell a story. Each series we do will be a 1 or 2-issue self contained story while also part of the larger whole of an interconnected universe. OUR SOCIAL MEDIA:Check us out on the following pages!Amryl Dark Entertainment has its own Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/amryldarkentertainment Cavewoman Comics also has its own Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/cavewomancomics Follow Amryl Entertainment on Twitter - https://twitter.com/amrylentFollow Amryl Entertainment on Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/amrylent/

story:
Following up on successful publishing campaigns for the P. Craig Russell Sketchbook Archives and a trio of Fine Art Editions, we're proud to announce the pre-order campaign for our fifth hardcover art book—101 Drawings by P. Craig Russell!

This oversized 12x12 inch hardcover features the crème de la crème of P. Craig Russell's black and white illustrations from the past 45-47 years—carefully chosen by the artist himself and presented in chronological order. The book also includes a number of all-new images that will be appearing in print for the very first time. Each and every book purchased via this campaign will be personally signed by P. Craig Russell!  The book is expected to be approximately 112-120 pages.

P. CRAIG RUSSELL: "I think artists especially like seeing the work in black and white—the line work before color is added. It gives it another dimension and it’s just fun to see. In addition to a carefully curated collection of vintage illustrations, the book will include recent pieces that we’ve done for our crowdfunding adventures over the past few years, various commissions that were created as original art rewards. Also, all of the new black and white squares that I’ve done this year—I’ve just finished the 7th one—will be seen for the very first time. I haven’t counted yet, but I would say that out of 101 drawings, a good 25-30% are pieces that haven’t seen print before."

Sample Illustrations From The Book

 

 

 

 

 

About The Artist

A graduate of the University of Cincinnati with a degree in painting, P. Craig Russell has run the gamut in comics. After establishing a name for himself at Marvel on Killraven and Dr. Strange, he went on to become one of the pioneers who opened new vistas for this underestimated field with, among other works, adaptations of operas by Mozart ("The Magic Flute"), Strauss ("Salome") and Wagner ("The Ring of the Nibelung"). Russell is also known for his Fairy Tales of Oscar Wilde series as well as his graphic novel adaptations of Neil Gaiman’s Coraline, Murder Mysteries and American Gods.


Shipping Information

Orders shipped outside of the United States will almost always be charged customs fees when they arrive. These fees may include taxes, duties, processing fees, brokerage fees, etc. We have no control over the amount or assessment of these fees. We will not mark items as a "gift." If you are not familiar with the customs laws and fees in your country, please check with your local customs office for more information.

It is possible that the delivery of your order could be delayed due to customs processing. If your order does not arrive in a reasonable amount of time, you should check with your local customs office to see if they are holding the package for payment of fees.

We know that international shipping has gotten very expensive, but unfortunately that is out of our control. We make no money from the shipping fees and actually end up subsidizing some of the shipping costs due to campaign fees, credit card processing fees, packaging costs, etc.
