story:
L’Associazione Culturale Cagliostro E-Press fa fumetti e valorizza autori dal 2005. In 11 anni abbiamo pubblicato più di 130 libri e 300 autori. Di questi, oggi circa 30 lavorano per Bonelli, Star, Aurea, Marvel e mercati francofoni.

Dal 2014, Cagliostro E-Press, in concomitanza con la principale fiera italiana del fumetto Lucca Comics & Games, allestisce un proprio spazio espositivo autonomo e autogestito fuori dai padiglioni: SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO.

Allo SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO, in due edizioni, abbiamo organizzato più di 40 eventi tra workshop, presentazioni librarie, aperitivi a tema e sessioni di disegno e di firma coinvolgendo diverse centinaia di lettori venuti a seguire le attività del nostro piccolo showroom del fumetto nel centro storico lucchese.

Per fare crescere lo SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO adesso ci rivolgiamo a voi che, acquistando in prevendita scontata le nostre novità editoriali in uscita a Lucca, contribuirete a realizzare anche quest’anno, il terzo, la nostra piccola utopia di uno spazio autonomo e indipendente calato all’interno della città del fumetto per eccellenza, durante la kermesse arrivata  alla cinquantesima edizione: il Lucca Comics and Games.

Quest’anno, lo SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO si troverà a Lucca in Piazzetta dell’Arancio 25 dal 28 ottobre al 1 novembre 2016.

Per allestire questa edizione dello SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO ci siamo prefissati di raccogliere 3200 Euro così divisi:

  • 1500 euro per affitto, trasporto e allestimento;
  • 1000 euro per le stampe dei volumi in uscita a Lucca;
  • 700 euro di tasse, oneri legali e spedizioni.

Per realizzare il nostro obiettivo, come perk, mettiamo in prevendita a prezzi scontati i nostri volumi a fumetti di prossima uscita:

  • Daryl Dark Stagione #02;
  • Incrociatore Stellare “E.Salgari” Stagione #01;
  • Mr. Holmes & Dr. Watson #02;
  • Occidente Omnibus #01;
  • Le avventure dell’Uomo Bagno #01.

I volumi si potranno ritirare a Lucca presso lo SPAZIO CAGLIOSTRO dal 28 ottobre al 1 novembre 2016. E chi non potrà venire a Lucca riceverà i volumi comodamente a casa sua dal 3 novembre in poi, spese di spedizione incluse nel prezzo.

Il vostro contributo è importantissimo per supportare il fumetto alternativo italiano e i nuovi talenti che mettono tutto il loro impegno nella realizzazione di opere su cui lo staff di Cagliostro E-Press lavora con serietà per garantire editing e soluzioni che nulla lasciano all’improvvisazione.

Daryl Dark Stagione  #02: L’esordio di questo investigatore del paranormale, trisnipote di Sherlock Holmes, e del suo assistente americano dal grilletto facile nel 2015 è stato accompagnato da critiche, estimatori e una buona dose di haters. Dopo il successo di vendite dell’anno scorso è giunto il momento di osare ancora di più con una Seconda Stagione ricca di intrighi, casi più bizzarri e nuovi retroscena nella vita dell’irregolare di Baker Street. Come evolverà il rapporto fra Daryl e Jane Marple? Quali trame ha ideato il perfido Koschei? Rendetelo possibile,  vi basta una donazione  e ne vedrete delle belle!

Incrociatore Stellare “E.Salgari” Stagione #01: Questa non è solo un’altra serie fantascientifica, questa è una serie di ambientazione tutta ITALIANA! L’equipaggio della "E. Salgari" aspetta solo voi per salpare negli spazi siderali. Un manipolo di uomini dal carattere diverso, ma animati dallo stesso spirito coraggioso dovrà affrontare i pericoli di una guerra nella galassia. Un prete ubriacone, giovani cadetti e un anziano mentore pronti a disubbidire agli ordini dei superiori per salvare la loro nave spaziale.

Mr. Holmes & Dr. Watson Stagione #02: amanti del Weird e dei gialli procedurali, non fatevi sfuggire l’occasione di contribuire alla realizzazione di quest’opera dal sapore retro ma con colpi di scena degni di un moderno serial! Vi chiedete se è il caso di contribuire? Elementare, certo che sì!

Occidente Omnibus #01: Torna l’adattamento a fumetti delle opere di Mario Farneti, l’autore dell’ucronia italiana acclamato anche nel Regno Unito. Questa è una occasione imperdibile per godervi completamente la graphic novel più chiacchierata di Italia in una nuova veste!

Le avventure dell’Uomo Bagno #01: Se avete dato un’occhiata alle tavole che vengono pubblicate settimanalmente on line,  non c’è bisogno di dirvi che la versione cartacea è un must! L’Uomo  Bagno, supereroe eccentrico e bizzarro, è la nuova frontiera dell’umorismo demenziale con uno stile grafico ben preciso e originale!

Lo Spazio Cagliostro, infine, è un’occasione per conoscere dal vivo chi lavora e collabora in questa realtà editoriale, farsi due chiacchiere con gli autori e gli editor e stare in un ambiente familiare dove il fumetto non è roba da McDonald, ma trattato con passione e rispetto da veri estimatori della Nona Arte.

Perché porre fiducia nella Cagliostro E-Press?

Perché da 11 anni si occupa di fumetto, e quindi, pur sperimentando e prendendosi dei rischi ha sempre agito nel massimo della trasparenza investendo in nuovi talenti, non avendo mai paura di produrre opere di nicchia, all’avanguardia o politicamente scorrette.

Perché l’esperienza dello Spazio Cagliostro è ben collaudata e chi l’ha toccata con mano ne è rimasto piacevolmente soddisfatto.

Vi va di darci una mano ulteriore?

Spargete la voce su questa campagna, ditelo a più gente possibile. Spammate e diffondete, al massimo qualche amico che è più interessato a Masterchef che ai fumetti vi manderà al diavolo, ma quello che è un click  per voi è vitale per noi! Quindi non esitate a utilizzare gli strumenti di condivisione di Indiegogo!

My series Awkward Hades is first and foremost a webcomic, and will remain online even if the book is published ! But having a book to offer to the fans who supported me all along would be a dream come true !

And for you my friends, I want the best : I want to make a beautiful, hardcover quality book with new visuals, new colors, new backgrounds, and a gallery of gorgeous guest-illustrations !



With this I'll be able to print  500 copies of a hardcover, quality book. Then the shipping ping-pong game between me, the printer, and you, begins ! There are no stretch goals, but all extra munniez you send will be greatly appreciated to feed myself. Because eating is great.


The book itself of course ! Around 60 pages with a solid hardcover, with the strips re-adapted to fit a cute 21x21cm format !

Magnets ! Thanks to the magical power of the Gods, you can stick these awesome square pictures to any metallic surface ! 3 magnets per pack !

Original sketches ! I've retrieved around 50 sketches I used to craft the comic - and other godly shenanigans - just for you ! They're more or less clean, but all of  them have been done with passion and could even contain a bit of my DNA if you want to attempt to clone me ! They're gonna be sent randomly so nobody gets jealous if they cant have their favourite strip !

Thank you all so very much for your support since the beginning of this comic! I'm always happy to make you laugh with my stupid gods, and can't wait to turn the pages of their silly adventures !

Please spread the word ! And see you soon !

Love,

Poly.

story:
Purgcomic.com

Help me make my second book and put my two books to print. Purg is a horror/cyberpunk comic.

Summary

Hi, I am J Murrin, a Canadian freelance illustrator and Comic book artist. 

Purg is my original story, I write, ink, and paint it all, and I need your help to bring my story into the world.

It has been a dream of mine to tell this story in comic format for years.  I completed book 1 which is viewable for free online http://www.purgcomic.com , there is also a .cbr file you can download on the page to view it anywhere. Warning: mature viewers suggested. 

Help me make this dream come true and get this book made and printed.

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to self publish and distribute 500 hundreds of copies each of book 1 and 2 in full color front to back.  As well as have time and resources to make it happen in a reasonable amount of time.  Any contribution is appreciated, even if it's just spreading the word about my comic.  Any contribution will get a big thank you and a shout out on twitter and facebook (unless you wish to be annonymous).  See the perks bellow that you'll recieve in addition to that.  The first X amount of books are free to download in .cbr format on my webpage, so anyone is welcome to them regardless of donation.

What is Purg?

Purg is set in 2040, in a city that the kids nicknamed 'Purg' out of mutual hatred for it. The world is a dark cyberpunk dystopia full of wondrous and/or terrifying technology, psychotic deceitful global corporations, riots in the overcrowded cities and marauders raping and pillaging rural areas. The rich sit in their well secured zones looking down on a city full of the lower class; those not homeless and starving in the streets are sitting in their shoddy homes hard wired into the ether, escaping the horrors of the world around them.

Something stranger and darker exists unknown to the common person - practitioners of black magic, terrifying suicide and chaos cults, secret societies, and creatures of nightmares. This story follows a gang of "malc" (malcontent) teens who, during their foolish but amusing adventures, discover that there is more to the world around them, bizarre and terrible things, things even worse than humans.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help me by spreading the word about my comic! Download the first book (on my page in .cbr format) share it with friends. Follow me on twitter, retweet me on twitter, and like me on facebook, any support is greatly appreciated. Also remember to share this with people on ingiegogo.

Twitter: @purgcomic.com  Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/purgcomiccom/280445308659418

Shipping

Anyone outside of Canada or the U.S. Plz include $5 dollars in your donation for shipping.

story:
Hey Everyone!!

So here's the deal:

As you may know, I have been touring overseas doing comedy. I did well at the Edinburgh Fringe last year, and since then I have been working tirelessly. Its been a blast, but its taken a lot of energy, sacrifice & hard work. I need to raise funds for Edinburgh, so if you enjoy my comedy (or me as a person) I hope you will consider getting a DVD, and supporting my return to the Festival!

The DVD:

"Live in Berlin" was shot in April, and its a great show with all my best material over the past year and a half. 

DVDs are $25 US (shipping included) -- 100% of profits are going towards my necessary expenses for the Edinburgh Fringe Festival (accommodation, food, flyers, etc)

You are welcome to donate more, if you are a die-hard fan. 

I'm unable to release online downloads at this time, so if you're eager to see it, this is your chance ;)

More Info About My Work:

www.danielryanspaulding.com

Thank you!!

story:
The funds that we are raising are to help bring our first FULL length issue into the world! Last year we successfully funded, via another online funding site, our first preview issue, where we introduced you to the amazing women of Chunky Girl Comics- Rosie, Candy, Sweet Pea & Sage. Now, the story has been set and it's time for these chunky and beautiful super heroes to show you what they can REALLY do!

The money raised via IndieGoGo, will ensure that the artwork, the printing and the availability of this comic book will be the same high quality of standards that were met with the Preview Issue #0. Every little bit helps! And the more we raise, the more availability we'll have! Thank you for your support!  Below is our press release, for some background information about me and Chunky Girl Comics.

Chunky Girl Comics is breaking down barriers and introducing the world of comics to Rosie, Sage, Sweet Pea and Candy, a group of ladies with curves in all of the right places that are determined to break the standards of what a typical superhero should look like.

Chunky Girl Comics is a small, independent organization based in Stockton, California comprised of husband and wife team, Jose and Marisa Garcia. A destined union at first meeting, Jose is the ever talented artist who continues to build his abilities in various mediums and Marisa, who cannot even draw a stick figure, is the creativemind behind the Heavy Response Unit and Chunky Girl Comics other creative projects. Both Garcia’s are lovers of comic art, both new and classic and after a few years of talking about starting a project together, it was in 2011 that Marisa and Jose decided to make their dreams of bringing their overweight superheroes to life and put pen to paper. With the huge help of their good friend, Grant Miller (who does the digital images and colors), the preview issue of the Heavy Response Unit was completed and made available to the public on August 5, 2012 at the Stockton-Con convention at the University of Pacific.

“I am a proud overweight woman who loves comic book art. But it was so hard to actually relate to any of the characters because no one that I’ve ever met looks like any of those women,” stated Marisa, “It was time to have characters that looked like me, had the same issues as me.”

The Heavy Response Unit storyline follows four friends who go from being happy, well adjusted, overweight women in Northern California to having to fight for equality when it essentially becomes illegal to be overweight in America. Not only are the girls curvy, but they are all of different ethnic backgrounds.

“It is so fun to write these characters because they are all so different and so strong in their own ways. They go from being confident and comfortable with their bodies to being shunned and forced into hiding. It’s basically an exaggerated take on what society has done to plus size women in the real world. I want anyone, no matter their size or race, to be able to look at these girls and find themselves in one of them,” commented Marisa.

Jose and Marisa have completed their first preview issue which introduces readers to the girls and begins to tease about what is to come. Stories are written and ideas are flowing and more products are being created in whatever spare time they can muster. Jose and Marisa have two beautiful children, Olivia, 8 and Dominic, 6. Most of their days are spent doing laundry, going to soccer and baseball practices, helping with homework, attending violin recitals and taking care of their three dogs, Manny, Oscar and Abby. But occasionally on weekends you will find the Garcia’s at comic conventions all over California sharing their comic book, stickers, prints and bracelets with comic lovers.

Future projects for Chunky Girl Comics include an anti-bullying children’s book illustrated by Miss Olivia Garcia, a Chunky Boys line and the ultimate goal is to have the Heavy Response Unit transformed into a cartoon.

“Our dream is to bring awareness to how bullying and singling out differences effects everyone, not just children. We love to celebrate women, men and children of all sizes and show that despite size and having a little extra padding, we can do all that everyone else can do!”, said Marisa, passionately. “We believe that the world of comics and cartoons are ready for this story, for these women. The feedback we’ve gotten over the last year has been extremely positive and we will keep pushing and pushing until Sage, Candy, Rosie and Sweet Pea have their place at the top! Fierce. Fab. Fluffy! Who says superheroes have to be skinny!?”

Every little bit helps! And the more we raise, the more availability we'll have! Thank you for your support!  Below is our press release, for some background information about me and Chunky Girl Comics.
Chunky Girl Comics is breaking down barriers and introducing the world of comics to Rosie, Sage, Sweet Pea and Candy, a group of ladies with curves in all of the right places that are determined to break the standards of what a typical superhero should look like.
Chunky Girl Comics is a small, independent organization based in Stockton, California comprised of husband and wife team, Jose and Marisa Garcia. A destined union at first meeting, Jose is the ever talented artist who continues to build his abilities in various mediums and Marisa, who cannot even draw a stick figure, is the creativemind behind the Heavy Response Unit and Chunky Girl Comics other creative projects. Both Garcia’s are lovers of comic art, both new and classic and after a few years of talking about starting a project together, it was in 2011 that Marisa and Jose decided to make their dreams of bringing their overweight superheroes to life and put pen to paper. With the huge help of their good friend, Grant Miller (who does the digital images and colors), the preview issue of the Heavy Response Unit was completed and made available to the public on August 5, 2012 at the Stockton-Con convention at the University of Pacific.
“I am a proud overweight woman who loves comic book art. But it was so hard to actually relate to any of the characters because no one that I’ve ever met looks like any of those women,” stated Marisa, “It was time to have characters that looked like me, had the same issues as me.” 
The Heavy Response Unit storyline follows four friends who go from being happy, well adjusted, overweight women in Northern California to having to fight for equality when it essentially becomes illegal to be overweight in America. Not only are the girls curvy, but they are all of different ethnic backgrounds.
“It is so fun to write these characters because they are all so different and so strong in their own ways. They go from being confident and comfortable with their bodies to being shunned and forced into hiding. It’s basically an exaggerated take on what society has done to plus size women in the real world. I want anyone, no matter their size or race, to be able to look at these girls and find themselves in one of them,” commented Marisa.
Jose and Marisa have completed their first preview issue which introduces readers to the girls and begins to tease about what is to come. Stories are written and ideas are flowing and more products are being created in whatever spare time they can muster. Jose and Marisa have two beautiful children, Olivia, 8 and Dominic, 6. Most of their days are spent doing laundry, going to soccer and baseball practices, helping with homework, attending violin recitals and taking care of their three dogs, Manny, Oscar and Abby. But occasionally on weekends you will find the Garcia’s at comic conventions all over California sharing their comic book, stickers, prints and bracelets with comic lovers.
Future projects for Chunky Girl Comics include an anti-bullying children’s book illustrated by Miss Olivia Garcia, a Chunky Boys line and the ultimate goal is to have the Heavy Response Unit transformed into a cartoon.
“Our dream is to bring awareness to how bullying and singling out differences effects everyone, not just children. We love to celebrate women, men and children of all sizes and show that despite size and having a little extra padding, we can do all that everyone else can do!”, said Marisa, passionately. “We believe that the world of comics and cartoons are ready for this story, for these women. The feedback we’ve gotten over the last year has been extremely positive and we will keep pushing and pushing until Sage, Candy, Rosie and Sweet Pea have their place at the top! Fierce. Fab. Fluffy! Who says superheroes have to be skinny!?”

story:
Issue One Cover by Andres Blanco and Andrew Poole

"If issue #1 and early peeks at issue #2 are any indication, Mr. Engman and crew plan on maintaining a standard of excellence that can only help this title to become a fan favorite. Check it out, it’s a read that’s well worth it!" - Mark Turner from The Examiner.com

Waitasec? Didn't you just do a Kickstarter ?

Yessir! We successfully ran a campaign for KFS! Issue 2 that ended on September 29th.

Yo! So why do another crowdfunder ?

Due to the success of the previous campaign, we've decided to extend it via Indiegogo for anyone who missed it or back only on Indiegogo. Also, I believe we can reach some more goals (like extending the pages and getting Issue 3 funded) to make KFS! the best comic as much as possible.


"We learn martial arts as helping weakness. You never fight for people to get hurt. You're always helping people."  - Jackie Chan 

Essentially a teen comedy, martial arts, and action comic, Kung Fu Skratch! is a love letter to comics,manga,martial arts, hip-hop culture, gaming, and a little bit of other things that I grew up with (you'll catch a ton of references within the comic). .

 Kung Fu Skratch! (also known as KFS!: Welcome 2 Brickhaven EP) is a black and white (with tones), six-issue, 22-24 page comic book mini-series, self-published (if we can't find a publisher within the timeframe) and distributed digitally on Comixology.

Along with wanting make a kickass martial arts comic, I truly wanted to positively introduce a diverse cast of characters of multiple ethnic and cultural backgrounds - - each of them representing the melting pot of American (if not the world) culture. 

Hip-Hop as a worldwide movement is the type of lifestyle that transcends race, religion, gender, and nationalities - - at its peak can bring people all over the world together. It also is about competition, swagger, and a rebelliousness! 

Hopefully in reading the book, the reader can find characters and stories that they can either relate to and identify with.

Aimed to teens and adults. KFS! is inspired by video games, movies,comics and animated series like Double Dragon, Streets of Rage, Final Fight, 2-D and 3-D Fighting games (ie: KOF, TEKKEN, SF) Barry Gordy's The Last Dragon, Sharknife, Kung Fu Hustle, the Scott Pilgrim series, Ranma 1/2,Samurai Champloo, Tenjo Tenge, Black Dynamite, and River City Ransom! 

What's different about the (re) release of physical copy of Issue 1 is that it'll be a Director's Cut. It will have 8-12 pages of bonus material including behind the scenes materials including character information, developmental art, sketches, script excerpts, among other things and will only be available via this campaign.

It's the story of Jason Stonewall, a teenage martial artist who has returned to the United States after training in the East for a year. Back in his hometown of Brickhaven, Jason's about start his his first freshman day of high school to run into the school's reigning tyrant, Fa'Sho! 

Now Jason must use his righteous fists of fury to take down the Gangsta Bancho and his gang, The Sho'Gunnz in a battle that will crack the school in half! 


               1

2-3

                      4

                  5             




Kung Fu Skratch! is written and created by Adrian Engmann, and is his first creator owned comics project. Issue 2's interior art is provided by the returning Erwin Prasetya (BLADE BUNNY, MONSUNO), and  Dong Zhang (SUPERNOVAS) and Steve "Kandoken" Mack. Frank Cvetkovic (MOLLY DANGER, ARTFUL DAGGERS) is on letters while Andeh Pinkard (MEGAMAIDEN, PANTY BRIGADE, SHONEN PUNK!) on design duties. 

Each and every one of the these guys are creative and help to bring the world of Kung Fu Skratch! to life and I, for one am fortunate to collaborate with. We're putting all we've got on in this book and hopefully it shows to you, the reader!


With the production and completion of Issue 1 during the year, I learned comics are fun to make but also very expensive and stressful without any type of support; especially when you are working on a independent comic and self-publishing it yourself. Through crowdfunding, I was able to fulfil my lifelong dream to create and publish a comic of my own and share it with others. The funds donated to this campaign will go towards payment for the publishing, production, and expenses towards the creative team. 



                                      The KFS! Postcard Print Set - $25




                                        AVAILABLE BONUS PERKS

We'll be continuing the same Stretch Goals that were started on the Kickstarter Campaign previously! If you donate to this campaign you'll be treated with the same  bonus perks that others on KS received!

All Tier $5 and above, will receive a 4X4 Die Cut Sticker of Steve "Kandoken" Mack's Jason Stonewall and a Postcard Print by Toshinho and signed by Adrian Engmann!



All Perks $15 and above, will receive along with their rewards a Indiegogo Exclusive Patch featuring the Sho'Gunn Skull Insignia or Jason Customized Head along with their rewards! (Note: These are the rough designs) along with a 4X4 Die Cut Sticker of the Toshinho's Jason Illo as well! 


All Perks $25 and above, will receive will receive their choice of the Indiegogo Exclusive Prints "Swagga Sketch" , "Women of KFS!" or the "New Rivals" by Andres Blanco and Erwin Prasetya along with their rewards.

All of the rewards above are available for Indiegogo contributors as well!

                                          

STRETCH GOAL #1 : $500 (LOCKED) - All $30/35 Tier Rewards and above will receive Jason Stonewall Lapel Pin! Let other ninjaz know that you're the baddest mammajamma in town!

                               Jason Stonewall Lapel

STRETCH GOAL #2: $1000 (LOCKED) - All Backers $25 and above will receive Kung Fu Skratch! Trading Cards! 

STRETCH GOAL #3: $1500 (LOCKED) - All Backers $35 and above will  receive a Brand New Variant Cover of Issue 2! Shhhh! The artist is a secret . . .

STRETCH GOAL #4: $2000 (LOCKED) - Kung Fu Skratch! Issue 1: DIRECTOR'S CUT gets expanded with 11 pages of new story! This will be available to all backers! ($5 Digital Only Backers Will Receive The Digital Version)

STRETCH GOAL #5: $2500 (LOCKED) - Kung Fu Skratch! Issue 3 FUNDED! Backers Will Receive Digital and Physical Copies along with their rewards ( $5 Digital Only Backers Will Receive The Digital Version).

 

All proceeds will go into the overall production of the comic and perks (50-65%: will go towards paying the creative team, 25%-30% for printing costs,and 10% in other expenses). Everything we earn will go towards making KFS! a better comic than originally conceived.

Issue 2 is 45% complete, the entire story arc for KFS! #1-6 is written, all that we need is to get the word out, attention to the campaign, and not get lost in the shuffle. To be honest, the lack of attention seems to be thing that's hurting us and I believe too much in this project to see it fail.

Other than that, we have Steve, Dong, Erwin on art duties so threre shouldn't be delays on that department, along with Andeh and Frank design/lettering.

We're all professionals and ready to roll - - we're awesome like that.

story:
Hi everyone!
My name is Melia, and my favorite thing in the world is comedy. I have always loved to make people laugh. All I want to do in this world is make other people's lives better by bringing laughter. It's what I can offer. 

Anyone who knows me knows how much I love Saturday Night Live, improv, and just comedy in general. It's truly my dream to be a comedian, and get to make people laugh for a living.

BUT, in order to get to where I want to go I need to take improv classes. I've started classes with two different improv schools in Los Angeles. One is called The Upright Citizen's Brigade (UCB) and it was started by Amy Poehler in New York in the late 90s. The other school is called The Groundlings, and it's started the careers of so many hysterical people such as Will Ferrell, Kristen Wiig, and Peewee Herman! 
I went to live in LA this past summer and I fell in love with the comedy scene there. I have made it to level 3 with UCB, and even passed the Basic level at The Groundlings on my first try! 

I am back at school now, getting a degree, gathering experience, and I cannot wait to head back to LA to keep pursuing my dreams. But in order to give it my all, it's going to take some money. I have a job, and I'm saving every penny that I have, but it would mean so much to me if you guys could chip in a little. I'll love you forever, and I'll thank you in my Emmy acceptance speech!

I'll love you forever, and I'll thank you in my Emmy acceptance speech!

story:
Preorder your copy of the second Bardsworth collection and help fund the printing of it!

"What the heck is Bardsworth?"

Bardsworth is an all-ages webcomic that has been updating since November 7, 2005.  It's the story of Mike Cosley, a high school nobody who isn't sure what he wants to do after graduating, until he finds a door in the back of his closet that leads to another world.  In this new world is a college, Bardsworth University, where one can learn magic, and Mike decides to enroll.  He gets a little more than he bargained for, though, as he becomes the victim of magical pranks, killer hugs, and the awful truth that doing magic isn't just waving a wand and saying "Abracadabra".

"And what is this 'second collection' of which you speak?"

It's just what it sounds like - it's the second collection of strips from the early days of my webcomic!  It includes fully colored strips, commentaries on each strip, and a sketch gallery with commentaries on some of the characters.  You can peek at a few of the colored strips at the gallery here on my campaign page.


"Okay, so who are you?"

While I am many things – a husband, a father, home brewer, a Cancer - I am most importantly a writer and an artist.  Okay, the husband and father parts are important, too.  And the home brewer part.  Anyway, Bardsworth was my first work of any note and one of the most successful things I've done.  I have also created fairy-themed works of art with my wife, and I've published several novels, including a Bardsworth one.  In short, I like to create and to share my creations with the world.


"Why are you asking for my hard-earned money?"

Printing a book is not cheap, and my wallet's not that deep (hey, that rhymed!).  My plan is to use this campaign as a pre-order for the book, with the hope that enough people will pre-order so that the cost of a small print run can be covered.  If not, I have a Plan B (more on that later).  But in any case, to ease your mind of the suspicion that I'm doing anything nefarious with your money, here's the simple breakdown of where it will go:

Printing Cost:  The cost to have 200 books printed and shipped to me comes out to be $2,254.50.

IndieGoGo Fees:  IndieGoGo charges a 5% fee of whatever I make.  Assuming I make my goal of $3000, the fee comes out to be $150.

Shipping/Handling Costs:  I'm setting aside $300 to cover the expenses of packing materials and shipping costs.

Misc Fees:  This $95.50 is a buffer amount to help cover third party transaction fees like credit card processing and PayPal processing fees.


"That's all well and good, but what do I get for my generous contribution?"

Well, that depends on how generous you are!

$5 Level - Freshman
You will have my sincere gratitude, and your name will appear on a "Thank You" page in the second collection.

$10 Level - Sophomore
You get my gratitude, your name on a "Thank You" page in the book, and an exclusive downloadable desktop wallpaper.

$20 Level - Junior
You get the $5 and $10 level rewards, plus a digital (PDF) copy of the second collection.

$30 Level - Senior (best value)
Rewards from all previous levels, plus a signed copy of the print collection.

$40 Level – Senior with Honors
Similar to the Senior level, but with an artist edition of the print collection (which includes a character sketch on the cover page).

$50 Level – Grad Student
All previous rewards, plus your choice of an art print (choices will be emailed after the campaign ends).

$75 Level - Professor's Assistant
All previous rewards, plus original artwork from a strip of your choice (first come, first served / based on availability)

$100 Lever - Professor
All previous rewards, plus a custom ink drawing of one character on 11"x14" Bristol board.

$150 Level – Grand Wizard, Third Class
All previous rewards, plus a one-of-a-kind custom hand-sewn Francis plushie doll!  Body will be made from felted wool sweaters and weighted so he will sit upright.  Each backer will be allowed to choose three (3) costume or accessory pieces in addition to his ripped pants.  What will it be?  A "Kiss the Cook" apron? A polymer-clay tray of cookies?   The choice is yours.  (limited to 5)

$200 Level – Spirit Bond (Media Sponsor)
You will receive one year of ad space on the Bardsworth website.  In addition, I will do monthly blog posts and social networking for you for up to a year.  I will also design one print ad (or two digital ads) to your specifications.  Restrictions apply and I retain the right of refusal for ads inappropriate to my audience.


"So, what happens if this campaign fails?"

That's a distinct possibility.  The reason I chose IndieGoGo is that regardless of whether I swim or sink, the money stays with me.  So if we don't reach the goal for the small print run, I will still be able to put the money towards a print-on-demand run of the books.  Everyone who contributes at the Senior level or beyond will be 100% guaranteed to get the print copy regardless of whether or not the campaign is successful.


"If that's the case, why don't you just do that in the first place?"

For several reasons, the biggest being that going with a small-run book printer means a higher quality product.  It will also mean that I'll have an inventory of books to continue selling online and at conventions.


"Will these be ready in time for Christmas?"

Unfortunately, no.  The campaign itself will span a month, and then we'll already be deep into December.  That's not even taking into account the time it takes to work with the printer, the time for the book to be physically printed, and the shipping time both to me and then to each individual contributor.  Even with a POD service it'll take time.  The best thing to do is to look at it as a late Christmas gift!


"What if somehow you get super-lucky and surpass your goal?  Stranger things have happened, you know."

If that should happen, I will do a happy dance on camera for everyone to see (that's a solemn promise, too).  But in addition, I do have some stretch goals with some fun rewards should that happen.

"You've convinced me, but I can't really contribute anything right now.  Can I support this campaign in any other ways?"

Yes!  Please do!  If for some reason you can't or don't want to use IndieGoGo, you can donate via PayPal on the Bardsworth website (just send me a note saying that it was specifically for the campaign so that you get your rewards).

If you can't afford to contribute to the campaign - and I completely understand that situation - please do your best to spread word of it far and wide.  Tweet it, Facebook it, Instagram it, whatever it is you crazy kids do on your mobile phones these days, just do it!  The more people who see the campaign, the more chances I have to make it a successful one.

 It includes fully colored strips, commentaries on each strip, and a sketch gallery with commentaries on some of the characters.  You can peek at a few of the colored strips at the gallery here on my campaign page."Okay, so who are you?"While I am many things – a husband, a father, home brewer, a Cancer - I am most importantly a writer and an artist.  Okay, the husband and father parts are important, too.  And the home brewer part.  Anyway, Bardsworth was my first work of any note and one of the most successful things I've done.  I have also created fairy-themed works of art with my wife, and I've published several novels, including a Bardsworth one.  In short, I like to create and to share my creations with the world."Why are you asking for my hard-earned money?"Printing a book is not cheap, and my wallet's not that deep (hey, that rhymed!).  My plan is to use this campaign as a pre-order for the book, with the hope that enough people will pre-order so that the cost of a small print run can be covered.  If not, I have a Plan B (more on that later).  But in any case, to ease your mind of the suspicion that I'm doing anything nefarious with your money, here's the simple breakdown of where it will go:Printing Cost:  The cost to have 200 books printed and shipped to me comes out to be $2,254.50.IndieGoGo Fees:  IndieGoGo charges a 5% fee of whatever I make.  Assuming I make my goal of $3000, the fee comes out to be $150.Shipping/Handling Costs:  I'm setting aside $300 to cover the expenses of packing materials and shipping costs.Misc Fees:  This $95.50 is a buffer amount to help cover third party transaction fees like credit card processing and PayPal processing fees.
"That's all well and good, but what do I get for my generous contribution?"
Well, that depends on how generous you are!$5 Level - FreshmanYou will have my sincere gratitude, and your name will appear on a "Thank You" page in the second collection.$10 Level - SophomoreYou get my gratitude, your name on a "Thank You" page in the book, and an exclusive downloadable desktop wallpaper.$20 Level - JuniorYou get the $5 and $10 level rewards, plus a digital (PDF) copy of the second collection.$30 Level - Senior (best value)Rewards from all previous levels, plus a signed copy of the print collection.$40 Level – Senior with HonorsSimilar to the Senior level, but with an artist edition of the print collection (which includes a character sketch on the cover page).$50 Level – Grad StudentAll previous rewards, plus your choice of an art print (choices will be emailed after the campaign ends).$75 Level - Professor's AssistantAll previous rewards, plus original artwork from a strip of your choice (first come, first served / based on availability)$100 Lever - ProfessorAll previous rewards, plus a custom ink drawing of one character on 11"x14" Bristol board.$150 Level – Grand Wizard, Third ClassAll previous rewards, plus a one-of-a-kind custom hand-sewn Francis plushie doll!  Body will be made from felted wool sweaters and weighted so he will sit upright.  Each backer will be allowed to choose three (3) costume or accessory pieces in addition to his ripped pants.  What will it be?  A "Kiss the Cook" apron? A polymer-clay tray of cookies?   The choice is yours.  (limited to 5)$200 Level – Spirit Bond (Media Sponsor)You will receive one year of ad space on the Bardsworth website.  In addition, I will do monthly blog posts and social networking for you for up to a year.  I will also design one print ad (or two digital ads) to your specifications.  Restrictions apply and I retain the right of refusal for ads inappropriate to my audience."So, what happens if this campaign fails?"That's a distinct possibility.  The reason I chose IndieGoGo is that regardless of whether I swim or sink, the money stays with me.  So if we don't reach the goal for the small print run, I will still be able to put the money towards a print-on-demand run of the books.  Everyone who contributes at the Senior level or beyond will be 100% guaranteed to get the print copy regardless of whether or not the campaign is successful."If that's the case, why don't you just do that in the first place?"For several reasons, the biggest being that going with a small-run book printer means a higher quality product.  It will also mean that I'll have an inventory of books to continue selling online and at conventions."Will these be ready in time for Christmas?"
Unfortunately, no.  The campaign itself will span a month, and then we'll already be deep into December.  That's not even taking into account the time it takes to work with the printer, the time for the book to be physically printed, and the shipping time both to me and then to each individual contributor.  Even with a POD service it'll take time.  The best thing to do is to look at it as a late Christmas gift!"What if somehow you get super-lucky and surpass your goal?  Stranger things have happened, you know."If that should happen, I will do a happy dance on camera for everyone to see (that's a solemn promise, too).  But in addition, I do have some stretch goals with some fun rewards should that happen."You've convinced me, but I can't really contribute anything right now.  Can I support this campaign in any other ways?"Yes!  Please do!  If for some reason you can't or don't want to use IndieGoGo, you can donate via PayPal on the Bardsworth website (just send me a note saying that it was specifically for the campaign so that you get your rewards).If you can't afford to contribute to the campaign - and I completely understand that situation - please do your best to spread word of it far and wide.  Tweet it, Facebook it, Instagram it, whatever it is you crazy kids do on your mobile phones these days, just do it!  The more people who see the campaign, the more chances I have to make it a successful one.

story:
The Unique Animated Series

MoodieVision is the unique series of short weekly animations produced by cartoonist Greg Moodie (The National, Bella Caledonia) and long-term collaborator Rose Garnett (comic-horror author of Carnalis, Strigidae Press 2016), satirising the rapidly-changing Scottish political landscape from a pro-independence perspective. See the 'Gallery' section for examples.

The first series (12 episodes) appeared on Wings Over Scotland from April this year and the second on Bella Caledonia from July. The forthcoming third series will be hosted by Common Space, one of the most important rising stars of the Scottish new media firmament.

Eccentric millionaires

As fellow cartoonist Chris Cairns noted, “we are not eccentric millionaires.” Animation is time-consuming and funds are needed simply to cover the time it takes to produce the show. 

MoodieVision Goodies

What is being offered in return - and limited to the last two weeks of November - is not only its continuation but also a one-off collector’s pack of MoodieVision goodies for subscribers, to be delivered at the end of the twelve-week run. Central to this is a limited edition DVD containing the complete third series as well as a raft of special features and other exclusive material.

In addition, the collector’s pack includes a signed limited edition print, a soundtrack album by in-house MoodieVision band The Defamators, a specially designed MoodieVision badge and The MoodieVision Companion, a mini booklet of fun facts, jokes, lies and outright libel. 

Pricking the Unionist balloons

Satire is a scarce commodity in Scottish politics, and with the election in 2016, an EU referendum and the possibility of another independence vote, it is more necessary than ever. MoodieVision is pricking the Unionist balloons and is the only animated production currently doing so. With your help we can burst them.

story:
Short Summary

People love to laugh. Harpoon Presents loves to help. Now you can help us help you with the 2nd Annual Riptide Comedy Festival in beautiful downtown Lawrence Kansas!

  • 20+ comedians from NYC, LA, Denver, Chicago, Iowa, Nebraska and more.
  • 9+ shows at 7 of Lawrence's best venues
  • 4 days
  • 1 unforgettable weekend for audiences, performers and the community alike!

Harpoon has spent the year since our inaugural festival last January producing, performing and helping run weekly and monthly comedy shows all over Lawrence and Kansas City. Now we're kicking it up a notch.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we would do with your generous support:

  • Providing travel (airfare, gasoline, etc.) for all performers
  • Lodging for all performers
  • Purchasing t-shirts and pint glasses for you!
  • Printing posters, banners, fliers, festival passes, etc.
Depending on your contribution, you can have some of everything listed above.

The Impact

Comedy around Lawrence has been limited to the local and regional talents we've loved working with, and the large TV-star comics that the University of Kansas can afford to occasionally bring. But there's a gap in between, filled elsewhere with amazing talents all over the country doing new, interesting and hilarious stuff. 

This is your chance to help us fill that gap in Kansas. If we do, everyone wins:

  • Audiences enjoy some of today's best performers
  • Performers experience and entertain a region and audiences many have never been to
  • Local comedians get to see, know and perform the big cities' best
  • Producers, performers, promoters and fans from all over 

Challenges And How To Kill Them

The logistics of bringing dozens of people to Kansas to perform months' worth of shows in a single weekend takes a lot of time, money and effort. We're more than happy to give up all of our time and effort to make it happen, but there's only so many winos we can charm and pool halls we can hustle.

We've got nearly all the arranged completed already, we're just left with greasing the wheels before we take.

And any grease you can add will only enhance the wild ride we're all in for.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money to our fundraiser, we would be more than happy with your telling your friends, family, and random social media followers about what we're trying to do.

Mostly we'd just like to thank you for reading this far!

story:
UPDATE! If you are donating internationally for the $30 Perk and up, PLEASE ADD $10 to your donation! Or if you would like to help cover the shipping costs all together, please contact me!

Quick Note* This page will have more images and previews to come! Including a short few pages to show how the final product should look!


Short Summary

Hey there! My name is Nick Brand. I have been illustrating cartoons and comics for several years now. I've spent a lot of time writing stories and perfecting my art style, and now, I feel I'm ready to share a story I've been writing for over ten years. I call this story "Spike Storm"


What is "Spike Storm"?

More like WHO is Spike Storm, however this question works too. Spike Storm centers around a teenage boy named Nicky Callaghan, who lives with his family in the city of Happydale. Their apartment actually doubles as a comic book store!

Everything was going normally for Nicky until he snuck into a weapons demonstration with the help of his best friend Axel. The demonstration was going well until the experimental weapon started going haywire, forcing everyone in the area to evacuate. Nicky was accidentally hit by the special energy surging from the experiment and was knocked out cold.

He woke up in a hospital and eventually found out that he wasn't the same “normal” boy anymore. Now lightning shoots from his hands, he has the power to control and manipulate plasma, he can run faster, jump higher, think and react to things quicker than any human being!

After quickly getting used to these abilities, he decides that with Axel's help, he will don on the name Spike Storm, and fight the criminals that plague Happydale.

However, he soon finds out that fighting petty criminals is just the tip of the iceberg when it comes to creating a super powered secret identity. He must overcome villains far more powerful than him, tend to his normal life responsibilities, maintain his new relationship with his girlfriend Meredith, and protect the innocent at all costs, all while making sure nobody discovers his secret.


Meet Spike Storm!

Many of you guys asked for a more detailed description of the main character, so here it is!
 

As mentioned above, Nicky Callaghan is a 16 year old nerd, and living in a comic book store that sells things from movies, video games and comic books definitely play a big factor in his love for these things. Nicky is a kind hearted individual, and keeps to himself, especially when he's pushed around by the bullies at his school. He usually hands out wisecracks and puns when he can. However, when under pressure, he can be very close minded, and can have a very hard time coming up with a solution to a problem.

This all changes when he gets involved with the lab accident that gives him his powers. His remarkable reaction time and improved thinking speed, while doesn't make him intelligent, does help rectify his former disability to handle situations while under stress. 

Nicky's powers also have a small side effect. Due to his faster thinking, his mind creates a second consciousness that can think on its own. It causes Nicky to hallucinate, and can see it manifest in things like mirrors and reflections in the form of Nicky himself. It talks to him and usually offers a voice of reason. Or just insults him, either way, it's here to stay!

When Nicky finally dons on the super hero name "Spike Storm", he is usually challenged with a powerful villain. Spike Storm is strong, but his villains are stronger, MUCH stronger. So Spike Storm will usually have to rely on his wits and other means besides his newfound strength to take down villains that range from a "living computer avatar", "a crazy homicidal scientist with god like powers", "a powerful mob boss with the strength to crush a human skull in his hands" to even "a rage induced cyborg from another dimension".

Can he handle it all? You'll have to help make this project a success to find out!


Supporting Cast


Axel Smith: Nicky's best friend and mechanical genius. He provides Nicky with all the help he can get when dons his Spike Storm persona. His father owns the technological/biological research facility known as "NEXTGEN".

Meredith Maye: Nicky's love interest and eventual girlfriend. She doesn't have the best lifestyle but always looks towards the positives in life.


Who are the Villains?


"Spike Storm" already has QUITE the rogues gallery planned out. However, I don't want to reveal too much. Even the description for the comic itself leaves out a lot of details for the sake of keeping a fresh spoiler free approach for the comic. As the campaign goes on, more will be revealed about the villains! Also keep in mind, these are NOT the only planned villains. These are just the ones featured in the 30 comics that will be covered by the initial goal! I have a lot more awesome villains and arcs planned that I really hope come to fruition. 

Raj Malek
Cannonball
PR0X1E
Mastermind
Snake Eyes
Muck Monster
Darkspine


How will this comic be presented?


Spike Storm will play out in story arcs. There will be a main conflict and overarching story in each arc which is spread out in about 10 comics per arc. The comics will be released digitally only. The reason I have chosen this method of publishing is because I would have to double or even triple the main goal budget if I were to physically print them. Plus, I feel the comic has a better home on the 'net for now. I DO plan on releasing some physical copies, quite possibly in the style of graphic novel collections, but that's an indiegogo for another day.

How will these comics be published? 


We currently are planning to upload the comics in the form of eBooks to iBooks, Amazon, the Kindle Store, and possibly our own website which will only require a paypal button per comic.

 

Special Charity Give Back!

One thing I feel I should also mention is that if this project is successful, I plan on donating all of the profits for the first issue of "Spike Storm" to St. Jude Children's Hospital!


What will the donations be going towards?

Let's face it, I'm just one guy, and I can't get everything done on my own. I have WAY too many ideas to chug out, and getting a page just penciled takes about half a day. So I got two amazing people on my team to help me with the coloring and inking while I focus on EVERY OTHER POSSIBLE THING THAT GOES INTO MAKING A COMIC BOOK.  They can't work for free, I won't allow for that either, so they will be getting paid per comic we make.

Other necessities include supplies, starting with basic stuff like pencils and paper up to Wacom tablets (colorist is currently using a track pad on her laptop... that's no good) We also need a few spares just in case any of them die off on us while we are working. The money is to also help cover the costs of ISBN numbers, the tools required to publish these books online, and to cover the donator perks. 

In total, the main goal will cover the cost to make 30 comics. That's 3 story arcs right there!

(Just some shots of the comic itself! This can't happen without you guys!)

What happens after you reach 30 comics?

I plan on funding future issues through the profits the comic will hopefully make. The comics won't be very expensive. I feel $1.99 per comic that gets published is standard for most digital comic books. I do plan on setting stretch goals to guarantee said future installments. The more money that gets donated, the more comics we can absolutely guarantee!

What about donator perks?

I have every intention on rewarding you guys with donator perks. I have things lined up from personalized drawings from myself, to autographed posters to t-shirts and even getting yourself a small role in the comic itself! To learn more about the perks, either read them on the side or shoot me an email at supernickbrand@gmail.com. I should be able to answer any question you've got.

Risks and Challenges

Luckily, thanks to the marvels of self publishing and crowdfunding websites, the one thing I fear most, losing the rights to my stories and ideas, is ideally LESS likely to happen than if I were to present the idea to a company or publisher. As far as challenges go, when it comes to a thing like making a comic book, I have to make sure the quality is the best that my team can provide. I've been working on starting this thing for the better part of five months, and both myself and my team are super excited to get it started! So, if you've made it this far in my description, thanks a lot, and I really hope you can help me achieve my lifelong dream!


Short Comic: (COMING SOON!)


(Short Disclaimer)

Please note that all above images above are works in progress and do not represent the final product, we will be using up all the time we need to make every image as decent as possible

story:
About Sean Eike

Thank you for taking the time to view my project!

 

I am an illustrator from Des Moines, Iowa. After getting a Graphic Design and Fine Arts degree from Grand View College (now Grand View University) in 2003, I decided that the world of corporate or industrial design was not for me. So I signed up for a crash-course year at The Kubert School in Dover, New Jersey and found my love for comic book art.

 

For the better part of 10 years I worked on projects that did not have much recognition or that I did not receive credit for. After the death of my hero, Joe Kubert in August of 2012, I decided to take my career into my own hands. So I started work on my series "Rocket Transfer's Secret Files"... a series that is print-on-demand with Black and White artwork.

 

"Rage Against Hel" is a story that I have wanted to tell for a while. It brings Nordic tales and tradtions to light in a story about a young woman named Tanngnidr Huginnson (no one in the story really knows about her past) who thinks she is one of Odin’s Valkyries trapped in the modern world. Most people pass it off as her being an eccentric person but in reality she is two souls trapped in one body as part of a plan by Hel, guardian of the underworld, to take over the world. The four part mini-series will explore Tanngnidr’s relationship with her single mother roommate, Emily, and the struggle with the two souls in her mind. Will she be able to confront Hel and restore hope for the world of the living? Contribute and find out!

 

 

Funding from this project will allow me to get over a few financial hurdles.

  • It will allow me to produce my first color comic book.
  • It will allow me to start painting comic book pages.
  • It will allow me to better market and advertise my work.

Where does the money go?

    • Funds pay for the production of the book (paper, ink, pens, paint, etc...)
    • Covers cost of perks as well as shipping.
    • Advertising and marketing (mailers, visits to comic shops, etc...)
    • Taxes and Fees.
    • Printing of comic books in full color.

This money does not pay for my time to create these books. It's not a salary substitution. The dollar amount is what it is because perks, taxes, fees and printing are expensive.

Any funds that exceed the $25,000 goal will go into marketing and advertising into markets beyond the midwest and allow me to have some face-time with fans in comic shops and/or events in other states.

Additional perks may involve a release party in Des Moines, Iowa after funds exceed $50,000 as a way for me to personally thank those who donate and support the book. Bonus perks would be given away as well!

The Impact

Funding independent comic book projects is important to bring less commercial, more artistic stories to light.

My goal is to bring fun stories that mixes emotion with relevant action sequences. If you want to encourage stories that are actual STORIES (unlike today's Hollywood blockbusters) I would encourage you to support this project and many more just like it!

You may ask what happens if the $25,000 goal is not met? Fear not. I will find a way to get this book made and all of the perks will be sent to the gracious donors. I may have to cut corners but I can say for sure that without the $25,000 I will be back to square one on my next project from the standpoint of being able to reach new audiences. Please help me take the next step in my independent comic book career!

Other Ways You Can Help

My friends, I know that it is not possible for everyone to give money. There are many ways that you can help!

  • Tell your friends and family about this project! Let them know the importance of independent comic books!
  • Use the resources of Indiegogo to spread the word!
  • Use social media to direct people to this page!
  • Talk to your local comic book shop owners and ask if you can put up information!

Any help.... ANY help is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for your time!


-Sean Eike
story_txt:
About Sean Eike
Thank you for taking the time to view my project!
 
I am an illustrator from Des Moines, Iowa. After getting a Graphic Design and Fine Arts degree from Grand View College (now Grand View University) in 2003, I decided that the world of corporate or industrial design was not for me. So I signed up for a crash-course year at The Kubert School in Dover, New Jersey and found my love for comic book art.
 
For the better part of 10 years I worked on projects that did not have much recognition or that I did not receive credit for. After the death of my hero, Joe Kubert in August of 2012, I decided to take my career into my own hands. So I started work on my series "Rocket Transfer's Secret Files"... a series that is print-on-demand with Black and White artwork.

 

"Rage Against Hel" is a story that I have wanted to tell for a while. It brings Nordic tales and tradtions to light in a story about a young woman named Tanngnidr Huginnson (no one in the story really knows about her past) who thinks she is one of Odin’s Valkyries trapped in the modern world. Most people pass it off as her being an eccentric person but in reality she is two souls trapped in one body as part of a plan by Hel, guardian of the underworld, to take over the world. The four part mini-series will explore Tanngnidr’s relationship with her single mother roommate, Emily, and the struggle with the two souls in her mind. Will she be able to confront Hel and restore hope for the world of the living? Contribute and find out!

 

 
Funding from this project will allow me to get over a few financial hurdles.



It will allow me to produce my first color comic book.
It will allow me to start painting comic book pages.
It will allow me to better market and advertise my work.





Where does the money go?

Funds pay for the production of the book (paper, ink, pens, paint, etc...)
Covers cost of perks as well as shipping.
Advertising and marketing (mailers, visits to comic shops, etc...)
Taxes and Fees.
Printing of comic books in full color.


This money does not pay for my time to create these books. It's not a salary substitution. The dollar amount is what it is because perks, taxes, fees and printing are expensive.
Any funds that exceed the $25,000 goal will go into marketing and advertising into markets beyond the midwest and allow me to have some face-time with fans in comic shops and/or events in other states.
Additional perks may involve a release party in Des Moines, Iowa after funds exceed $50,000 as a way for me to personally thank those who donate and support the book. Bonus perks would be given away as well!




The Impact
Funding independent comic book projects is important to bring less commercial, more artistic stories to light.
My goal is to bring fun stories that mixes emotion with relevant action sequences. If you want to encourage stories that are actual STORIES (unlike today's Hollywood blockbusters) I would encourage you to support this project and many more just like it!
You may ask what happens if the $25,000 goal is not met? Fear not. I will find a way to get this book made and all of the perks will be sent to the gracious donors. I may have to cut corners but I can say for sure that without the $25,000 I will be back to square one on my next project from the standpoint of being able to reach new audiences. Please help me take the next step in my independent comic book career!




Other Ways You Can Help
My friends, I know that it is not possible for everyone to give money. There are many ways that you can help!



Tell your friends and family about this project! Let them know the importance of independent comic books!
Use the resources of Indiegogo to spread the word!
Use social media to direct people to this page!
Talk to your local comic book shop owners and ask if you can put up information!

Any help.... ANY help is greatly appreciated. Thank you so much for your time!
-Sean Eike

story:
350 Comedy Needs Your Support!

350 Comedy is a production company that brings you hot and fresh sketch videos straight outta New York City. Created by Travis Greisler (The Orion Experience,  NYMF's The Travels) and Eliza Kingsbury (Upright Citizens Brigade), we strive to produce comedy that is fast, dirty, and fun.

From the team that brought you "A Very Gaga Christmas" comes a web series about the couple you love to hate: "Dom and Tamantha". Join the very wealthy Wall Street bro named Dom (played by Eliza Kingsbury) and his wife, the NYC socialite/event planner, named Tamantha (played by Travis Greisler) as they tear Manhattan a new one. Plus it's got inappropriate groping, dogs, money, and fast cars.

There's one thing we really need to make a web series about money: MONEY!

We need your support. As young writers/directors/actors, we want to bring you material that is entertaining and impeccably made. In order to shoot this web series in HD with professional equipment and a top-notch team, we have a goal of $3500. This will help us rent equipment, pay for crew, directors, editors, costumes, make up, rental spaces, costumes, and assist funding for future sketches coming to you this summer.

story:
This project is funded! 

Thanks to all of you who participated, shared it and talked about it. You made Devlok reach another cluster within the Hyperhedron. Keep updated, it's just the begining...


The comic

This is the beginning of an adventure in the "Hyperhedron", a universe whose structure is made of nano-machines, where pseudo-gravity and non-definable temporal sectors act as physical laws. After the unexpected crash of his shuttle, "Devlok" is taken away by cybernetic creatures and brought into the biomechanical depths of the poly-teflo-carbon giga-tubes, where humans seem to have no place anymore...

​


​The book


"Devlok, the Techno-Templar", that's: 

- 56 pages featuring the first two chapters of Devlok (20 color pages) + two other short stories ("Obekna", 6 color pages and "Controlled Transgression", 4 B&W pages) + extra pages of sketches, works in progress and full illustrations.

- 200gr. paper, matt.

- A4 format (21x29,7cm - 8,3x11,7 inch).

- Soft cover, 300gr., shiny.

Here's a flick through the (French) book:


And pictures​


Note: Enclosed in this (hopefully) forthcoming English edition is a first story of "Devlok", that has an end. Following the succes of the French crowdfunding and the demands of the readers, I added 8 extra pages that are now the continuation of Devlok's adventures!


Behind the curtain

Every original artboard of Devlok is around 30x40cm (11,8 x 15,8 inch). Entirely hand-made with watercolor, acrylic and ink.




The little story

In april of this year, I printed the first 100 copies and surprisingly, they were sold out in less than a week! 

So I made a crowdfunding for a French version that also surpassed all expectations. 

Check it here: https://fr.ulule.com/techno-templier/

Today, as there are still people interested in the English version, I decided to make this page.


The project

By participating in this project, you'll help me to continue to make comics but above all of course, it is about the opportunity to get the signed book directly to your house door. Plus all the extras that can come with it:  Dedications, Ex-Libris, Illustrated bookmarks, Posters, Special editions and Original illustrations!

The point is to print 100 books including a minimum of 60 preorders, the rest will go for promotion and extra sales.

Please note that, except in a few European conventions or in the case of an eventual re-press, this book might be difficult to get elsewhere than through this campaign.


The costs

To print 100 books costs approximatively 400€. 

Shipping fees are around 250€. 

Perks around 250€ not including original drawings.  5% of the final raised amount will also be deducted for Indiegogo and around 3% for paypal. The rest would cover a part of my creation costs.

Because printing a bunch of books without being sure they go is a financial risk I cannot take, this is a fixed funding campaign. If the goal is not reached, everyone will be refunded and this edition will not be printed, but ... it would be sad, no?


The perks

Please, read carefully what exactly is included in the perks. As some of them are including a donation, they might offer less according to their price.

- Eternal thanks: Your name will be listed in the thanks section of the book and in the website, for ever! (In every of my Devlok's autoproductions). 

- The book: Like indicated upper, it's 56 pages, 21x30cm / 8,3x11,7 inch format, 200gr Paper and 300gr. soft cover. 


- Dedication: Small color drawing in the book, signed.


- Ex-Libris (Bookplate): Small sheet of nice paper with a thick ink stamped Devlok. Signed.


- Poster A3: (42x30cm - 16,5x11,8 inch) 300gr. Paper. Signed  (It will not be possible to choose, probably it'll be this one)


​- Poster A2: 200gr. Paper. Signed. (No picture available yet)

- Printed Bookmark (7x25cm / 2,7x9,8 inch). Signed. (No picture available yet)

- Illustrated Bookmark (7x25cm / 2,7x9,8 inch). Yes, it's a real original illustration. And it's Signed of course.​​


*Obviously bookmarks with original illustrations are all different, this one is an example commissioned by a fan.

Notes:

*Every perk include shipping costs wordwide.

*I will probably make a new cover for the book.

*There might be small differences between the pictures and the final product.


You can't participate?

Legit! Still, talking and sharing this page with your friends will make you earn some extra Karma points!

Also, keep an eye on Haedre Fb's page, I will probably launch a contest to win free copies!


The author

I was born in the french part of Belgium in 81. Very early, masters of science fiction like Giger, Moebius, Druillet, Otomo, Shirow, Nihei and many many more influenced me a lot. Later, I also produced electronic music which somehow converged perfectly towards my obsessions of machines and cables. And because I am connected to this field, I did a bunch of commissionned illustrations for technoish records.

Today, I live in Berlin, Germany.

​


If you want to know/see more, I invite you to visit my pages:

http://haedre.com

http://facebook.com/haedreart

http://facebook.com/vonkor-lab

Thank you for your visit!

story:
Filming a music video parody!!!

We've recorded a song parody called B*tches in WeHo to the JayZ and Kanye West track N*ggas in Paris.  

"They made a hot beat... we made it even hotter"

Help support 2 funny girls working hard to step it up a notch, and play with the big girls of comedy in Hollywood.  If you enjoying laughing, dancing, and hot beauties this video will not disappoint.  We've poured our hearts and souls into every aspect of this song from writing the lyrics, choregraphing dances, and story boarding our video.  There are some extremely talented people on board directing, producing, and making cameo's for B*tches in WeHo.  Please help us make our dream into a kick ass reality!!!  Were very grateful for any lil bit that helps. Xo TyJax

"TyJax are in the building 

Our jokes are to the ceiling

We know were about to kill it

How you know This Sh*t's PREMIERING"

 

PS.  SHARE WITH YOUR FRIENDS I bet they'll like us too =)

story:
Our Story

My name is Regine L. Sawyer and I am the owner of Lockett Down Productions Publications as well as the writer and creator of the comic book"The Rippers". The story is about an intergalactic bounty hunter, who works for a government agency whose sole purpose is to disassemble all factions of a criminal organization. In the mist of doing that, she gets accused of a crime she doesn't remember commiting.

I love writing this series. It's my baby. Nuturing it since 1997, it was my pleasure and honor to debut it to the public at last year's New York Anime Festival. And it was overwhelming to receive so much support at the convention, as well as conventions since then, especially from female comic book readers. The success of this project will prove that comic books with a female lead can bridge gaps, as well as encourage even more female readership without snubbing the industry staple of male readers.   

As the owner of a fledgling comic book company it's a challenge promoting The Rippers on a small budget, and that's where I need your help. $3,000.00 is the amount I need to suppliment book, poster, and flyer costs for up coming conventions such as: the New York Comic Con/Anime Festival and the San Diego International Comic Con.  To thank you all for your support I have an awesome list rewards that include tickets to a much anticipated Comic Con, Personalized Pin-Ups drawn by one of my featured artists, Gift Cards from a famous Comic Book Store in New York City, and more!

 

I want to thank everyone in advance for all your help! And please, tell your friends, family, co-workers, and aquiantences about my company and this site. When something comes along as good as this project, you have to pass the word, don't keep it to yourself! Again I thank you!

story:
The Chosen One Order of Darkness Volume 1

It’s 2060, a draconian empire stretches across North America, spreading tyranny and trying to dominate the world with their control. Their extremist views aim to strip the world’s people of their freedoms.

The last band of resistance mercenaries are on a mission to tear down the order and regain their independence. 

Enzo, an ex-patient of the human advancement program (a program created by the O.H.I. to create super humans for their agenda), has just discovered his powers.

He joins with the resistance mercenaries in their fight to take down the empire. If they fail the entire world will become enslaved and will have to submit to the rule of the Holy New Order.

Your support and funding will allow us to complete the remaining artwork.

The complete graphic novel will be 45 pages long. 

 Main Characters

Enzo
Hero of the story, his objective is to unlock his powers and face off against the O.H.I.

Lord Saturn

God from the planet Saturn. Guardian of the Eternity Crystals.

O.H.I. Knight

They are defenders of the Holy New Order. 

Sir. Henry Delores

Politician and leader of the O.H.I. 

Viceroy Henry Gallivant

Viceroy of the O.H.I. and commander of the 9th Legion, Protector of the Holy New Order. 

Mick McEwan

Ex-special forces and commander of the Resistance Mercenaries. 

Team

Writer — Matthew van der Lee

Artist — Filip Cekic

 

OHI Knight, defenders of the Holy New Order. 

Enzo, our protagonist, on a mission to use his newly found powers to take down the O.H.I.

Lord Saturn, God of the planet Saturn and protector of the Eternity Crystals.

story:
Short Synopsis

The galaxy is a dangerous place filled with dangerous creatures doing dangerous...things. The Weaselmeizters, a group of intergalactic bounty hunters who also happen to be weasels (yes, weasels), are here to make it a safer place. 

With influences ranging from Guardians of the Galaxy, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, and Star Wars to Daredevil (Brubaker, Bendis, Waid), Batman (Snyder), Sex Criminals (Fraction/Zdarsky), and Rocket Girl (Montclare/Reeder), the creative team (along with Coast Comics) aims to put Weaselmeizters into your hands every other month (starting THIS September). Created by Evan Wucher, Jerry Choy, and writer Brentt Harshman, WEASELMEIZTERS is a fast-paced, action-packed, suspenseful, and fun read with gorgeous art by the talented Kamil Boettcher and Lukasz Marko, lettering by Keith Perkins, and help from Michael Colbert, help US entertain YOU.


What We Need & What You Get
  • We are reaching for a $2,000 goal. These funds will cover all printing costs, as well as costs for ComicCon appearances and ISBN code costs. Also, this goal would cover, of course, perk & reward costs.
  • Our perks range from a print copy of the first issue and a personalized thank-you note all the way to getting to be drawn into a future issue, and a subscription to the first 12 issues of this fantastic series!
  • If the goal is not met, we will still be putting out the issue come end-September 2014, except now there will be less comics for comic shops and retailers across the US to get their probably-very-soft hands on.

The Impact

We are not DC. We are not Marvel, or Image, or Dark Horse, or IDW. We are Coast. We are an independent publishing company created by writers and artists who want to work hard, create something worthwhile, and build up a portfolio and repertoire they can be proud of. Nobody is paid upfront per-page fees. Not only does this weed out greedy collaborators, but it also shows that anyone who is willing to script, pencil, ink, color, or letter a 22-page comic truly believes in the project. Everyone in our company is paid on a per-sales ratio. Ten percent of all profit goes to the company, for maintenance, and the rest is split up entirely by the creative team. Nobody here delusions themselves with hopes of racking in millions. We all simply have dreams, and won't stop until our dreams can be held in our hands as we turn the pages we've put our heart & soul into.

In Case You Weren't Convinced

  • Despite its wide range of influences, WEASELMEIZTERS is unlike anything this world (or surrounding worlds) has ever seen. Genetically advanced weasels toting big guns, sporting fashionable jackets, and racking in serious money? Can't say we've heard of this before.
  • Alongside its end-September release date, WEASELMEIZTERS will be accompanied on its first wave trek by other upcoming Coast Comics books like GONE FISHING (F.D. White, Alrissa Sia), JANEIRO'S ROYAL HELL (Gabe Cohen, Gene Schleeter), and THE ASTOUNDING AMOEBA ARMADA (Jason Russell, Mandy Marguerite).
     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, don't worry! Simply following us on Twitter, or Instagram, or liking us on Facebook, helps! Getting the word out and telling your family/friends about us is super helpful as well.
    Also, you can support WEASELMEIZTERS when its first issue launches end-September, and keep an eye out for all Coast Comics titles!
