story:
War Dance Comics will be a small press, creator owned comic book publishing company, with a desire to offer a constructive, effective environment for up and coming comic book creators to share their stories to the world. We want to provide creative teams a place that they can turn to who understands what it can be to be a comic book creator and have a day job. For many creators, this is a hurdle that isn't easily leapt, and can be a rapid deterant from working in the industry. 

War Dance's debut comic will be Sancte, a tale by War Dance founders Aaron Pierce and Kitty Patterson. It will follow the story of Frank Rames, a man who's lost his past, and can't see his future. He finds himself dragged into a world of super natural occurance, and in the middle of a war between angels and demons. 

Our goal for this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to publish our comic, and establish our presence at cons to start gathering more creaters into our fold. With this, we should be able to get our publishing company on the ground and start moving toward bigger and better goals in the future for all comics coming together under the Wardance label. 

 

War Dance comics needs to get a few things handled in order to get ourselves in the active market:

  • Sancte #1 Published - A comic book publisher isn't much without a comic to boast. We'll be working with top quality printers to get our debut comic published at an economical price for the best quality we can find. 
  • Convention Display - We want to present ourselves as a professional company, not some fly by night operation. As such, our presentation at cons is essential to our success. We need signage and display racks etc, as well as table covers and other con essentials so we can put our best foot forward. 
  • Convention Fees - We have very little money to foot our own project, so if we want to get out there, we need your help! Your contributions would go toward purchasing a table at one or two conventions so that we can represent what we're selling. Tables at these events are no cheap ordeal!
  • Operational Expenses - Office supplies, domain name registrations, incorporation expenses, etc. We are running a business and as we do so, the money will also be used to help run it.

If we do not raise our total goal, we'll begin prioritizing our funds. Any money beyond our target goal would go toward more con appearances, and publishing more books, either our own or fellow creators if we get other projects quickly enough. Either way, it will all be put toward the development and growth of our company.

As a way of saying thank you, we'll be giving you all something, be it praise on our website and in our books, issues of Sancte, prints, or original art. You'll also have the knowledge that you helped launch a publishing company that is by the creators, for the creators, to help our community grow!

 

Kitty is a writer, I am an artist. We've both been struggling to get our messages out to the world for years now. We've finally come together as a creative team on Sancte, and we're having a blast putting it all together and making something cohesive out of it. With War Dance we want to help other creators in similar situations get past the hump of "How do I get this out there?" and "How do I get this done" by providing our own on the job experieince and management for them. We want to be the publisher that will accept their schedules and understand when they can't quite make it due to the day job or personal issues arising.

We are the publisher for the indie, the small-press, the young guns. The ones who desperately need a door into the industry but don't have it just yet. We're not trying to compete with Marvel or DC, we're trying to tell our stories and help our fellow creators tell their's. By funding our project, you're helping dreams come true, and drive and ambition pay off. You're opening the market to a whole knew generation of storytellers and visionaries, and helping us expand our forrays into the realm of art.

 

If you can't contribute monetarily, or you want to help beyond that, please make some noise! Post the link to this project on your facebook pages and twitter accounts! Get us some love, guys! We're trying really hard to bring not only our dreams to fruition but also those dreams of our fellow indie creators.  Any foot traffic you can get us here is always appreciated and is a huge boon to our efforts! 

We also need creators! We're not just looking to put our own comic out, we want to put out high-quality comics from other creative teams too! If you've got people who have great ideas and good art but they don't have a way to get it out, let us know! We'll help all we can and manage production for them so they can see their names in print too!

We'll help all we can and manage production for them so they can see their names in print too!

story:
First, I would like to thank you, our audience and investors, for taking the time to check out this project. 

This is the launch of our first independent comic, and it’s quite a task. When we set out to create Operation Home Front: 1941 The crucible, we felt that a crowd-sourced funding would be the perfect vehicle for not only funding the final stage of the project, but also for delivering the completed comic into the hands of our audience: comic enthusiasts like you!

The project’s fundraising goal of $15,000.00 will cover the cost of production, shipping, promotion, and the artwork. ( and Indiegogo fees) The goal is ensuring that our final product is professional, our stories compelling, and our characters well-developed. Also, we want to ensure that our finished physical print run will be of the highest quality for our investors.

These costs we've considered are the actual cost of production in order to quickly develop and deliver the first four issue self contained story arc of our comic. Ultimately, if this is successful, we would like to create more stories that explore the origins of the other characters and continue to follow their adventures through the course of the entire war. We are exploring digital delivery options via Comixology.com and/or other avenues for future installments.

STORY

The year is 1941, the world is at war! America is trying to remain out of the conflict that rages over in Europe and the pacific, but a surprise attack at Pearl Harbor by the empire of Japan not only causes horrific destruction upon the U.S. pacific fleet, it also unleashes a new era of super heroes. The first story arc focuses on Calvin Brooks an African american, sailor who is unknowingly forced to participate in an experiment that will forever change his life.

The project, Operation Home Front: 1941 The Crucible, aims to become a full-color, four part self contained story arc comic series to be distributed both digitally and in hard copy (comic book) form. It's super hero story at the core, infused with world and american history.

This project is the first story in a set of mini-series and one shots, that will follow the characters over the course of the entire war. Further chapters of this world’s chronology already being penned by our creative team.

RISKS/CHALLENGES

The inherent challenge in funding a creator owned comic as a first time comic producer is a lack of publicity/exposure. Please share this with your friends and family and post links to our IndieGoGo campaign on your social media - it could be that little bit extra exposure from YOU that helps fund this project!

Our next hurdle has been that creating a comic from scratch has a huge learning curve. That said, so far we are finding our way through that labyrinth with the help of some artist/creators, and doing our best to anticipate and budget for all production costs.

Finally, our team has a lot of outside-of-comics responsibilities at this point. Between family obligations, school, and our paying jobs, we are all budgeting significant time out of our week - every week - to bring this project to fruition, and will continue to do everything we can to see it become a success. So far this hasn’t presented a conflict for us as we’ve written and edited the Operation Home Front- The Crucible series, and we don’t foresee it being an issue as we move into pencil, ink, color, letters, and publishing.

The ultimate goal for the Pigdog Press Development team is that we would like to produce digitally distributed, independent comics on a full-time basis. This project is our first step towards that goal! Ideally we would like for our first story arc to be so successful that our team will see a modest profit after the production costs are paid, and also that by distributing and selling our completed first issue, we’ll get the momentum to sustain the whole series through direct sales without further crowd funding campaigns!

All funds raised by this IndieGogo will go directly towards the completion, publication, promotion, and delivery of our comic, Operation Home Front- The Crucible.  We have worked out our costs to:

-$2500 per book for writing/artwork (pencil, ink, color, and letters)

-$3000 for printing/shipping (comic books as well as perks to our contributors )

$1000 for promotion of the series 

REACH GOALS

If we reach $3850 goal we'll be able to bring you Issue #1.

-If we reach $7350, we’ll be able to bring you Issue #2.

-If we reach $10,850, we’ll be able to bring you Issue #3.

-If we reach $14,350, we’ll be able to bring you Issue #4.

Even if you can’t contribute money to the project, it’d be tremendously helpful if you share this with friends and fellow comic enthusiasts who might be interested! Thank you in advance for all of your support.

story:
Hello guys check this great article from Digital Riot Click Here

After an epic battle with Astaroth's minions  

Welcome to...                                                                            

the amazing world of 

Your contribution will help us acheieve our goal of printing a comic book consisting of 20 full colored pages in A4 format!

  

Devil 's legacy is an animated adventure, which speaks of the eternal conflict between good and evil inside us and how a person can always change in life when he has to defend the values in which he believes and fight for the loved ones.

it's like Berserk will meet Ghost In The Shell under the direction of Go Nagai, with a dip in Death Note, a story worthy of the Dante's Divine Comedy, spectacular animations of Akira and the power of the super robot's coming from the 80', all mixed up and shaked with Devilman.

Vincent and the mythological Fenrir


This is a deep story, which takes place through a thousand years of history till our presents days. An incredible cast, more than 100 characters perfectly described one by one, a universe created entirely for this television series, 2000 pages of script are waiting for bring you in this amazing world.

The Renegade roams the wastelands of purgatory ...



The chronology of the tale on which is based the whole project embraces almost a millennium, starting from 1123 A.D. till nowadays.

It develops in parallel in two different dimensions, Earth and Purgatory. As for the “butterfly effect”, what happens in one world can, in our case too, affect events in the other.And that is the theory and the philosophy underneath. 

The tale is based on three main characters: Vincent McKane, Sir William McKane and Astaroth the demon. 

Vincent Mc Kane

Sir William Mc Kane

The Evil Astaroth

 That makes it a choral play in which the fatal flow of these three heroes creates a thread that will include the destiny of many others complex characters, any one with his - or her - heritage of life and death experiences.


Everything begins when, in 1123 A.D., Sir William McKane, a Scottish Templar knight, and his heroic crew fought against a bunch of witches trying to summon the most evil and powerful demon from the other side of the “mirror”: Astaroth.

The lord of evil forces is about to reach our world when William, showing great courage, sacrifices his mortal life in order to prevent this disaster. He jumps against Astaroth and they both fall into a dimensional hole. They end up in an other dimension, unknown to both of them; a world that is in between Earth, land of the livings, and Hell.


Sir William rises back to life in the afterworld as a bodied soul and his fight against Astaroth has just begun and Purgatory becomes the battleground. During the fight William breaks one of Astaroth’s horns and manage to escape with the splinter.



Astaroth with his powers could eventually leave that crappy place, but he cannot, as he is “incomplete” missing a part of his horn. So the prince of darkness is stuck there! Both for rage and to prevent Sir William to leave Purgatory – eventually by being “elected” for Heaven – Astaroth summons his four generals from Hell.

The cruel Aamon, the smart Malphas, the crazy Pruslas and the faithful Barbatos the clairvoyant gather around their leader and together they cast a spell that produces the most horrifying of the earthquakes. It's a catastrophe; any type of natural disaster shakes Purgatory, the gates to Heaven and Hell collapse and nothing lasts of them but relics…

The Evil Army!

 What happens now is that people in the world of the living they keep dying and their souls keep ending up in Purgatory. But there are no exits anymore now that the gates have collapsed! So it happens that the population of souls waiting to be judged rises day after day, for the eternal cycle of the Universal Judgment being interrupted.

Wherever people gather they tend to create society. So it happens in Purgatory where a new syncretism creates a world where past and future links together, mixing cultures, technologies and human kinds; it is an amazing melting pot, a human miracle, under the oppression of a tyrant called Astaroth.

He imposes his power spreading terror all around the five continents with his army of demons. He wants to find Sir William and get back the splinter of his horn. In the meantime Sir William got organized. After having realized all that happened to him, he started to wander across the unknown land. Along his journey he has met many people that have decided to join him in his will to fight against that monster and try to put the Universe back to balance.


So, the “Resistance” was born. With Sir William McKane now ride Sir Ryan, Shizuko the Japanese warrior, the young Eric and other soldiers of any origin. Along the centuries this war goes on. The Resistance has established five bases, one in each continent. They have built castles and fortresses to protect the five entrances to Purgatory, and that for one reason. They know that one day Astaroth will try again to get into our dimension to rule over the living.

The Heroes of the story!

They also know that to do that he needs a new body, a special body, composed by the pieces of five different special kids, the Star Children. One day those kids will maybe get into Purgatory and when they will, it will be through one of the five passages. The Resistance must be ready to save them before Astaroth finds them.

The 5 star children

The struggle between the two sides goes on for almost nine centuries until in XX century something changes in Astaroth’ strategy. The Astral alignments are favorable, so Barbatos has forwarded. The time to rule the Universe has come. Malphas is the only demon that can step in the world of the leavings as a sort of ambassador of evil.

As a spirit he wanders on Earth and he finally finds what he was looking for. He gets in touch with a powerful lodge, the Lodge of Illuminati, introducing himself as a hermit magician. He provides them a Grimorium, a spell book, and lure them with the promise of great power. They just have to follow his indications and help him to find five particular kids and send them into another dimension.


Along the years of the XX centuries four of these kids have been found. One is a German kid, Mark Weigart, whose peculiarity was to be the best violin player ever, his fingers so sensitive that the sound coming from his violin was considered the most incredible sound of the century; then WWII arrived and during that terrible time, one mysterious day, Mark disappeared.

In the early seventies, the second one was a kid from Kenya, Sanogo. He was fast! Oh man, he was fast! His legs were like the paws of a cheetah, reaching 60 miles per hour! His tribe adored him like a God. One day he disappeared too. The tribe since then has a song that describes the “hand of Pasusu” coming to kidnap Sanogo and bringing disgrace on the village.

In the eighties two twins, Jesse and Megan, a couple of geniuses with ESP powers had the same destiny in the Canadian prairies.

The Last Child


Vincent and Aura

In this amazing series he will be placed in front of his incredible destiny and he will accept unknown challenges and a foggy future and so he will end up in the same place where the other Star Children have been taken: Purgatory. Vincent will join Sir William and the other fellows of the Resistance and, along with you, he will play a key role in the development of the future of the Universe.

Along his journey many other characters will join him. The relationships among them won't always be fine… His courage, morality, sense of honor and justice will be challenged and tested.

Until he will finally decide weather to be the savior of the Universe or the force that could destroy it forever… 

Vincent can't always control his darkside...


The Team Players

For a large project we need a great team capable of facing many difficulties,

For this project, we have an A team. All team members of this project have over 20 years of experience in the Japanese animation industry and from Toei Animation. They have worked on some of the biggest animations seen on TV as shown below.

Our team members worked on these past other production series  :

  • One Piece (series).
  • One Piece (movie).
  • Dragonball (kai).
  • Gaiking (modern series).
  • Toriko (series).
  • Kindaichi (series).
  • Precure (series).
  • Kitaro (series).
  • Dr Slump (series).
  • St Seya (series).
  • Magical Doremi (series and movies).
  • Digimon Saga (series and movies).
  • Yu-gi-oh (series).
  • Beet Vander Buster (series).
  • Tetsuya (video).
  • Air Master (series).
  • Kanon (video).
  • Tsuribaka (series).
  • Mono-Chan (series).
  • Ring (series).
  • Mononoke (video).
  • Thriller restaurant (series).
  • Mari Gali (video).
  • Kyouso Giga (video).

All these series are copyright of Toei Animation Co, Ltd

and many others ...

All our drawings and animations are made in-house, by our staff.

We have all the experiences and skills needed to craft this next masterpiece.

I just want to say a few more words, regarding what we are gonna show you.

   We're not coming to you with an idea to realize, but with a project that started more than two years ago. 

Offices, team, company, scripts, concepts, trailers, teasers, opening are already there and it's the result of more than two years of hard work ... 


Some pages from our Manga !

Rewards

all our contributors will have acces to our SPECIAL developer blog! 


Add - Ons

We have a store full of phone and tablet covers, computer, tablet and phone skins, stickers, tshirts and many other things !!! Click here ! 

If you like one of our charcters who's not in the covers, skins, t-shirts, just let us know an we will make the artwork on purpose for you.


So you can buy your awesome t-shirt, cover etc with the characters you love more!!

Thx for the amazing brushes coming from redheadstock: 
http://redheadstock.deviantart.com/journal/Term...

The Resistance has established five bases, one in each continent. They have built castles and fortresses to protect the five entrances to Purgatory, and that for one reason. They know that one day Astaroth will try again to get into our dimension to rule over the living.





The Heroes of the story!



They also know that to do that he needs a new body, a special body, composed by the pieces of five different special kids, the Star Children. One day those kids will maybe get into Purgatory and when they will, it will be through one of the five passages. The Resistance must be ready to save them before Astaroth finds them.






The 5 star children



The struggle between the two sides goes on for almost nine centuries until in XX century something changes in Astaroth’ strategy. The Astral alignments are favorable, so Barbatos has forwarded. The time to rule the Universe has come. Malphas is the only demon that can step in the world of the leavings as a sort of ambassador of evil.
As a spirit he wanders on Earth and he finally finds what he was looking for. He gets in touch with a powerful lodge, the Lodge of Illuminati, introducing himself as a hermit magician. He provides them a Grimorium, a spell book, and lure them with the promise of great power. They just have to follow his indications and help him to find five particular kids and send them into another dimension.



Along the years of the XX centuries four of these kids have been found. One is a German kid, Mark Weigart, whose peculiarity was to be the best violin player ever, his fingers so sensitive that the sound coming from his violin was considered the most incredible sound of the century; then WWII arrived and during that terrible time, one mysterious day, Mark disappeared.
In the early seventies, the second one was a kid from Kenya, Sanogo. He was fast! Oh man, he was fast! His legs were like the paws of a cheetah, reaching 60 miles per hour! His tribe adored him like a God. One day he disappeared too. The tribe since then has a song that describes the “hand of Pasusu” coming to kidnap Sanogo and bringing disgrace on the village.
In the eighties two twins, Jesse and Megan, a couple of geniuses with ESP powers had the same destiny in the Canadian prairies.
The Last Child







Vincent and Aura



In this amazing series he will be placed in front of his incredible destiny and he will accept unknown challenges and a foggy future and so he will end up in the same place where the other Star Children have been taken: Purgatory. Vincent will join Sir William and the other fellows of the Resistance and, along with you, he will play a key role in the development of the future of the Universe.
Along his journey many other characters will join him. The relationships among them won't always be fine… His courage, morality, sense of honor and justice will be challenged and tested.
Until he will finally decide weather to be the savior of the Universe or the force that could destroy it forever… 




Vincent can't always control his darkside...




The Team Players


For a large project we need a great team capable of facing many difficulties,
For this project, we have an A team. All team members of this project have over 20 years of experience in the Japanese animation industry and from Toei Animation. They have worked on some of the biggest animations seen on TV as shown below.
Our team members worked on these past other production series  :

One Piece (series).
One Piece (movie).
Dragonball (kai).
Gaiking (modern series).
Toriko (series).
Kindaichi (series).
Precure (series).
Kitaro (series).
Dr Slump (series).
St Seya (series).
Magical Doremi (series and movies).
Digimon Saga (series and movies).
Yu-gi-oh (series).
Beet Vander Buster (series).
Tetsuya (video).
Air Master (series).
Kanon (video).
Tsuribaka (series).
Mono-Chan (series).
Ring (series).
Mononoke (video).
Thriller restaurant (series).
Mari Gali (video).
Kyouso Giga (video).

All these series are copyright of Toei Animation Co, Ltd
and many others ...

All our drawings and animations are made in-house, by our staff.
We have all the experiences and skills needed to craft this next masterpiece.
I just want to say a few more words, regarding what we are gonna show you.
   We're not coming to you with an idea to realize, but with a project that started more than two years ago. 
Offices, team, company, scripts, concepts, trailers, teasers, opening are already there and it's the result of more than two years of hard work ... 

Some pages from our Manga !





Rewards


all our contributors will have acces to our SPECIAL developer blog! 




















Add - Ons



We have a store full of phone and tablet covers, computer, tablet and phone skins, stickers, tshirts and many other things !!! Click here ! 


If you like one of our charcters who's not in the covers, skins, t-shirts, just let us know an we will make the artwork on purpose for you.





So you can buy your awesome t-shirt, cover etc with the characters you love more!!







Thx for the amazing brushes coming from redheadstock: 

http://redheadstock.deviantart.com/journal/Term...

story:
broken is a dark fantasy webcomic about two people struggling to help each other get through one day at a time while the world falls apart around them. Huvrye is a homunculus general overwhelmed by guilt over his role in a genocide. He is magically tethered to Yin, an undead psychic forced to repeatedly relive his and Huvrye's worst memories. Book 1 covers the first four chapters of the story, in which Huvrye and Yin flee the last known bastion of civilization while chased by monsters, both literal and metaphorical.

This comic is rated Mature for things like graphic violence (including suicide) and body horror.

This comic is a long-running passion project of mine, first posted in 2015 on SmackJeeves, and then more recently joined the lovely SpiderForest community. broken, now well into Chapter 5, is available here to read for free online, and the first four chapters are already available as PDFs. The online portions are posted panel-by-panel because I wanted to play with how it would affect pacing as well as web-unique storytelling elements, like simple animations or larger changes to the overall webpage. That being said, I always intended to print broken at some point, so every page has been drawn with both options in mind. Aside from format, the only notable difference between the online and print versions is that that I will be touching up a few pages that have always bothered me.

The goal of the campaign is to fund printing a small run of Book 1, which will combine the first four chapters- 232 pages- into a single volume.

There's also a few extras available if you want them instead of or in addition to your book: three prints- one each of the Yin, Huvrye, and Spitter designs- and two pins- one of the construct alchemy circle and one of the homunculus alchemy circle.

For the last reward tier, you have the option to get a custom ink illustration in your book that focuses on any one broken character of your choice. Even a background character/monster who's shown up exactly once, if that's what suits you. What the rest of the illustration looks like will be up to me.

One final note about the campaign: I don't need to tell any of you that the world really sucks right now, but I'm trying to do better personally to look out for something I can do to help. So full disclosure, a portion of the profits will be going to the Pajama Program, a charity that strives to help low-income children establish a comforting and healthy bedtime routine by giving them books and pajamas. The exact portion of profits will depend on what I have to work with once the campaign is over, but I'll certainly keep all the backers updated on it when the time comes.

Once we hit $2,000, all reward tiers will also include a bookplate and bookmark!

At $3,000 I will add pages of concept art to the book (I haven't figured out an exact number yet, but I have a lot of concept art so it should be quite a few pages), so you can see more behind the scenes art of how the comic was developed.

The risks are pretty minimal since the bulk of the work- creating the comic itself- is already done. I've been part of a successful Kickstarter campaign before, and there's many more experienced SpiderForest members I can get help and advice from if something goes wrong. Even if we don't reach the campaign goal, we should still be able to send everyone their rewards thanks to flexible funding and a printer who doesn't have a minimum requirement.

story:
THE STORY (LA STORIA)

You haven't to wait for it nor read here a synopsis. You can read the story here and, if you like it, you can show your appreciation by contributing to this campaign and getting one of the perks.

Non avete bisogno di attendere o di leggere un riassunto. Potete leggere subito la storia (qui) e, se vi piacerà, mostrarci il vostro apprezzamento contribuendo a questa campagna.


What We Need & What You Get

It's very simple. Since Enchantment Agency is a webcomic you can read for free, we need money to pay the artists and so to offer you more and more episodes continuously. So, in this specific case, raised funds will be destinate to Davide Castelluccio, who draw this episode. But aiding us you'll get one (or even more, if you want!) of the perks we offer: commissions traditional and digital), and an exclusive digital pin-up of the sexy character Myriam.


Lo sapete come funziona: i fondi raccolti vanno al disegnatore per compensare il suo lavoro. E contribuendo voi potrete, oltre ad aiutarci a realizzare ancora più storie, anche ricevere delle ricompense: sia commission (in questo caso da parte di davide Castelluccio) che un'esclusiva pin up di Myriam riservata unicamente a chi parteciperà a questa campagna.


Other Ways You Can Help

Simple, again: if you can't help us funding this campaign, maybe you'll be so kind to share news about it. Spreading the word is a very useful help too, so many thanks for that!


Come sempre, se non avete la possibilità di contribuire economicamente,potete ugualmente aiutarci spargendo la voce di questa campagna fra i vostri contatti. E' un aiuto che viene sempre utile e per il quale vi ringraziamo anticipatamente!

story:
What is Lost and Found?

Lost and Found is an online graphic novel that tells the mystery of a brother's quest to find his sister in a world that is not what it seems.

L&F is done with actors and models who perform the scene in 2D photos which are then rendered with the artistic app Prisma.

Click HERE to read Volume 1: Issue 0 to see what our story is all about...

Who is a part of Lost and Found?

The story was created by Matthew Preston (5 Dias) and Co-Writer/Photographer Viktoria IV King (Gray's Disconnect).  Special Effects Make Up are crafted by Jessica Pallotta.

Cast includes creator Matthew Preston as Logan.  Genny Yosco as Kat.  Chad Allen as Eli.  Italo Medelius as Nico.

The cast are very passionate about this project that deals with dysfunctional families and gay love triangles!

 

Why donate to Lost and Found?

    Lost and Found is a unique story that has elements of Sci-Fi mixed with LGBTQ themes.   We have a hard working cast and crew who want this complex story told and with more generous donations, the better quality we can produce for this project.  Believe us when we say that there are so many twists and turns you do not want to miss an issue!

      What will your donations go towards?

      • Cast: Actors and Models who are portraying the characters ($1900/$50 per actor, per issue)
      • Crew:  Photographers and Make Up Artists ($400/$50 for each issue)
      • Website Domain and Hosting ($144/$12 per month for 1 year)
      • Advertising/Social Media Boosts to get more views directed to our site ($500)
      • Food and Travel Expenses for the Crew ($128)
      • IndieGoGo Expenses ($128/4% paid back for using IndieGoGo if we reach our full amount)
      • Complete Total for Volume 1: 6 Issues ($3200)

      Goals

      We have certain goals that we want to reach while raising this campaign.

      Goal #1:  (RAISED)

      • Website Domain and Hosting ($144/$12 per month for 1 year)

      Goal #2:  (RAISED)

      • Volume 1: Issue 1 ($350)
      • 5 Actors ($250/$50 per actor)
      • 1 Photographer ($50)
      • Advertising/Social Media Boost ($30)
      • Food & Travel Expenses ($20)

      Goal #3:  (RAISED)

      • Volume 1: Issue 2 ($300)
      • 4 Actors ($200/$50 per actor)
      • 1 Photographer ($50)
      • Advertising/Social Media Boost ($30)
      • Food & Travel Expenses ($20)

      Goal #4:  (RAISED)

      • Volume 1: Issue 3 ($350)
      • 5 Characters ($250/$50 per actor)
      • 1 Photographer ($50)
      • Advertising/Social Media Boost ($30)
      • Food & Travel Expenses ($20)

      Goal #5:  (RAISED)

      • Volume 1: Issue 4 ($450)
      • 6 Characters ($300/$50 per actor)
      • 1 Photographer ($50)
      • 1 Special Effects Make Up Artist ($50)
      • Advertising/Social Media Boost ($30)
      • Food & Travel Expenses ($20)

      Goal #6:  (CURRENTLY RAISING)

      • Volume 1: Issue 5 ($500)
      • 7 Characters ($350)
      • 1 Photographer ($50)
      • 1 Make Up Artist ($50)
      • Advertising/Special Media Boost ($30)
      • Food & Travel Expenses ($20)

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please help spread the word to help make this project complete by sharing our campaign link to anyone who you know would be willing to donate.

story:
ADMIRAL PIZZA COMIC BOOK

Hello my Name is Alex Luebke, I am in my early 30's i am happily married. And I am very talented at cooking pizza. I have 2 dogs named Lady and Amber and a pet tortoise named Magus the destroyer. I LOVE drawing comics,  My star title...Admiral pizza! He is the leader of the Snergaville city sea and space fleet. Admiral pizza is a comic for all ages. (too extreme for babies), Co created by me and my kid cousin Quetzal in 2008- Every Monday after school we would make homemade pizza and draw!  We would pretend that one day it would be a real comic! Today is that day. Pizza and comics are my passion. I have completed 2 Books and am working hard on the 3rd. My First Book "The Life of Times of Admiral Pizza"  is over 60 pages and includes all the toppings-!

 

The sequel "Revenge of Darkhand" is over 50 pages! Thats OVER 100 PAGES OF INCREDIBLE AWESOME PIZZA ADVENTURES!

4 ACTION PACKED ADVENTURES in Full color! With fake adds for terrible products that don't exist! Like THE BREAKFAST GUN, SUPER CRAZY INVISIBLE INTANGIBLE ROBOT TOYS-PUG PASTE-AND MORE~!

If you invest in Admiral pizza you can be a super Pizza fan and get cool stuff like collectable comic book  trading cards! Stickers! Toys!  You could be in the comic! A DVD of the Animated comic! VIDEO GAME?! AND MORE~ TO COME!

First pick of custom freak toys!

 

ADMIRAL PIZZA WAS MENTIONED IN PMQ MAGAZINE!

CAMPAIGN AND STRETCH GOALS

All backers who donate will be mentioned in a super special "Thank you" Page of the upcoming 3rd Admiral Pizza Book.

  • 500$ GOAL:

If i complete my 500 dollar campaign goal i will pledge myself to complete 1 or more Admiral pizza books EVERY YEAR!  (Have 2 Books completed and am working on a 3rd!) it will give me the funds to print more books for upcoming conventions, and i will promise to work hard to bring Admiral Pizza to a comic store near YOU. if this goal is met i will record a video of myself eating a pizza with gross toppings!! And i will get a pizza tattoo.

ALL BACKERS WILL RECEIVE A 3RD TRADING CARD!...AND MORE...

  • 1000$ GOAL

I will release Admiral pizza the animated comic the movie DVD (Animated comic issues #1-4) and all backers will receive an EXTRA TRADING CARD!...AND MORE!

  • 2000$ goal

I will complete and release a 3rd Admiral pizza book. "The LEGEND of Admiral Pizza" (Working title) And MORE COOL STUFF!

POSSIBLE FUTURE STRETCH GOALS!

  • Admiral Pizza Video game.  
  • Admiral Pizza in "Pizza across the world" a book/show about Pizza across 7 seas!  
  • Admiral Pizza in other languages!
 

Risks & Challenges & Fears & Pizza

Most of the hard work is done. I already have 2 books done and am working hard on the 3rd. I printed  100+ copies of my books, Trading cards, Stickers, toys. Already bought a table at the first ever Alaska Comicon 2020.  I need your help to back my project so i can get both books printed and stocked for my booth! Honestly a big fear i have is that Admiral pizza the comic will just fly off the table like a buffet of pepperoni pizza!!  

HAVING AN EMPTY TABLE IS NOT AN OPTION.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share on social media! tell your friends and family! Do you draw? Do your kids draw? I have an ADMIRAL PIZZA FANART Contest going on! Draw the Admiral and i will put it in my upcoming 3rd Book! WINNER OF THE CONTEST WINS FREE COPIES OF MY BOOK WITH COOL PIZZA SWAG!!! Winners will be announced at the end of the campaign.

DON'T LET YOUR PIZZA DREAMS BE DREAMS! JUST DO IT!

story:
Dave Sim and Aardvark-Vanaheim have partnered with The Waverly Press to present Sim’s new modified version of this classic tale published nearly three decades ago, expanded with rarities from this comics milestone!

1992: After departing his enormously successful record-breaking run on SPIDER-MAN for Marvel Comics, Todd McFarlane launched his creation SPAWN which has since earned its place as the most successful independent comic-book of all time. Shortly after the initial launch, McFarlane invited 4 of the most respected writers in comics—Alan Moore, Neil Gaiman, Frank Miller, and Dave Sim—to collaborate with him on a string of single issues. At the time, Dave Sim was riding his own wave of success and popularity with his groundbreaking, award-winning series CEREBUS. Sim accepted McFarlane’s offer (as did Moore, Gaiman and Miller) and the two of them embarked on their collaboration which appeared in issue No.10 of SPAWN in 1993. McFarlane illustrated Sim’s story, bringing their popular characters together in a tale about Creator’s Rights called "Crossing Over." The issue made such an impact that their collaboration went on to win the 1993 WIZARD WORLD AWARD for “Best Single Story” and remains one of the most memorable collaborations in the history of comics.

2020: Dave Sim and Aardvark-Vanaheim have partnered with The Waverly Press to present Sim’s new modified version of this classic tale published nearly three decades ago, expanded with new content and rarities from this comics milestone. It’s still as fresh and relevant today as when it first appeared. While the original edition of SPAWN No. 10 was published in full color, this special edition - at Dave Sim’s insistence - presents the story in black and white. In the original edition, McFarlane drew what Dave Sim has called “the definitive Cerebus” (“...more people saw Todd’s Cerebus that one month than had seen my Cerebus in the decade prior to SPAWN No. 10”). Working gingerly and painstakingly around his career-ending (2015) wrist ailment, Sim fulfilled what he calls a “last ambition” to render the Kitchener Sequence as he originally pictured it, and to produce three new covers. He also redrew the Cerebus figures throughout the issue. McFarlane’s loose, detailed, energetic art alongside Sim’s cartoon realism brush and line work highlights the power of each artist in the pages of this new edition of SPAWN No. 10!

$35 STANDARD COVER SET - Set of all 4 standard color cover books.

$75 GOLD COVER SET - Set of all 4 gold ink variant cover books.

$90 COLLECTOR SET - Set of all 4 covers in the classic 1950's horror style. Every book is individually numbered and exclusive to Indiegogo. 

$110 PLATINUM COVER SET - All 4 platinum cover variant books. Every copy is individually numbered and hand signed by Dave Sim.

ADDITIONAL ADD-ON BOOKS

After you select your perk you will be given the option to add any of these rare editions to your package!

$25 SKETCH COVER VARIANT - This variant features an an unfinished early idea for the cover to the remastered edition of Spawn No. 10!

$25 BLANK COVER VARIANT - This variant come bound in heavy art paper, with only the printed logo. Ready for you or your favorite artist to create a unique cover to Spawn No. 10! This variant comes with a matching blank art trading card unique to this edition.

$50 DELUXE SIGNED & NUMBERED - This unique cover comes with a color trading card and 5x7" postcard exclusive to this edition!

$15 SUPPLEMENTAL BOOK - A behind the scenes look at the creation of the remastered SPAWN No. 10. This 24 page book includes all of Dave Sim's new individual full frame illustrations, preliminary cover art including work that did not make it into the book, and Sim's original 1993 hand written story notes from the Cerebus Archive!

Every copy of Spawn No. 10 comes with one of 12 different trading cards by Dave Sim. One card will be randomly inserted into each book.

STRETCH GOALS!

100k - Every Indiegogo backer will receive a bonus 5x7" postcard and a new trading card!

120k - We will add 8 pages of rarities to the Spawn 10 Supplemental book!

Don’t miss what is sure to be an instant collector’s item!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Though nearly every aspect of the project is ready for production at the launch of the campaign, our primary risks are potential production and delivery delays due to COVID-19. We will remain in close communication with every link in the chain from pre-press to final delivery. Should we encounter any delays we will keep all of you posted.
story_txt:
Dave Sim and Aardvark-Vanaheim have partnered with The Waverly Press to present Sim’s new modified version of this classic tale published nearly three decades ago, expanded with rarities from this comics milestone!

1992: After departing his enormously successful record-breaking run on SPIDER-MAN for Marvel Comics, Todd McFarlane launched his creation SPAWN which has since earned its place as the most successful independent comic-book of all time. Shortly after the initial launch, McFarlane invited 4 of the most respected writers in comics—Alan Moore, Neil Gaiman, Frank Miller, and Dave Sim—to collaborate with him on a string of single issues. At the time, Dave Sim was riding his own wave of success and popularity with his groundbreaking, award-winning series CEREBUS. Sim accepted McFarlane’s offer (as did Moore, Gaiman and Miller) and the two of them embarked on their collaboration which appeared in issue No.10 of SPAWN in 1993. McFarlane illustrated Sim’s story, bringing their popular characters together in a tale about Creator’s Rights called "Crossing Over." The issue made such an impact that their collaboration went on to win the 1993 WIZARD WORLD AWARD for “Best Single Story” and remains one of the most memorable collaborations in the history of comics.
2020: Dave Sim and Aardvark-Vanaheim have partnered with The Waverly Press to present Sim’s new modified version of this classic tale published nearly three decades ago, expanded with new content and rarities from this comics milestone. It’s still as fresh and relevant today as when it first appeared. While the original edition of SPAWN No. 10 was published in full color, this special edition - at Dave Sim’s insistence - presents the story in black and white. In the original edition, McFarlane drew what Dave Sim has called “the definitive Cerebus” (“...more people saw Todd’s Cerebus that one month than had seen my Cerebus in the decade prior to SPAWN No. 10”). Working gingerly and painstakingly around his career-ending (2015) wrist ailment, Sim fulfilled what he calls a “last ambition” to render the Kitchener Sequence as he originally pictured it, and to produce three new covers. He also redrew the Cerebus figures throughout the issue. McFarlane’s loose, detailed, energetic art alongside Sim’s cartoon realism brush and line work highlights the power of each artist in the pages of this new edition of SPAWN No. 10!

story:
Short Summary

My name is James Mascia, I am an English teacher at a high school in Maryland who is passionate about writing novels and comics for children and teens. I like coming up with new ways to interest young people in reading.

I am working on a project called "The Poe Murders" which is a graphic retelling of many of Edgar Allan Poe's mystery and horror stories meshed into a single tale. The stories included in this graphic-novel are: The Cask of Amontillado, The Tell-Tale Heart, The Masque of the Red Death, The Purloined Letter, The Fall of the House of Usher, The Raven, as well as others.

The graphic-novel will be told in the style of a mystery, in which the characters are searching for the mysterious source causing rational men and women to commit these horrific murders.

It is my hope that by creating this, it will interest young people in some of Poe's tales.

What We Need & What You Get


By funding this project, you will be helping in the creation and production of "The Poe Murders." It will be used to pay the artists for their work on the pages as well as the printing and distribution of the books themselves.

For helping to fund the project, you will recieve:

For a contribution of $2

  • A full-color Edgar Allan Poe wallpaper designed in the style of our cover image

For a Contribution of $5

  • All of the above
  • An e-copy of the completed graphic-novel in PDF
  • Your name listed on the acknowledgments page in the back of the book

For a contribution of $15

  • All of the above
  • A copy of the completed graphic-novel in print

For a contribution of $25

  • All of the above
  • A full-color print of any page you choose from the novel

For a contribution of $50

  • All of the above
  • A print featuring the original character designs for "The Poe Murders"

For a contribution of $75

  • All of the above
  • You will be featured in the background in one scene of the comic
  • The prints you will receive will be of the page your character is on and the character print will be of your character

For a contribution of $100

  • All of the above
  • The exception will be that your character will be featured more prominently in the comic
  • A signed copy of the completed script

For a contribution of $150

  • All of the above
  • Your name will be featured on the title page as a "Producer" of the graphic-novel
Whatever funds we receive for the comic will be used toward paying the artists and creating a great graphic-novel that anyone would be excited to read. Even if we do not make our goal, this is where the funds will be going.

The Impact

Each and every contribution will make a huge difference in getting this graphic-novel produced.

My YA series, High School Heroes has been greatly reviewed and has sold very well. The webcomic of the same series won WeVolt's Lord of the Rumble competition and has also received many great reviews.

This graphic-novel will get just as much inticate attention as my other projects to make it the best it can possible be, but that can only be done with funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, please at the very least "Like" the page, and share on Facebook, Twitter and Google+. Getting the word out there is half the battle and everytime you help share is a great step toward getting that needed contribution.


Thanks all!

story:
Smars is going to AWA (Anime Weekend Atlanta) and needs your help.
I'm an independent comics artists and 2d animator, I currently am artist/writer on 2 weekly titles. Goblyn and Munch Chunky, and I have been invited to attend Anime Weekend Atlanta. The only problem is I'm SOOOOOOOOOPER poor. and can't afford to have stuff to put on my table.
And so I come to you the comics loving community to help me make this comic convention experience a great one for me and for everyone who comes to my table.

For the Convention:

A list of the things I want to make for the convention:

  • 11X17 full colour Prints: Goblyn and Munch Chunky
  • Full colour postcards
  • LOTS an' LOTS of stickers. Full colour and black & white
  • Bookmarks
  • dTPB (digital trade paperbacks) of the entire Goblyn series and Munch Chunky series so far.
  • Materials for building a table display

 

 

The Perks:

All the awesome stuff you can get by contributing.

$5
Goblyn postcard set

Munch chunky postcard set

$10

Postcard bundle                                                                                      all 8 postcards

Goblyn dTPB (book one)

$45

Smarstastic Bundle Black
Goblyn postcard set

Postcard bundle all 8 postcards
Goblyn dTPB bundle (book one & book two)
Munch Chunky dTPB (book one)
Goblyn Dedstar shirt & Munch Chunky Seraphitic heart shirt


 

 

Thank you for checking out my fundraiser. ever little bit counts.

story:
Why You Need Mark Rudolph's Closing Doors:

Mark Rudolph’s Closing Doors is the story of struggling record store owner Elvin Cherry who is torn between the necessities of living in a stark urban landscape where mom and pop stores are quickly becoming a thing of the past and his love of the store that is not only his life’s work but also the hub of a small eccentric community.

Our communities have changed so much in the 21stcentury that many people no longer remember the thrill of digging through dusty crates and high-piled boxes for hidden gold.  We rely more on yelp reviews for guidance than a learned shop owner behind a counter and showcase shop for the best deals instead of indulging in the age old tradition of haggling.    Closing Doors is a love story for everyone who laments the loss of the record store down the block that started your obsession with Stax Records, the newsstand stand on the corner that sold you your first copy of Punk Magazine or local comic shop that showed you that there was more to there was more to funny books than DC vs. Marvel.  

Nix Comics, with its mission to create comics that appeal as much to record and music fans as comic fans, is proud to add Closing Doors to its roster of books.  Mark Rudolph is a truly singular talent and this story strikes all the right chords.

"Mark Rudolph's haunting CLOSING DOORS is a lament for much more than the record store. It's also a eulogy for the locally owned book store, the
corner drug store, the comic book shop, the corner grocers, and every
other small shop that once dotted the streets of our cities and small
towns. These were the businesses that made the places we lived distinct,
and our own.

Rudolph fills his engaging tale with loving detail and the familiar
characters that those of us, who spent more time in such places than we
should have, knew all too well. This is no mere nostalgia trip. CLOSING
DOORS is about the American Dream, when someone with an idea and a work ethic could scrape together a little cash, open a store and make a life.
CLOSING DOORS shows the death of that dream, as the bigboxes and the all-consuming internet sweep over the nation like barcoded Four Horsemen.
Do we even understand what we've lost? Rudolph does."

--Derf Backderf

What Nix Comics Needs to make it happen & what you get:

All funds raised through this crowd funding campaign go directly to printing a limited run of 500 copies of Closing Doors (a 74 page B&W graphic novel), shipping costs and royalties for Mark Rudolph for this print run.  (That's right!  Nix artists always get paid! Up front!)

For a $15 Pledge you'll get a a copy of Closing Doors shipped to your door!  (Please add $10 for overseas shipping)

For a $35 Pledge you'll receive a subscription to the complete Nix Comics 2013 slate of Comics:  Closing Doors, Nix Comics Quarterly #5 and Nix Mini Comix #1 and #2 plus Nix Western Comics #2 (June 2013), Nix Comics for Kids #2 (July 2013) and Nix comics Quarterly #6 (September 2013)... Plus any bonus titles released before December 2013! 

(Please add $30 for overseas shipping… It’s a lot of books!)

For a $60 Pledge you'll get every comic Nix has to offer: A complete set of Nix Comics To Date!  Closing Doors, Nix Comics Quarterly #1-5, Nix Western Comics #1-2 (Including the deluxe Record and comic combo!), Nix Comics for Kids #1-2, Nix Mini Comix #1-2 plus any bonus titles! 

(Please add $40 for overseas shipping… Again, it’s a lot of books!)

ABOUT MARK RUDOLPH

Mark Rudolph is a Detroit cartoonist who works within the framework of heavy metal and caricature. Bringing a sense of humor to a genre of music widely known for it's seriousness, his work combines elements of 60s comics, album cover paintings and political cartoon to magazines, album covers and comics. Drawing from the rich history of comics illustration, his work shrugs off the stereotypical stylings of heavy metal imagery and focuses on the musicians themselves rather than fantasy or gore aesthetics associated with the genre. The grotesqueness is conveyed in the exaggerated human form rather than subject matter of the lyrics and album covers.

Growing up in the 80s, he learned the analog forbearers of digital coloring, art reproduction and printing, which has influenced his digital work to still possess imperfections and the look as if a hand has touched the art. Nearly all of his illustration process is still analog. Ink on paper with minimal digital postproduction. Having a tactile finished piece that relies only on a few simple tools rather than a computer, electricity and software is deeply satisfying in its simplicity for him. Simplicity is what Rudolph is striving toward. 

He's been working in the extreme music underground since the early 90s where he published fanzines, created album covers and co-hosted a podcast about heavy metal.  Combining his love of music and art, Rudolph has recently published Satan is Alive: A tribute to Mercyful Fate which includes prose, comics and illustration by a group of renowned artists and cartoonists. He is currently working on the graphic novel I, Barbarian, the Henry and Glenn Forever and Ever comic series and monthly illustrations for Decibel and Metal hammer magazine. 

ABOUT NIX COMICS

story:
Update 1:

Hey gang! Thank you so much for you support, it really has been overwhelming and humbling to me, and I can’t thank you all enough. What started off as a small fundraiser to get a few books printed has definitely turned into a full-on preorder, and I can’t wait to see my comics in print and get them out to everyone! I’m so excited, just thank you all so so much!

I also want to add that after a lot of thought and consideration, I’ve decided to add in my Memory Lane strips to conclude the series of comics in the book. Those strips highlight a huge part of my life, and I really feel that they are an incredibly important part of my comic as a whole. Not to mention that a big reason I wanted to make those strips was to reach out to people who have gone through something similar, and to let them know they are not alone. It is my hope that by including them in the book that they will reach even more people.

We’re a bit past the halfway point for this fundraiser (21 days left as of this writing), and I sincerely appreciate and thank every one of you for making this possible. <3

About Me

Hey Guys! My name is Christopher Williams, author of a journal comic of the same name called Christopher! I'm 30 years old, and I've been drawing for as long as I can remember, and have had a love of comics for who knows how long. 

My journal comic is about my everyday life, and also about how my wife I handle being a new parents to a toddler (!!). When I started this comic, it was originally made just to announce to our friends and family that my wife and I had gotten pregnant. But I had always wanted to DO a journal comic, so I figured it would also be a good way to keep track of the pregnancy as we went along. Soon afterward I became addicted to making comics, and decided that I would make this comic as long as I possibly can, especially to catalog my son's growth.

Since starting my comic, it has also become a sort of therapy to me. Some of the times that I am at my happiest are when I finish a comic, and know that people are reading it. I've also used it to work out personal issues and stress, and surprisingly to me, it's worked rather well! My comic has essentially become my life on display for everyone to read.

What Is Needed & What You Get

  • About the book

    The book we're making will be perfect bound paperback, and will come in at about 100 pages, featuring the first 250ish comics that I have made, all leading up to his first birthday, including my Memory Lane strips.

I'm looking for about $500 to get a bunch of books printed to sell from my website and at conventions! Any contributions after I have hit my $500 goal will go right back into the comic in the form of more books, other merch, convention fees, and website costs!

Here's a breakdown of what you'll get at each perk level:

  • $1 Newborn

    You get a PDF of the book!

  • $5 The Baby Burrito

    You get a PDF of the book, and your name included in the list of supporters in the book!

  • $6 Teething

    You get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters in the book, and you also get a 1" button!

  • $15 First Steps

    This is essentially the preorder, where you'll receive a signed copy of the book! You will also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!

  • $25 First Words

    You get a signed copy of the book where I'll draw something in it for you! You'll also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!

  • $50 The High Chair

    You will get a signed and drawn in copy of the book, as well as a signed print of a journal strip of your choosing! You will also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!

  • $100 The Booster Seat

    You get a guest appearance in the comic, where I will make up a fun and silly adventure for us! You will also get a signed and drawn in copy of the book, a signed print of a journal strip of your choosing, a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters for the book, and a 1" button!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute but still want to help somehow? You can still help out by spreading the word! You can link friends and family to this IndieGogo campaign with this: http://www.indiegogo.com/christophervolume1 or you can link them to my comic at http://www.christophercomic.com ! Thank you so much for helping out, and LET'S DO THIS!!
story_txt:
Update 1:

Hey gang! Thank you so much for you support, it really has been overwhelming and humbling to me, and I can’t thank you all enough. What started off as a small fundraiser to get a few books printed has definitely turned into a full-on preorder, and I can’t wait to see my comics in print and get them out to everyone! I’m so excited, just thank you all so so much!
I also want to add that after a lot of thought and consideration, I’ve decided to add in my Memory Lane strips to conclude the series of comics in the book. Those strips highlight a huge part of my life, and I really feel that they are an incredibly important part of my comic as a whole. Not to mention that a big reason I wanted to make those strips was to reach out to people who have gone through something similar, and to let them know they are not alone. It is my hope that by including them in the book that they will reach even more people.
We’re a bit past the halfway point for this fundraiser (21 days left as of this writing), and I sincerely appreciate and thank every one of you for making this possible. <3

About Me
Hey Guys! My name is Christopher Williams, author of a journal comic of the same name called Christopher! I'm 30 years old, and I've been drawing for as long as I can remember, and have had a love of comics for who knows how long. 
My journal comic is about my everyday life, and also about how my wife I handle being a new parents to a toddler (!!). When I started this comic, it was originally made just to announce to our friends and family that my wife and I had gotten pregnant. But I had always wanted to DO a journal comic, so I figured it would also be a good way to keep track of the pregnancy as we went along. Soon afterward I became addicted to making comics, and decided that I would make this comic as long as I possibly can, especially to catalog my son's growth.
Since starting my comic, it has also become a sort of therapy to me. Some of the times that I am at my happiest are when I finish a comic, and know that people are reading it. I've also used it to work out personal issues and stress, and surprisingly to me, it's worked rather well! My comic has essentially become my life on display for everyone to read.



What Is Needed & What You Get


About the book
The book we're making will be perfect bound paperback, and will come in at about 100 pages, featuring the first 250ish comics that I have made, all leading up to his first birthday, including my Memory Lane strips.


I'm looking for about $500 to get a bunch of books printed to sell from my website and at conventions! Any contributions after I have hit my $500 goal will go right back into the comic in the form of more books, other merch, convention fees, and website costs!
Here's a breakdown of what you'll get at each perk level:



$1 Newborn
You get a PDF of the book!



$5 The Baby Burrito
You get a PDF of the book, and your name included in the list of supporters in the book!



$6 Teething
You get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters in the book, and you also get a 1" button!



$15 First Steps
This is essentially the preorder, where you'll receive a signed copy of the book! You will also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!



$25 First Words
You get a signed copy of the book where I'll draw something in it for you! You'll also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!



$50 The High Chair
You will get a signed and drawn in copy of the book, as well as a signed print of a journal strip of your choosing! You will also get a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters, and a 1" button!



$100 The Booster Seat
You get a guest appearance in the comic, where I will make up a fun and silly adventure for us! You will also get a signed and drawn in copy of the book, a signed print of a journal strip of your choosing, a PDF of the book, your name included in the list of supporters for the book, and a 1" button!







Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute but still want to help somehow? You can still help out by spreading the word! You can link friends and family to this IndieGogo campaign with this: http://www.indiegogo.com/christophervolume1 or you can link them to my comic at http://www.christophercomic.com ! Thank you so much for helping out, and LET'S DO THIS!!

story:
The Story

Vestri 2 is a continued comic series based in the world of Vestri as we follow the last issues event surrounding a hard ass monster hunter Damyn who has found himself being tasked by the peculiar Steward Alimander to travel to the abandoned island known as Omrydell. Our Hero has his own tragic history with this island which torments his dreams.

Vestri 2 takes place directly after the previous issue. Damyn has cleared a mysterious castle in the ruins of Omrydell and stumbled across a rather suspicious crystal shard. Damyn could not comprehend what came next, an Elven woman named Elle emerges from the shard in a panic. Something has followed her to the realm of Vestri. How is our Hero going to handle this new threat? Who is this Elven woman? And how does this tie into Damyn’s past? Well you are going to have to read our upcoming issues to find out. As our story continues, there will be many reveals and twists.

Art by  Sashi Perdigao

 

Cover by Jakub Sebesta

We pride ourselves on having every single of Vestri 100% completed before we launch which means all we have to do is go to print. We also like to keep prices as low as we can, but we like to keep a low number of tiers. Our book/tiers include:

  • Vestri #2, 26 pages of story. Front cover by Jakub Sebesta and back cover by Sashi Perdgao.
  • Yes we got an art piece by Sashi who has done work for Kamen America, Jawbreakers, Rags, Lair, Saving the World and so many more!
  • A reprint of Vestri #1, 21 pages of story, 3 more pages of art by Jakub Sebesta.
  • Ashcan #2, 10 pages of story cover by Jakub Sebesta.

 

The Team:

  • Created by Jakub Sebesta and Dylan Clarke
  • Art and Letters by Jakub Sebesta
  • Written by Dylan Clarke
  • Printed and Fulfilled in the USA!
  • Distributed by Comic Sense Distribution

 

INFO REGARDING FULFILLMENT:

It is our personal mission to fulfil on time, which we did for Vestri #1. Our digital PDF’S will be emailed as the physical book ships or sooner. We will resend links if you have not received them.

story:
What is Ahura?


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BDO6r3QvKLg

Trailer from above:

https://youtu.be/aXx54hQeAF8


Short Summary

Ahura is a web serial with a vast array of comic/graphic elements. It is inspired by a Japanese story telling device by which personal characteristics are present in the fictional world as a sort of super power or pseudo-science. The first book focuses primarily on the subject of emotional and anxiety disorders, but branches into other subjects such as abuse, suicide, rape, and humanity in general. It is both packed with action as it is philosophically touching, and has been the object of at least three years of work.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make Ahura a reality, we need a bare minimum of $455 for domain hosting and copyright registration, but due to the rather dated nature of our equipment, we would like an additional $1,600 for things like improved sketch tablets, materials for backer rewards and other merchandise,  and computers that are not in constant danger of crashing. If we are able to meet our goal and ultimately release Ahura online for reading with (at least) weekly updates, then it will be available online for your viewing anytime. Plus, we will hopefully create a store for the site using Society6, and other sources, where you will be able to buy merchandise based on the story world. In addition to merchandise that will be available for purchase, we hope to include backer rewards. The rewards we are hoping to produce include your avatar featured on the story website, Demon of Sprucia Revolution Masks, and possibly prop replicas of the Crest of Teyocanni.



The Impact

I feel I should be honest and state that our financial situations are not the best. The equipment we have to work with has either been purchased a long time ago, so it is on the verge of breaking, or left over from college which may be subject to similar risks. This project will both aid us in supporting our families as well as making an artistic statement that is very near to our hearts.

(Design concepts of Mitsuuchi Yo)

The story of the first book follows a man named Mitsuuchi Yo in his quest to rescue his wife in a land of bizarre sciences, political corruption, and a crazed demon whose intentions, while undeniably cruel, are never quite clear. Along the way, he encounters a number of allies and foes, and as Mitsuuchi struggles to help his new found friends amid the chaos, he must also maintain his sanity as his own inner demons threaten to devour his soul.

The tale is an allegory for dealing with certain emotional disorders, as well as dealing with others who have them.

(Map of North America as per the time period of Ahura)

The world of Ahura is a near-distant future where magic and science are used synonymously, and the United States of America has long since been broken into several independent countries with their own respective shadows of American culture. (Example: Amerigo, a rather peaceful land which is more or less America as it is today. Montania, a dystopian federation that embodies all the evil that American politics stands to succumb to.)

The artistic style of the tale is heavily inspired by Japanese anime/manga, and the story's imagery borrows from a number of various religions and folklore including Japanese, Mayan, Australian Aborigines, North American Tribal Culture, and much more. I am currently overseeing the illustrations personally, but as the project grows, I hope to include illustrations from a separate artist.

We also hope to eventually incorporate audio book style readings into the chapter pages, but the first priority will be getting the serial itself produced.




Risks & Challenges

As stated before, our finances are somewhat limited. So with our day jobs, this makes finding time to work on illustrations difficult. Our original intention was to release Ahura (First book title: Alali) as a physical book via a publishing agent. However, due to the highly detailed nature of our illustrations and hectic work schedules, the images were being produced slower than we had hoped. Thus, we decided to skip to our Plan B: The Web Serial. Once the site is up, readers will be able to read the finished chapters while we work on the next set, but we need money to make it happen. The bare necessities are the website and the copyright, but we need the extra to make sure we have something extra to give back to the readers and supporters. Then there is also the matter of our equipment. One of the computers we use is a Dell Inspiron that was purchased as a floor model close over three years ago. Just recently it came close to suffering a memory failure preventing me from working on the site and its assets. If we are able to meet our goal, we will be able to purchase updated equipment to ensure that we are delivering the best quality product we can, and all funds left over will go towards progressing the project in other ways such as merchandise, translation, extended hosting, etc.


Milestones

These milestones mark the progress and prospective benefits of certain amounts.

$55 - Copyright registration. (MET)

$200 - One year domain hosting from WIX. If met, we will link the website to donators for early access. (MET)

$400 - Second year domain hosting from WIX. (MET)

$1000 - Improved storage devices for site assets.

$2000 - Improved equipment and possibly better illustrations for the website.



Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a high dollar contribution, visit our Society6 page and take a look at some of our preliminary merchandise. For more information, drop us a line at ahurabooks@gmail.com

https://society6.com/artofahurabooks

https://society6.com/boneheadillustrations

https://society6.com/landonoberg

http://ahuraweb.tumblr.com/

https://www.patreon.com/user?u=2297177&ty=h&u=2297177

Donation Perks

With us being a rather small operation, and sorting out the funding of the project itself, deciding upon perks has been difficult, BUT below are some descriptions of cool items you can get if you donate to Ahura.

Chosen Value Below $30- While certain donation packages will yield gift rewards, you do not have to donate that much. I intend to post a list of all backers in the "thanks" page when it is complete.

$30- The demon masks will be made out of cotton so that they are breathable. The masks will ideally be one-size-fits-all, but this may be subject to change.


(Models: Stephanie Morales, depicting character Adila Adira; Jake LaCroix)
$50-
The Regulatory Order perk gets you a Montanian propaganda poster. The image below is a rough draft of the final product. Your copy will be cleaned up and with some added deatails. It will be 24x18 inches in size.

(Model: Stephanie Morales, depicting character Adila Adira)

$150-
The seal of the demon is an approximately 8-inch wide plate of clay symbolic of the seal of the Demon that abducts Alali. On the back of the crest is a message, but will yours depict the message of Mitsuuchi, or something unique to your copy? (MYSTERY) It will hopefully be glazed and pigmented to have an ethereal purple tint. You can see the seal again in the picture above of Teril with her father.

(Bellow are a pair of variant prototypes. The second is the work of one Erin Compton. More photos to follow soon)

 

(Below: Recent prototype. I decided to combine the two into a hybrid.)
